The knish was fine; I've had their meat and potato knishes before and thought I'd try the spinach (the others are better). But the whitefish salad was great. It reminded me of the fish dip at Ted Peters Famous Smoked Fish in St. Petersburg, Florida, and I ate it as such: like a spread on crackers (which I had at the house). Not sure if you can eat it this way if you dine in, but I bet you could ask for some crackers and serve yourself up some tasty Vegas fish dip!

Next time, I'll double up on the whitefish and skip the knish. In fact, I'm craving that whitefish now ... See you soon, Bagel Cafe!

The bagels here are dense and filling, and their cream cheese makes it that much better. From blueberry cream cheese to the one with chives, they are all flavorful. In addition, I had their pastrami omelette and it was filled with a ton of pastrami and was delicious!

Had my sons 6th birthday cake made here & it was delicious! It was a fantastic display, just what I was looking for. You know you have an incredible cake when all the parents eat some too! Will definitely order cakes here when I need them!

This place has always had tasty food but the service lately has just been worse than bad... I went to get 2 breakfast sandwiches and they messed up the order and put bacon instead of sausage. Oh well I got over it. The following day I went to try and get the correct sandwiches and they still messed up my order!! Didn't even put any meat on it this time. It's disappointing because I did like this cafe and I realize they are busy but both time were very simple orders...

Sooooooo good!!! The bagels, the breakfast, lunch, bakery and staff are great! I've been eating here since I was a little kid and my parents used to take me all the time. Now, in 26 years old and I still go there. In fact, I took my now fiancé of 4 years there for our first lunch date nearly 4 years ago! She's obsessed with it now too! Go get a bagel and cream cheese, some fresh lox, or some incredible marble pound cake, or they're awesome cheese danish... Omg. Great. Now I'm hungry..... :) 
My mom used to know the owners back when they were still here and she could tell you where certain realtors would come in and sit at the counter on which days and she'd be right. Lol 
Those were the days.... They've had some changes, but they're still awesome! Makes me happy to claim my Jewish half

True East Coast bagels in Vegas.  Amazing.

Pastries are great, sandwiches are flawless.

Always packed on Sunday mornings, which only makes it more fun.

You can't go wrong here!

First time here. I was surprised at how big it was inside. It was very busy, but our wait was not that bad. 
Our server was sweet. She checked on us often and my drink was always filled. 
The bagel chips & sweet dip was a nice free appetizer while we waited for our lunch. 
I tried the Pot Pie! It was yummy! 
I will definitely be back to try some of their pastries. They all looked great!

As a young Jewish girl living in Vegas, I grew up eating Bagle cafe with my family. My father gets the challla for Shabbat every Friday from this place and religiously get breakfast here because it's so addicting. Not only is the food incredible and worth the price (not to mention the drooling desserts), but I always feel welcomed and the staff is always on top of it. It truly feels like a little slice of New York and home.

I had hoped service here had improved since our last visit, but after today, I am convinced this subpar service must be the norm for the place. Owner even messaged after the last review, so really hoped it had improved. But just as a frame of reference, I typed most of this review out while waiting for our server to just check on us to see if everything was ok(that's how long she was taking).

Arrived on a busy Sunday brunch, so we more than expected to wait a little. After being seated at the table, it took 15 minutes just to get drinks. Then another 15 minutes to have our order taken. Waited 20 minutes to get food, only to have it delivered to the table with things missing, like butter for pancakes. Also discovered our table had zero utensils set out for a party of 5.

Waitress scuttles away so fast that we could barely tell her what we needed, so more waiting. 

Usually I love the food for its authentic Jewish fare. Today, I ordered the potato pancakes. Huge, thick portion of 3 pancakes but served with the tiniest serving of sour cream and applesauce. I would expect the $10 cost could cover a bit more condiment with the dish. The patties are so dry that you need something to balance it, but the scale does not fit what they serve. Also took forever to flag the waitress down for this to get a little more.

I should have stuck with my original assessment and just stop in to the deli to get my fix of NY food.
Extremely good bagels. Purchased a dozen and a half for a company meeting.  There was a mad dash for the bags when I entered  the office.

For years now this is my Togo place whenever I'm not feeling so great or just miss home. Their matza ball soap is my favorite thing on the menu. It's so reach with flavors and perfectly done. Over the weekend they have long lines but the great service and good food is really worth it. One more thing the cakes are to die for lol my favorite is the cheesecake :) enjoy

They have sturgeon and it is always fresh and delicious. 

I've never had a bad time here or had anything I didnt like. 

My favorite: fish platter for two, sturgeon and nova.

American style breakfasts. Jewish deli sammies. Soup: very good. The restaurant stays busy and that makes for always fresh foods. 

This is the place for Jewish Bakery in LV. Cookies, cakes. Yum!
YUMMY! This place is so good. Definitely make time to get some food here. We came three days in a row for breakfast. It's that good!

This is one of my all time favorites and a true staple in the Las Vegas community. There is nothing better in my opinion than grabbing a cup of matzoh ball soup and a half sandwich from bagel cafe.

The only thing that I don't like about this place is the face that there can sometimes be an extremely long wait when attempting to pick up food from the deli counter. 

As for recommendations: the pastrami on rye is killer, as mentioned before, the matzoh ball soup is unreal, and the black and white cookies will change your life.

I love the bagel cafe, and I'm sure you will too!
Sandwich was just okay, potato salad sucked. None of it was worth 15.00 next time I go somewhere else

Sorry this restaurant does not allow me to protect my family. As a legal gun owner I am not a felon or a domestic abuser. I can't say the same for the person sitting next table over. This is sad because my wife loved your food but now that we know we are not welcome we will eat at another place that welcomes us.

Wow - how can you NOT love Bagel Cafe?! Watch out for the huge portions! We had the soup & half sandwich combo and when I ordered my chicken salad on a bagel, they brought me a whole sandwich anyway! GREAT matzo ball soup! Service very good. My husbands from Brooklyn and he says this is a legit NY Deli. Will come here monthly!

Bad customer service when ordering for delivery. They didn't deliver my full order and when I called them they were not helpful and just put me on hold.  Didn't give me a refund - just claimed that my food was there. Why would I waste my time calling them in my Saturday if my food was there?

This has become a favorite of mine while living here. I have recommended it as on off strip stop for friends as well. They have loved it. 

The inside reminds me of being in New York at times due to the amount of people inside. 
The wall of bagels and tubs of smear are overwhelming. You name it, they have it. I'm so in love with the Nova it's not even funny.  

They have a very extensive bakery case. I can't even explain the yumminess! Tarts, cookies, cakes, cinnamon rolls. Oh my. 

The deli options are amazing as well. I have not eaten at the restaurant but the menu looks appetizing and the place is always full!!

Heard so much about the crab eggs Benedict that I just had to try it. I drove from Chinatown all the way to the bagel cafe on buffalo just to try this much recommended plate. 
 Monday  2:00 pm the place wasn't busy, went in right away and sat myself, place looks very nice and clean. The menu is in a newspaper form, very nice but I prefer the ones with color pictures. (need glasses)
Waitress came over ( very nice by the way) offered me drinks and asked me if I needed few minutes to decide on my meal.
Oh no thank you!  I know exactly what I want! I'll have the crab eggs Benedict that I heard so much of! Drove all the way here just for that, can't wait to try them! Ah, with extra sauce please.
-" sorry we don't have that right now " 
                                                                     (and that's how you lose a star)
I've had a lot of pastrami in my life, and theirs ranks right up there at the top. The lox plate is an excellent appetizer for the table as well. Love this spot!

Not impressed !   The desserts in the bakery side looked delicious upon walking into the restaurant!

My bagel was NOT a real New York style bagel, but had the taste of a cheap bland bagel (and it was an everything bagel)   Very Very disappointing!    Had the pastrami sandwich, was pathetic in size to any pastrami sandwich I ever got in a New York Delicatessen...and to top off my bad meal was 2 pickles that tasted rotten -- verified by my other eating partners!  Will NOT be back -- especially at the prices they charge !

I'm a New Yorker, born and raised on the likes of Rattner's in the East Village and transplanted here. There is no "great" deli food. Give me a bagel (a bagel's not a bagel unless it's a bagel. If you're from NY, you know what I'm talking about. The Bagel Cafe has BAGELS. Unfortunately, it like most others now has stepped into the non-traditional, with chocolate chip, blueberry and other flavored circles of dough which are most assuredly not bagels, but muffins. They don't count. Anyone who eats 'em out to go to Freeds and buy cupcakes.

A good plain, egg, sesame everything, poppy seed and sesame seed bagel is what the Bagel Cafe has along with a variety of cream cheeses and great lox. It purveys pastrami sandwiches that are every bit as good and as large (I buy halfs) as New York -- and they all have the right amount of fat. Similary so for corned beef. Of course you can order them "lean," but what's that about. That's just fake deli meat -- After all, ya gotta die of something and my motto, one of the anyway, is that I don't want to die with a tuna sandwich in my hand.

Give this place a go, a regular go -- It has great baked goods as well, fresh.

Horrible experience at take out. Been going there for years, but today I couldn't have my order my way. Counter man told me if I got what I wanted he would get written up. Consulted with manager, who recognized me as a customer.  No one interested in fixing it. WENT ELSEWHERE.  YOU SHOULD TOO!

Best NY style Deli and restaurant in town! The Chicken soup with Matso ball is the best. For breakfast any of the bagel plates and fish are recommended and the desserts are first rate! Love the home made Corned Beef Hash for breakfast and their fresh ground coffee puts Starbucks to shame!

I love this place and have been coming here since I was a child. However, my latest concern is placing an order ahead of time or paying ahead of time for a take out order. I only get a short period of time for my lunch break. It's hard to come here and get out on time to make it back to work. They should really look into letting people place orders over the phone and paying up front for their orders.

This is a typical New York deli plopped into northwest Las Vegas. They provide large portions... with large attitudes and prices to go with them. I find the bagels at other bagel shops (like Einstein Bagels) more flavorful and less gummy and I was not impressed with the black cookie I received with my order. The bakery items in the cakes and specialty item case looked really tasty. I also saw they had halvah, not commonly available in Vegas.

The schmear was terrific (I had the low-fat veggie) and the vegetables on my asiago bagel were fresh. The pickle was so fresh that it tasted much more like salty cucumber than pickle. My meal came with chips. When I asked to change the plain chips for another flavor of the same brand and size, I was told: "This is what comes with the meal."

The service is typical New York--they weren't mean, but they certainly won't go out of their ways to greet you with a smile or make you feel comfortable.
BEST bagels on the West Coast, I kid you not. I literally thought I was back home in NY. Staff exceptional, service A+. Wish I had taken a dozen home.
I am totally hooked on the chicken salad.  OMG - the absolute best!
Just average nothing great you can get the same food in any bar around town except bagels you can get those fresh at smiths if your hungry and have no other choice here's your place

This is my every Sunday go to place for breakfast. I wouldn't know about anything but the cinnamon French Toast. You can only get it on the weekends!!
For lunch, the pastrami and corned beef are the best!

I had surgery and can only eat child portion on restaurant menus. I have a doctors note to explain this and although restaurant have no obligation to accept it I feel that those who don't are more concerned with their profits than honoring a valid medical request from  paying customer. I  Have ordered sides and appetizers from here in the past & I end up still eating too much & being sick.  We got the manager involved and he also wouldn't accommodate my dietary restrictions. I feel bad that I wasn't accommodated. I ended up not order anything. Bagel cafe left me with a sour taste. In these days where dogs and cats are allowed in restaurants, not to accommodate a customer with a valid medical note and dietary restriction is bad business. I don't feel like a "valued customer".  I won't be returning. There's Lots of restaurants in town that will respect my personal health issues and will see me as a person and not a dollar sign.
Amazing food and the service was top notch. I had the nova lox and a dozen bagels to go. My husband is from NYC and this is as close to their deli as you can get. Highly recommended!

Whenever we are in VEGAS The Bagel Cafe has the best breakfast and lunch!
LARGE PORTIONS and the Bakery Is Delicious and everything is oversized.
Red Velvet Twinkies are sooooo good.
It is a must try in VEGAS.

I came here yesterday and it was a seat yourself situation. Service was quick and they brought over a sample of their pumpkin cream cheese. The cream cheese was good but not enough to make me want to order it.

I ordered one egg with bacon, homefries, and an Asiago bagel. The bagel was good but tasted more like a plain bagel than Asiago. The bacon wasn't great and I didn't like the homefries much.

Overall, i'd only recommend coming here for a bagel. They have tons of flavors.
We had bagel breakfast sandwiches and they were super good! The carrot cake cream cheese of the month was very good!

No better breakfast spot in vegas hands down. The bagels are the best in town. The cabbage soup on Mondays is the real deal. The sandwhichs are stacked and will not leave you disappointed. Service is good for the most part. Last but not least their deserts are absolutely deadly.

Really good bagels and a nice atmosphere.

I passed this place by for years thinking it was basically just an einstein's, and I am glad to discover it has a full dining room.

The food is good, standard breakfast fare, but featuring their authentic bagels. Lunch includes deli selections straight from New York.

Prices are a little high, and only open during breakfast hours, I would love it if they stayed open all night.
I can honestly say I'll always  be a customer. There so amazing. They had me feeling like a kid in a candy shop. It's a definite must try if u haven't.

First time in this place, I haven't seen a deli here in Vegas that quite looks like NY deli. I ordered toasted bialys and my friends got a bagel and it was good. I did not try the hash brown. I asked for over medium egg and it came over easy. The Canadian bacon was 3 pieces as thin as a dime. They have an array of desserts and the menu is quite extensive. It's good for a try. I may come back again and try other food. Being a local New Yorker, this place is average.

I have been coming here forever! I come get bagel breakfast sandwiches before class ;-) The best deli and restaurant on the west side. Mark said it was the best french dip sandwich he had ever eaten. ever.

This is one of my all time favorite Sunday morning breakfast places! I love the omelets and bagels that they have here, get the garlic cheddar cream cheese it is great on all the bagels! well maybe not the raisin one but hey, give it a try anyway!!

Be sure to leave room in your carry on. I can't come to Las Vegas without a stop at the Bagel Cafe. Their food is amazing. By far the best bagel I've ever had. The fresh squeezed orange juice is fabulous and their lox platter is to write home about. They are extremely generous with their portions.  The cinnamon walnut cream cheese is out of this world.

This place is a hidden gem. Not very convenient for me and in a medical complex. But the food is worth every bit of the commute!! To start, the fresh squeezed orange juice (chilled) is so refreshing. Each table is given some bagel chips and choice cream cheese to enjoy while ordering. The menu is very large, which is expected for a place like this. Today, I enjoyed the western omelette with home potatoes and a side bagel. The omelette was large and full of meat and veggies!! The potatoes were perfectly cooked! But the highlight of the meal, was what my father ordered..... the almighty fruit and granola yogurt parfait!! This parfait was hand crafted with a lot of love! It was over flowing with fresh fruit (apples, bananas, strawberries, blackberries, raspberries, mango, kiwi)!! You must see the picture to fully understand the beauty involved!! I can't wait to go back and enjoy one of these on my own! A+++++

My rating is based on service alone. The waitress was nice, so that is why I am giving two stars instead of one. I had to wait almost 15 minutes to order, after my waitress disappeared. Considering the location is in a business complex, I would assume many people come here between appointments or on lunch breaks, so ordering in a timely manner would be appreciated by many. 

Once my food finally arrived, the Philly cheesesteak has peppers on it even though I ordered it without. It didn't have the side of mayo I ordered either. I did not have time to wait for a new sandwich to be made, so I couldn't have lunch. It seemed odd that such a simple order wasn't fulfilled. I was really looking forward to trying this place because the decorations were cute and I expected a NY restaurant to have good food.

I do like this place but if my friends were not planning to go here, I do not think it would be my first choice for lunch or breakfast.

Been here a few times before, got seated quickly with a party of 6. Took a little bit to order but that was okay as at least we were given our drinks. I ordered a bagel breakfast sandwich with cheese and one egg, and some breakfast potatoes. Both were alright, not the best, but it left me satiated. 

My crazy boyfriend however, had the LARGEST slice of tiramisu cake I have ever seen in my life. I thought it was the entire cake. He downed that thing like a champ! I didn't take a bite but it sure looked good!

Overall this cafe is alright - not my favorite, but I don't oppose to it either. Kind of limited selection for vegetarians which is why for me it is one way or the other. I will have to come in some other time to grab some black and white cookies from their bakery, as their desserts seem to be more mouth-watering than their other goods. Maybe I'll find something yummier next time.
Lunch today was busy as usual, service was good, food was fresh. I feel like it was just thrown together though rather than treating it like an art or craft. Then again, this is also just a cafe.

The service and the food has gone so downhill lately. Used to be so much better. We complained to the guy who said he was the manager and his name was Jerry. He just stood there and laughed at us. I guess when you do so much business you don't need to care about your customers or in this case ex customers. I wish yelp would allow negative stars.

I think they're food is great!
Service is slow, almost everytime 
And the waiters don't pay much attention to their customers besides dropping off the food and check.
The coffee there is awful! 
No taste at all and extremely watery. 
If they bought another coffee brand& trained their staff to multitask and be more efficient I would come more often.

So the one previous time I have been here my bf and I ordered breakfast bagel sandwiches to go at the counter. Which were HUGE and delicious (from what I remember anyway). I must admit, I think it's pretty cool how they've got the bagel display and other treats set up. It's just a comfy cozy kinda feeling to me. 

Last time we came it was mid morning and this place was p a c k e d! So this morning we opted to go about 7:30a just after they open to avoid the crowd; and we did just that. We were invited to seat ourselves when we walked in and immediately upon seating we were greeted and asked for our drink order. This was a good start and excited me because after our recent trip to PR I was glad to get great and quick customer service at a home town restaurant. 

I ordered the spinach and feta cheese omlet (added tomato); it came with home fries and a bagel with cream cheese. The bagel I loved. The home fries were ok. In the omlet they used fresh spinach which was great, I hate when restaurants use frozen or canned crap. Other than that I didn't really care for the omlet; I'm super picky with eggs and the eggs in this omlet were dry like over cooked, & it had browning on the outside of it which to me is disgusting. My bf had a bagels and lox; he loved it, just like he loves everything. 

The reason I give this place a 3 is because the food here just did not knock my socks off AND because they charged $4.50 for an orange juice, really? After we left I made the bf go around back and see if there was an orange tree back there because that's the only reason I can justify paying that much for a glass of juice, is if the tree is in the back growing those damn things and picked fresh daily. Lo and behold, there was no tree. I'm willing to give another try though sometime in the future. Their service though is definitely a 5 stars; from the friendliness of our waitress to how quick the food came out (under 10 min).

Great breakfast place, I would recommend to come here early in the morning if it gets past 9 AM on a sunday or Saturday the place is packed. The bagel is the best in Las Vegas the prices are good based on the quality and quantity of the food being served. Make sure to come here HUNGRY otherwise you have to bring the food home. My daughter  gets her chicken fingers and the servings are enormous enough for an Adult Large Meal.  The service is good , although due to the amount of people the service degrades a bit which is completely understandable. If your looking for  A Simple breakfast with good quality and quantity this place would be it.

Yum! Great menu, lots of choices. The sandwiches are giant like a deli sandwich should be. I'm anxious to go back and have a breakfast there :) The bagels are awesome, like bagels are supposed to be....nice, dense and with great flavor. Will definitely come back to this place for more bagel sandwich goodness!!

Bagels, bagels and more bagels...which I do not eat anymore.  I do however enjoy watching everyone enjoy them and say how good they are.

Bagels are not the only thing on the menu.  I can only vouch for breakfast of which they do all manner of breakfast food.

The service is friendly and quick on the coffee refills.  

TBC is a great place to enjoy the most important meal of the day.

Ordered two lean corned beef sandwiches to bring home to ill parents.  Corned beef was very fatty--not lean.  We were in no position to return them to the Bagel Cafe but would have if we could.  Instead we tried to pull the fat off of the corned beef and it was an expensive lesson.  Disappointing.

Always consistent with great food and service... Definitely recommend this place... I hit it every chance I get when I'm in Las Vegas. Recommend the pastrami corned beef all of their Breads and desserts are awesome.

hi,  place posts own fake good reviews, this is a REAL review from a REAL person
:
this  is the worst restaurant i have been to in las vegas, first: their baked goods are old and hard ! they buy their bagels frozen and defrost them ( i saw the bag).
the food is awful, . we ordered brisket sandwich, potato salad, chicken soup, salmon platter, pastrami sandwich, hamburger with cole slaw (the hamburger was immediately sent back it was hard and flat as a hockey puck :  (    cole slaw was gross and slimy, ... the sandwiches were tasteless
the pastrami : not edible, the soup was cold and from a can, the potato salad came from a plastic tub. they are making nothing homemade as they "claim", the salmon was a salmon substitute ( very gummy after one bite, i was afraid to eat anymore in a chance i would become ill).. all of their food is frozen and microwaved.go buy a frozen sandwich, microwave it thats what our disgusting sandwiches tasted like for quadruple the price!!.. the waitress told me and rolled her eyes, she also told us she found a new waitress job because they have to tell customers food is homemade when nothing is made there and she did not want to lie to customers. i repeat DO NOT WASTE YOUR MONEY HERE

TLDR: The namesake bagels are surprisingly well done here: large, fluffy, and great with lox and/or their cream cheese- the green onion is my favorite, and they're all made in house. The matzo ball soup (better than the version at Weiss) and thick-ass pastrami sandwiches are also pretty great. 

2 ounce lox plate with a spinach and feta bagel and cheddar-garlic cream cheese: not a combo I'd normally opt for, but somehow it all really worked together- the fish was fresh and silky and plentiful, the bagel toasty and chewy, the schmear chunky with cheese and fragrant with garlic. Everything was plated beautifully too, a leaf of lettuce under all of the thick slices of tomato and red onion, a russian pickle, several slices of cucumber, and a handful of olives, too.

I peeked in the pastry case "just for a look"- and walked out with a "small" black and white, that was easily the size of my hand. Great cookie, overly sweet frosting. My BF samples a different cake each visit and hasn't yet found anything he dislikes.

ETA: Pizza bagels (particularly the fresh spinach and feta) are divine, especially on the garlic bagel;  the tongue sandwich is also light and silky and delicious.

The best bagel and veggie snear I've had. This place was amazing!!! The bagel was light yet full of flavor. This place is worth a 30min drive just for one bagel. I will be sure to visit this place next time I fly to Vegas.

Great east-coast style deli in an unsuspecting location.  I've just been once, but the bagels and coffee were excellent, especially the bagels.  There's a big bakery and an extensive lunch & dinner menu.  My potatoes were cold, but that's my only complaint.

Sadly this place is brought down by terrible customer service and inconsistent take out. Seems like it gets worse every time I give them a try. It's too bad because the bagels are fantastic when the order is put together correctly.

FOOD:  5 Stars -- Their deli and restaurant food is killer delicious,
LOCATION:  3 Stars -- A little dicey to find and parking at the busy times of the day.
ATMOSPHERE: 4 Stars
PRICE: $$  (2 bagels and coffees were $14)
SERVICE:  NO Stars -- It Sucks!  Surly wait-staff.  No greeting when I came in. No one cared if I lived or died. Today (02/19/2013) was the last straw. I found two flyers/notices that had fallen off their door (and were laying at the door step), brought them in, and tried to get someone to notice me so I could give them the signs.  After 7 (SEVEN!) minutes of watching four people who blatantly ignored me, I threw the signs in the trash.  If you're not a "regular", you (apparently) are crap to them.  I couldn't even get someone behind the counter to notice me when I tried to buy some pastries.  Wow. They must be resting on their laurels and believing this is how to treat newcomers.  No wonder they can't grow.
Love this place, been here multiple times only reason it didn't get five stars is a few times the for was warm and not hot.

This is an amazing spot for brunch. The food is pretty basic, but still very good. They have a way of taking the standard deli fare and transforming it into something exceptionally delicious. I usually get the egg sandwich with cheese on an everything bagel, which I can highly recommend.

Prices are very reasonable.
The best breakfast spot in vegas! Been going for years and the food quality hasn't changed one bit ! I Always get the make your own bagel sandwich. The prices are so cheap!

The number of bagel places in Las Vegas is very limited. This is probably the closest I have had to a true New York style bagel. It's certainly not the best bagel I've ever had but it is certainly the best bagel I have ever had in Vegas. They had an excellent cream cheese selection with approximately 11 different varieties including light options. Cream cheese flavoRS where traditional veggie, scallion, locks, and a rotating flavor of the month. We had their jalapeño cheddar bagel, asiago bagel, plain bagel, and Sun dried tomato. We had the bagels toasted. The bagels had a nice chew and crunch. Forfour bagels with two of them having specialty cream cheese we spent $10.

Their CRAB CAKE BENEDICT was the bomb!

It came with jumbo lump crab meat as advertised in the menu, and it was sooo delicious. I don't appreciate the Hollandaise sauce that much, but it was also outstanding.

The fresh veggie omelet came with spinach, tomato, onion, mushrooms and bell peppers - was good but not as impressive as the bennie.

And the bagel - came with the nova cream cheese (mixed with smoked salmon) and it was great.

The place was packed on Saturday Morning which is a positive sign. But I was not over the top impressed.   

The menu is cleverly done on a newspaper and it took us quite a while to decide due to so many choices. 

I ordered their Matzo Ball Soup which was pretty good, and my hubby ordered an Everything Bagel with Nova Spread, Potato Pancake, and a Knish which we didn't care for too much. Since the soup came with a bagel, I decided to try a Cinnamon-Raisin Bagel with Cinnamon-Raisin spread which was quite good.

The French Toast was something we had to try after hearing good things, but that too was just so-so. Maybe we'll give the bakery items a try if and when we return.

When it comes to being the best Jewish Deli  in town... This place is definitely- HANDS DOWN! They have the best rugelach! I love their Tongue Sandwich- I barely chew it! Matzo Ball soup, my all-time favorite!

Never leave without getting something from the pastry counter. 1 pastry itself is good enough to feed 2-3 people!

I absolutely love this place! My other half and family are all from NY and think that the Bagel Cafe has the best deli in Las Vegas. We have even gone so far as to wonder if they are bringing water in from NY! Bagels are fantastic... Matzo wonderful! Everything is delicious! Customer service is so so...But who cares because the food is great:) they would be five star if the cashiers were polite.

Best bagels in town - I know because I searched high and low.  This place has the feel of a neighborhood diner and Jewish deli wrapped in one.  No skimping on the schmear here.  I get the everything with veggie cream cheese, and if I am hungover I have a bacon, egg, and swiss on sesame.  Then I eat celery for a week and feel self loathing.  

It's in the middle of a non descript commercial strip mall in Summerlin, but I come from downtown and run into people from my building here.  Fresh, yummy bagels.  It's not NYC 5 star bagels, but its the best I've tasted outside the 5 boroughs.

The Bagel Cafe is one of my favorite breakfast places! & one of the first places id recommend for breakfast. Located in a strip of office buildings that is visible on Buffalo. It can get pretty busy, but that is because it is soo good! Parking lot is pretty congested since they do share with other offices.They have a bakery as well, great baked goods. Traditional breakfast, they also have lunch items on their menu. Orange juice is freshly squeezed. Cream cheese is home made, delicious flavors! Staff is so kind & timely. Definitely check this place out!

Originally this place was going to be a 5 star for me. The place has a great ambiance with a nice sitting area. Looks like a great homestyle diner. Super excited, I ordered a pastrami ruben on rye. It took about 30 minutes for the to-go order to come out, which was a bit disappointing. That's ok I guess, but when I finally got down to try the rye, it was flavorless. That's ok again I guess. There's only one thing though, that really really bothered me. Coming from New York, I love me a good Black and White cookie, and the Bagel Cafe displayed these gigantic beautiful Black and White cookies, and boy was I excited to try this glorious cookie. It looked so delicious. I wanted it... I wanted it badddd.....

Now in my mind, a Black and White cookie is the beautiful love child of a cookie and a cake: soft inners with just enough crisp to keep a firm shape and texture. When I went for my first break of the cookie, it felt soft, and not just soft, but cakey. That's ok, I guess again....... Maybe the frosting would be better? No... The frosting was way too soft. I have to say, this place came off as a possible diamond in the rough, but every part of it was just more and more disappointing.
Very good Matza ball soup.  Bagels are large too.  Can't wait to come back

Been coming here for 17+ years - always good.
Cabbage soup on the weekends is like grandma used to make.

2nd weekend in a row eating with my boys here
OMG delish! Love love love this place!!! They have so many options and tasty foods!!! Plus the service was on point :)

My husband recommended Bagel Cafe for brunch.  He'd been there before based on a review that rated them as one of the top 3 soup places in Vegas.

Nice neighborhood in Summerlin, clean and pretty new.  In front of you when you walk in are large displays with smoke fish and other bagel condiments, various fresh bagels, and a nice size offering of huge cookies and pastries, including chocolate chunk cookies, macaroons, rugelach, rice pudding, flan, turnovers, brownies, and more!

This is a "seat yourself" place with quick, friendly service and a whimsical menu that looks and feels like a small newspaper.  The menu offerings are numerous!  I had the biscuits and gravy - yum!  They make their own biscuits and they were soooo much better than the kind you can make at home and they were huge!  My husband had matza ball soup.  After tasting it I understand why they were rated one of the top soup places - wow!

The prices were very impressive!  My humongous biscuits and gravy were only $5.95, $7.50 with two eggs.

I doubt we will often travel across town to eat here, but if you're in the area it is well worth it!
This place is Amazing! A variety of foods and top quality deli! Feels like I'm in New York.

So much food you'll either have to share one dish or take some home!
They have NY style deli sandwiches, and food for all times of the day.
Their bagels far outdo Einsteins and they have quite a variety of cream cheese for those. You can either sit down and eat there or pick it up for to go.
The food here is amazing and it's always busy because its so damn good. 
My only complaint is that parking sucks, but it often does at busy/awesome places.
Great breakfast place for family and friends. Really great environment with good food.

The Bagel Cafe is one of the best breakfast spots in Vegas. I always recommend this restaurant to everyone, there are so many different options to chose from. Their bakery area is phenomenal and almost overwhelming! Definitely love this place!

The bagels and food are very good!! The service is hit or miss. Some are great and some are terrible. Ordering behind the deli or bakery is a nightmare. The girl at the register will stand there doing nothing and not help with bakery while the guys behind are busting their butts. It's really ridiculous. The manager should sit down with their staff and discuss team work.

My hubby and I love the bagel cafe, we really enjoy taking our 89yr old grandpa there.  He loves the matzoh soup, tuna salad and the sandwiches, I really enjoy the fresh OJ and the house salad.  It's always busy when we go, but there is always a table available and the food comes quickly.

I come here for their chicken noodle soup, bagels,  and their dessert! I need to mention they have the best Tiramisu in Las Vegas! And they're prices are  great!! Love this place and the staff is always smiling :-)

I do have to say this is the best you can get in Vegas for a Jewish deli. You can go to to the counter to take your food to go and there is never a lack of workers. You can order off the regular menu and it is nice because you can see all the sides up close to see which ones you want if you get a sandwich. Great selection of cream cheese spreads (lox being my favorite). Bagels are cooked perfectly and the perfect amount of chewy! It is so hard for me to get the perfect bagel after being spoiled growing up eating good bagels from LA. This bagel is a match to what I grew up with. They also have really friendly service although a bit rushed. 

I appreciate the sugar free rugelach and the large cookie and sweets selection. I do love the chocolate rugelach the most. Not too sweet. I think their corned beef is really good unlike other places in town that it is dry. It's not cheap though. Overall I think the prices are above what they should be, but it's one of those places I would pay for good food every once in a while.

Really really disappointed...have been there before and was good. But this time the pastrami was TERRIBLE!
Cut very thick and was very tough, could not bite thru, needed to eat sandwich with a knife n fork.
Even then, was very tough to chew! Only ate half of sandwich.
Not sure if I'll return !

It's what you expect from a deli, but only better. 

First and foremost, THE MENUS ARE SO CUTE! They're pretend newspapers... love love that idea. 

The prices are ridiculously cheap. The bagels have unique flavors (sundried tomato?!). And the bakery... oh man, oversized delciousness.. if you're in the mood to splurge on calories, get the humongous cinnamon roll (I shared it with a friend, and we still could have used 3 other people to help us out... but we were champs, and ate the whollle thing, ha!)

Apparently the salmon platter is bangin, my friend says she usually gets that with fam. 

But this time, we made our own bagel sandwiches... Sundried tomato bagel with scallion cream cheese, tomato, and a fried egggg... And like I said, reallly cheap..


As far as service goes, it's what you expect from a deli. Nothing amazing. People just there to get the job done.

I have been coming to The Bagel Cafe on and off for a handful of years now and have to say it's honestly the best place on this side of town (aside from an Einstein's) to get some deliciously fresh bagels!
 I am really only a bagel customer, as I've only sat down to eat once in the past, but from the dozens upon dozens of bagels I've had the pleasure of eating, I'm happy. 
The desserts are pretty great too! On my most recent visit I got a blueberry danish and it was amazing! 
The line might seem confusing but trust me, these people know what they're doing. I've never been wrongly skipped or had my goodies given to the wrong person. Don't worry!

Outstanding restaurant! We had the roast beef sandwich, macaroni salad, side of Sturgeon, bagel and Nova smoked salmon (less salty).
I did ask for my bagel not to be toasted and it came out toasted, this turned out being a great mistake by our server because it was really good. The best bagel I have ever had. I can't wait to go back and try all of their gourmet flavored cream cheeses.
The sandwich was perfection. The homemade pickle was discussting.they should make a few different pickled types, it tasted like a half done pickle. The macaroni salad had too much pickle flavor, would not order that again.
The Nova Salmon was a perfect amount for my bagel and sodium content was balanced by the fresh fish flavor.
We tried an eclair ! It was huge, the size reminded me of a six inch sub at subway! The pudding cream inside was incredibly addicting, they should sell that seperatelyI could eat it by the spoonful! I was hoping they had more mini dessert selections, we would've tried more and spent more.
My sugar cookie, had a smiley face on it, tasted like dry shortbread. I did not like it at all, I prefer chewy cookies. I saw multiple servers eating on the job coming from a back serving room, not the kitchen, that was weird, we're they eating off old plates? Also our server checked her watch multiple times, made me think she wanted to get out of work and rush us. 
The man at checkout was very nice and engaging. We can't wait to come back and try more.

The menus are discussing dirty!!! Gluten unfriendly. The brisket sandwich had so much fat on it you had to tear it apart than it was too hot to touch so than the bread fell apart:-(.  It took for ever to get cashed out. It was freezing cold inside and it's winter.  The glass wear was dirty.  The forks where bented need I say more?

I went with two friends on a rainy Friday afternoon for a late lunch. The cafe is located in an unsuspecting plaza filled with lots of medical and realtor offices. Parking was decently easy to find. Even though we got there around 1, there was still a 20ish minute wait for a table. While you wait, you can look at all the desserts and bagels they have on display. You have the option of dining in or taking out.

Their menus are already at the table and are fashioned after newspapers. I thought it was extremely adorable.

I ordered the homemade matzoh ball soup and toasted asiago bagel with scallion cream cheese. I must pat myself on the back because that bagel/cream cheese combo was so bomb. The bagel had just the right density and springiness to it with every bite. It's no wonder they're called Bagel Cafe. I also snuck a bite of my friend's everything bagel with nova cream cheese and plain bagel with blueberry cream cheese. The nova cream cheese was awesome, and I definitely wouldn't mind paying the extra dollar for it. This was my first time trying any kind of matzoh ball soup, and I enjoyed it enough. It's basically a glorified chicken soup--it got better with every bite.

Given that I have been nonstop complimenting their food, why the three stars then? The service was atrocious. The busboy delivered us our waters right away, but after that, it took forever for the waitress to actually take our order. I actually noticed two tables who were seated after us got their orders taken first and some of their food delivered before us. We had come at the tail end of lunch, and the crowd was dying down. There was absolutely no excuse for the waitress to ignore our table like that. The busboy actually stopped by and asked if our orders had been taken/told us that he'd get the waitress for us. She never apologized for ignoring us/being slow, but she was very fast at giving us our bill. 

I will very likely be back for their bagels, but I am wary of dining in again.

4 stars
-2 stars for the awful waitress
+1 star for the busboy

Dear Bagel Cafe, PLEASE DO SOMETHING ABOUT YOUR CUSTOMER SERVICE.  IT IS HORRIBLE.  The food here is GREAT.  GETTING AND PAYING is AWFUL.  So bad in fact we no longer come for sit down or take out.  This is SOOOO sad.  The people at the register need to be FIRED.  They are rude and incapeable of taking people in order.  Please, we are paying premium prices and being treated like crap.  Also, if you folks are really from NY you must know that tipping is dependent on SERVICE (not just in the resturant but the to go area AND BEHIND THE REGISTER).  It is not a right, so let's try to be nice......even if it hurts.  Your business will improve, believe me.

This is a little slice of the east coast in Vegas. Bagel cafe has all the trimmings of a full scale deli and restaurant. The deli side has fresh meats, fish and favorites such as chop liver, on display and ready to order. 

The restaurant side has comfy seats and a wide menu. 

Try the Asiago Bagel, toasted with cream cheese, tomato and lox. 

The pastrami is cut to order and great. 

The only downside is that they do take their time. You could easily wait 10 to 15 min for a order at the deli counter, so make sure your not in a hurry.

**Original review from 5/5/2011. Updating new profile.**

Another place I must visit when I'm out in Vegas. Of course, I've only been here 3 times and each time I get the same thing. Lump Crab Eggs Benedict. Heaven in my mouth! I don't come here for the coffee, which is drinkable, but not the best. I come here for this heavenly lump crab dish.... and the deli/bakery items. My mom had me try the potato cakes last time we were there and..... excuse me. Had to take a breather. Just thinking about those delicious, wonderful potato concoctions with the apple sauce.... Yummmmmmmmm.

The cafe service has been great for me each time. The last time I was there was on a Sunday morning and they were jam packed!!! The waitress was great and attentive, even though the place was packed. On busy days, I understand poaching eggs can be a little difficult because there's a lot more to pay attention to, so when I pointed out that my eggs had been overcooked, without hesitation, she comped me for one of my favorite things in the bakery. (I didn't want them remade.... they were still edible)

The bakery staff is why this place didn't receive a 5 star rating from me. Since I'm still new to the place, I didn't know that you had to stand in line at the deli to get service at the bakery. No one spoke up and when I tried to get the attention of one of the guys, I was blown off. When I finally received service, I placed my order and then asked for something from the deli. He treated my request as a big inconvenience. Needless to say, if it's a busy day, I'll just eat at the cafe and leave my bakery/deli order for another, less busy time.

Their food is great. Their bakery and deli items are delicious. I would recommend this place to everyone and anyone, but I would tell them to be patient and try to go when it's not so busy.
Great food! We will definitely come back. We had the bagels with egg and bacon and fresh squeezed OJ. The pastries are delicious!

Cashiers need to be trained with how they handle customers.  I purchased a Ruben sandwich to go.  After I received my sandwich, I decided that I'd rather sit down and eat it.  I told the cashier that I wanted to sit down, and rather than being courteous and finding me a seat, she told me that the tables are for people that order food from a waitress.  Ridiculous!  I guess spending $15 for a sandwich, fries and potato salad isn't enough for me to to sit down at their establishment and enjoy my meal.    

I wouldn't recommend this place based on the customer service alone.  I definitely won't be bringing my family or friends.

I picked up a half dozen bagels of various kinds. Toasted them for breakfast and found each one to be tasteless. If you had a blindfold, there is no way you could guess which was which. 

Probably the worst bagels I have ever had.
Bagel cafe is a great breakfast spot.  The service is a little slow sometimes but the food is always superb!  Awesome fruit cup, great bagels and the matzo ball soup can cure almost anything.

So I love the pastry shop. Ordered about $35 worth of goodies. Was waiting for my table for two. My name was called but because my friend hadn't arrived, she had to go check with her manager to seat me. I was a party of two but I could have been a party of one. Seriously??? Just seat me at the table. How much more can you make by turning the tables every 20 minutes vs allowing me to sit with a cup of coffee and enjoy a lovely breakfast???? Seriously peaved about this. It's not like I wouldn't have ordered even if my friend hadn't arrived.

We ordered the combination plate for 1 and shared! It is totally enough, but you will need a extra bagel. 

It was great, we loved the desserts, they are HUGE! 

One thing that we missed is that the combination plate doesn't come with capers. But still great.
Legit Bagels, just like NY. Best tasting cream cheese ever! The place is always packed. Service is just ok. I go back for the bagels and cream cheese!

Excellent service and Great comfort food!!!
My wife and I like coming here to eat especially
breakfast. Home made deserts and bakery!!
Always tastes great service is friendly menu is awesome been going to this place for a couple of years now! Love it!!

AMAZING!!! Our favorite bakery/breakfast/lunch/bagel heaven! We are huge fans of The Bagel Cafe, good enough to bring your out-of-town guests. Black and white cookies are uncomparable, pastrami sandwich is delish and I believe they make their own meat, fresh fruit and yogurt parfait is the best parfait you will ever have (and its huge), pancakes are amazing, chicken noodle soup, homemade pickles may not sound exciting, but they are! For the holidays they make a strawberry rhubarb pie that I order each year. I really can't say enough good things about this place. Family friendly, large portions, unbelievable bakery with everything you'll never know you were missing in life.
I come from NY, this place is the best. I will travel from Henderson to The bagel cafe. Just like home!

I really wanted to like this place so gave it several tries. The Reuben was great the first time, but the next time arrived fatty and cold. The corned beef hash was corned beef on the plate with the potatoes Not traditional at all. Chopped chicken livers were horrible. Garlic was so heavy I couldn't even eat it. Seriously, I grew up on Jewish food so I do have something to compare it to. Mediocre to me although their bakery is very good. Service slow and not a fan of the wait to get a seat. It's okay, but I'll be trying someplace else. Oh, ordered take out and it was awful. Order wrong, corned beef fatty again.

I have to start with a disclaimer that I grew up in New York/Philadelphia and recently moved from Chicago so I've had probably some of the best Jewish food in the country and I have high standards. I love Jewish food and will spend hours hunting down the best place I can find whenever I move somewhere new. That being said, I can't understand some of the people who have reviewed this place and say it's the best food they've ever had. Most of them have probably lived in LV all their lives and simply don't know any better, because as anyone who's lived near large urban cities probably knows, LV is pretty much an ethnic food-challenged culinary backwater for the most part. 
To be fair, my gf and I stopped by here a while ago on a Sunday at a very busy time. The line was out in the parking lot. I figured the food must be authentic and legit. Wrong! We ordered some easy, quick to make dishes and waited almost an hour, even sitting at the counter with open spots. I get it was crowded, but the service was sub-par, the waitress would disappear for 20 minutes and never bothered to even check back with us or apologize for the long wait. They need to figure out how to serve the public properly, either they're chronically understaffed or just don't have the right systems in place. The lack of acknowledgment of poor service borders on inexcusable and even if the food had been better I still would have thought twice about returning.
The "fresh squeezed" orange juice with no pulp was most likely Tropicana, it was room temp to boot. The bagels are doughy and too big, pretty much tasteless. You know it's bad when bagels from Einstein's totally outclass this place. The eggs were under-cooked and mediocre. To me the true test of a good Jewish deli is how good the potato pancakes are. Total fail - they were too thick, not hot and soggy. They basically tasted like a big home fry patty, not seasoned correctly either. It was disgusting I couldn't even finish it. 
They didn't want to substitute anything, and every add-on dish was $6 or more. It was big-city prices for an inferior execution. I honestly lost my appetite and was so disappointed with their "real Jewish food" that I couldn't wait to get out of there.
Nothing seemed special or unique about this place - they just overcharge because there really isn't any competition in the jewish deli biz in Vegas. I'd rather eat at Subway then ever go back to bagel cafe. For those of you who don't want to be part of the sheeple herd that seem devoted to this train wreck of a pretend Jewish restaurant, I highly recommend Weiss Deli in Green Valley, Henderson. It's a hole in the wall with spot-on service that can give some of better delis in Chicago a run for their $. The matzo ball soup is served in a trough-sized container and one matzoh ball is literally baseball sized, enough for 2 or 3 to share. The plates there are so big you could eat for 3 days on a sandwich. Compare the two and see for yourself - I guarantee you won't be disappointed. It's doesn't get much worse than Bagel Cafe.
We always come here for the breakfast bagel sandwiches (spinach/feta) is my favorite. They also have a great bakery with a variety of pastries and sweet treats!

Another one of my first stops when getting back to Vegas.  If you are a New Yorker or just like good food, this is the spot.  I always come here to get a sesame bagel with low-fat veggie cream cheese.  When I am here, it's as if I am back at The Bagel Chalet in Commack!  The black and white cookies  are delicious too!  If anyone is longing for NY while in Vegas, come here!

I have always been the biggest fan of the Bagel Cafe. I have visited multiple times always for bagels and cheese to-go.   After my last visit the day after Christmas I may never come back...EVER!   Let me start off by saying that it was very early and not busy at all. Just me and two other people in the bakery area.   I placed my order for sliced bagels and cream cheese selections and moved on to the cashier.  At the register, I decided that I needed some soup for our lunch later that day so I ordered 2 chicken noodle soups w/ 3 matzo balls in each.  Didn't seem very difficult and the cashier said that she "would ring them up but just this one time since it wasn't busy."  ??? I didn't know soup needed to be ordered from the guys at the bagel counter...fine, my mistake, now I know for the future.  No big deal.  Here's where it all went downhill.  The cashier that I ordered the soup from rang up 3 soups instead of 2.  When she gave me the total I asked why it was so much? (The bowls of soups are $8.50 each)  She showed me the receipt and she rang up 3 soups instead of 2 which was her mistake.  During the process of refunding the soup you would have thought it was the end of the world that she had to refund 1 soup (which hadn't even been packaged yet).  She turned to another employee and rolled her eyes during the process all with me standing right there.  I spent over $50 on bagels and soups to go.  I told her that she was very rude and why I felt that way.  I walked out to my car which was parked in front of the big huge window by the register and she was huffing and puffing around talking about me to her co-worker.  I watched all of this through the window and made the decision to go back inside for the manager.  I told the manager exactly what happened.  He wanted me to "just let it go because it was the holidays"...WHAT?!?! Holidays or not when your employees are unprofessional and losing you business you better address your problems.  What a terrible approach from the manager to know I was treated poorly and to tell me to let it go because of the holidays without a simple apology.

No apology...no yelp stars or business from me.  Never again will I spend my money here! There is something to be said for good customer service and this place doesn't have it.  I noticed some other reviews that noted rude and poor service.  I could have chalked it up to the cashier having a bad morning but with a terrible manager it was a double whammy.  I guess being rude is acceptable and you can put up with it or go somewhere else.

The guy at the bagel counter was wonderful.  This issue was from the cashier and then the terrible manager.    Just because I walked out the door and can't hear you doesn't mean I can't SEE you talking trash about me through your huge windows!

From previous visits during the busy times I learned that you must stand your ground in the line or people will just cut right in front of you. People act like their time is more important than yours and it's like they go ahead of you on purpose.  Nobody ever knows whose turn it is to order...pretty chaotic!

I used to love this place but can't go there anymore because of my diet that restricts almost everything they serve. I loved the food, with one exception - if you are Eastern European don't expect stuffed cabbage will be just like your mom used to make. Maybe for somebody who doesn't know how it's really supposed to taste it will be ok. Breakfasts are amazing, portions are enormous and everything is always super fresh and delicious. Even when it's super busy wait is not too long and food comes fast and yummy.

Fresh bread, muffins and of course bagels. The food is great, very fresh. Large portions, several side choices for the sandwhichs.. fries big enough to share. Breakfast come with a bagel.
The staff is refreshingly pleasant, always full of smiles. They frequently visit to ensure everything's good. Oh and you can seat yourself most days. 


Tons of parking and a newspaper boy that works right outside. Oh and small and large booths

Best bagel In Las Vegas !staff was also nice!
Only problem is the place is so small, 
and the seating uncomfortable.

Has the best bagels I've tasted on the West coast (so happy to find bagels like the New York bagels I grew up with :) I was also so happy to see my favorite east coast treats and foods like black and white cookies, giant chocolate chip cookies, rainbow cookies, fresh lox w/cream cheese, knishes and cream puffs! :) So happy my sis and brother-in-law found this place :) I can't wait to go back to try everything I saw!!! (I'm pacing myself)

There is nothing bad in here !! It's true. Amazing bagels, bakery section, I've always loved their sandwiches and there omelets are so good. I remember they used to be in the sun coast hotel and they had some amazing sugar free desserts. I don't know if they make them anymore. Sad . But do go, it's so good .

The food here is usually fantastic.  The portions are huge and the wait staff is friendly.  You can plan to be waiting a good long while for your food but most the time it's worth it.  I had the special which was an asparagus and goat cheese omelette that was very good but my bagel was burnt, and I was surprised she even served it to me. Today was a mess, but I would definitely come again.

AMAZING!!! I have to wonder about some of the bad reviews, as this was my first visit to this New York Jewish Deli, but am So Glad I took them with a grain of salt. Ordered "to go" veggie omelet w /cheddar, bagel lox sand which and a "pizza bagel". Everything from the sweets in the case to the bagels, spreads, meats and FISH ~ omg! ~ looked sooo good!!! When we finally ate our meal (at home), my friend just kept saying "oh my god" and "are you gunna eat that?" Cuz he wanted it all!! Las Vegas , enjoy and frequent this business!

The Bagel Cafe is the premier breakfast/brunch destination in Las Vegas.  The service, (while at times very busy), is always friendly and the food is great.  The feeling going there is just like an old school Jewish deli back on the East Coast.  Get there before 10 in the morning on the weekends because it gets really busy.  Fantastic place and I would recommend it to anyone.

I can't seem to order anything but the matzo ball chicken soup...I try and try to order something different but end up getting the same thing!  I have tried different bagels and they've always been fresh and wonderful.  The matzo ball soup has always been great, but sometimes (two or three times out of the many times I have eaten there) the soup tastes old and the matzo is mushy.  Most of the time it's great.  Maybe because I usually go late in the day...I sometimes find myself scared to eat there after lunch as I hate the taste of old chicken.  I do love lunch there.

My favorite bagel place in town.  I usually buy a dozen and once I get home, I pop it in the freezer and each time I wanted one, I just throw it in the microwave for a minute and wha la... we have a bagel that taste as if it was just freshly baked.

I have been a fan and regular customer of the Bagel Cafe for many years.  What happened to me today is a game changer!  My wife and I took 3 friends out to breakfast.  As usual the food was good and as usual my wife wanted to take home a pastry as did my friends.  There was quite a long line to pay as Sundays are always busy.  I wait in the pay line while the other 4 check out the goodies.  After about 5 minutes it's my turn to pay and I ask the cashier to add an eclair.  In a not so great tone of voice she says " we are too busy, you have to order over there".  I was taken aback by not only the tone but in the past I always ordered my to go pastry from the cashier.  I will grant that I usually eat thier on Monday"s when they are not as busy but I became defensive from her barking at me.  I stated my unhappiness and she asked if I wanted to speak to the manager and I stated I did so she pointed him out to me.  I walked over to him and explained that I have always ordered my pastries as I was paying and he told me something to the effect of, We don't let the cashiers handle money and food because some money comes in from sick people, casinos and from a "strippers ass crack". REALLY! Stuff happens and I sure don't want to take such a good deli off my list but I felt pretty small at that point.  If the cashier was nicer in her response from me I would not have questioned going to another line, but the manager was icing on the cake. We can all have a bad day and maybe I could have handled everyhing different on my end but the attitude and response said to me they just don't really appreciate my patronage

I lived in NY for 21 years and this is the closest thing to authentic NY deli food and pastries from back home than any other place in Las Vegas. The only reason I didn't give this 5 stars is your bill can run up high, fast. Freshly squeezed Orange juice runs close to $5. A sausage egg and cheese runs around $8 or $9, but for me the cost is worth the joy of eating incredible food. And the desserts....Fuuugettaaaboutttttittttttt
Great place to start your day with your favorite Bagel n coffee! Or any other selection on their delicious menu! Great selection!! Enjoy!!

Usually one of my favorite delis in Las Vegas. But today's visit was a disappointment in customer service. I ordered a beef dip sandwich with roast beef. It came with delicious crispy french fries and really good coleslaw.unfortunately the sandwich itself was almost inedible.it was stacked high with roast beef and a nice soft roll but the roast beef was so dry it was more like eating paper.it's one thing to have an occasional disappointing meal, but when I talk to management about the sandwich there was little empathy about my situation . I got no apology only excuse is that no one else has complained about the sandwich. Not offered to bring me something else or even discount it since I didn't eat half of the sandwich. I'm sure I'll be back but just be warned if you complain about the quality of the food or that you just simply don't like something don't expect the management to care.
Food has gone downhill while prices have gone up.  Messed up the whole order and never apologized.

Their bagels are the best (I've had) in Las Vegas! But equally as good are their assortment of cream cheeses and their pastries, cookies, etc.

Whenever I'm on this side of town, I like to get their bagel and lox sandwich w/ lite scallion cream cheese. I was there today and someone ordered a pastrami sandwich that looked amazing, so I may need to divert from my standard order.

This place is the best ny Jewish deli , fantastic menu, fantastic service, fantastic prices , just retrain busboy for sanitation and safety , he did a few boo boos , always lift a cup up off table to pour , he almost burned me , and don't put your hands over the glasses to serve , serve them by the base !!!! ,

I haven't been here for a while & it was a mistake coming here this time for breakfast.   All of the food that arrived was served cold & my eggs were improperly cooked.  Overall, the food quality, execution & service was poor.  Needless to say I will not be back!

This usual to be a nice place with friendly staff and good food. But the last few times we've been here the experience were very poor. They keep on seating people without regard of the servers being slammed. We sat for over 20 mins at the table without anyone come by to even said " hi, I'll be right with you". The busperson gave us coffee and disappear. We had to flag down someone to track down a server.  But people who know the owner got served before people been waiting for long time. The food may be good but I wouldn't recommend anyone to come here unless you're a friend of the owner. This place no longer offer a good eating experience.
Excellent cafe deli and bakery - went for lunch and had a bagel and egg sandwich with bacon - outstanding - got a small eclair for desert - yummy

Everything I've tried is yummy. Haven't taken anything from the bakery as yet, been coming here for years, not sure how that happened. Bagels clearly a good choice. Soup and sandwiches are tasty as well. Some nice bagel/fish plates. Worth a try but be prepared to wait.

I've been here dozens of times but this is my first time leaving a review. Being an East Coast person of Jewish persuasion, I know my delis and this is one great deli! Food is always good, whether it's breakfast, dinner or just "a nosh".  My personal favorite meal is the early bird special of chicken parmesan and comes with soup (I love the matzoh ball soup) veggies and pasta as well as a drink and dessert! Their bakery is also amazing with plenty of choices. I bring new people all the time and never had anyone not love it. Expect deli prices but the food and friendly service make it well worth it! My only complaint are the weekend hours bring so short. Other than that....I love it!

I have been to The Bagel Cafe a few times now and I think it's A-OK!  

Good option for a bite to eat when you are looking for something quicker than one of the sit-down restaurants at the Red Rock and something better than the food court.

Like Ken M., I too had the Philly chicken, however my sandwich was not dripping in oil and the fries were crispy and delicious.  The staff seems friendly and everything is made to order.  I have also seen the club, the chicken fingers, and a few others.  Everything was good.  

Now, let's not go crazy.  I wouldn't order EVERYTHING off the menu.  C'mon folks, its a grill next to a sports book.   I still advise making your choices wisely.  Maybe avoid the tongue or the chopped chicken liver sandwich?  I'm just saying . . . not my bag baby.  Of all the things I have ordered, I haven't had anything bad.

I say when you want a quick bite (for lunch or breakfast, or even a snack) stop at The Bagel Cafe. Order smart, keep your expectations in check, and enjoy your grill food!  Then, get back to gambling!
The Best New York Style deli in Las Vegas!!!

Great food and great service, have had the pleasure of meeting the owner who personally walks around and speaks with customers and he's a great guy! Just makes me want to come back again to support a small business for a hard working man!

This is my first visit here after a friend told me about it. My office is right down the street and I've driven past it a million times thinking they just served bagels. 

We ordered two veggie omelets with potatos and sourdough bread. For drinks we had 1 coffee and 1 hot tea and I also ordered a cinnamon bun to go for my assistant, because I am the best boss ever. Total cost was approx. $33.

Plate presentation was amazing. Everything here seems to be supersized and looks delicious. The 4 pieces of sourdough toast between us was probably a half loaf of bread! Yabba Dabba Doo!

The omelets were very good: Fresh vegetables mixed into the egg and cooked thoroughly... I'm picky when it comes to undercooked eggs. The only criticism I can offer is there was a lack of salt, but there was salt at the table so we added salt to our own to taste.

The potatos were ok. Nothing really exciting about them. My wife asked for no onions in her omelet and when the plate was delivered the potatos had onions.  No biggie.

The restaurant serves as a bakery and deli as well. The bakery side has lots of goodies that look like they are on steroids.  The cinnamon bun is huge and could easily feed three to four people. 

Our waitress was friendly and prompt and everyone else in the restaurant looked like they were enjoying  the same level of service. 

While slightly pricier than other breakfast spots in the area, it isn't a smokey bar or a chain restaurant, which makes it appealing to me.

Overall the food is good nothing negative to say about the food but the service , jeez do they need help . This place is crowded and sometimes there's rarely any moving space but that's not my reason for the 3 starts the cashier was probably the rudest person I've ever had to encounter and trust me I've encountered some rude ones , but no hello or anything basically just stated the total and placed my change on the counter when I had my hand out passed me my food and started yelling for the next order . I feel like customer service is a huge part that contributes to a restaurant and if you have crappy service it doesn't make you want to go back no matter how good the food is . I doubt I'll be back to this place. I didn't catch the cashiers name but she had long dark hair I went in yesterday around 3:30 . The guy that initially helped me was nice but the last lady really ruined it for me .

Wow, this place is such a treat! It's the Jewish deli that everyone wishes they had in their life! 

Pros:
The knish was delicious! And the hamantashens were better then my grandmothers.

Cons:
The dells lemonade was very bitter, and not as close to the original.

If you like pastrami and cornbeef sandwiches this is the place. How about bagels and lox? We have been going to Begel Cafe for over 10 years every weekend. A must try place in Las Vegas.

Bob

The Bagel Cafe is really under rated. Reminds me of a New York deli, everything is extremely fresh the pastries are AMAZING. 

Price wise could be a little cheaper but if you want a good place to chill and watch Sports all day with some great munchies this is the spot!

Wish this place was outside the casino it would do really well on it's own

My Jewish family and I loveeee The Bagel Cafe. We dine in occasionally, but usually get stuff to go. They have a huge assortment of bagels and cream cheeses, as well as deli salads, fish, cold cuts, and some amazing desserts for purchase. The bagels are my favorite. They are soft and baked in house with over a dozen flavors. They are extra delicious if you can get them fresh out of the oven. We usually get a baker's dozen, which is 13 bagels, and a flavored cream cheese, as well as egg and tuna salads. This makes for a yummy brunch. 

My last visit was on a Sunday around 1 and I was in and out quickly. You order at the deli counter, and then pay at the register. For a dozen bagels, 1 pound of lox cream cheese, a pound of tuna salad, and half a pound of egg salad I spent $40. A bit pricey, but definitely worth it. You get what you pay for, and you are paying for quality food. Whenever anyone suggests bagels, this is the place we always go to. 

I recommend not coming early on weekends if you can help it, because they are jam packed and there is always a line. They are open during the week until 8pm and until 5pm on weekends.

I'm done with this place. I've been here before several times and many times when I have guest visit me, I'll take them here or recommend people here. Today I arrived with family who are visiting us and decided to grab a bite to eat. It was 4:40pm and as we arrived, this  man (later found out is a manager) approached us and with a stern voice told us " you have 5 min to order because the kitchen will close ". What kind of crap is that?! He was practically telling us to turn around and leave. Ive worked I this industry for many years and understand that the staff wants to go home, but you still should accommodate guests as best as you can. I've had way better customer service the times I've been here before. This town is growing, as far as places to eat. I'm taking my business elsewhere and will not recommend this place again. Like I said, many other places to go and eat.

Great food, mostly homemade however the service is terribly slow. When my food was delivered my drink was empty and it stayed that way till after I was done eating. Then when delivering the check she asked if I wanted a refill which I replied yes please but I didn't get that till 10 minutes later

I've been here a few times and each time the food and service has been outstanding. It's a seat yourself type of joint so be sure to get there before the breakfast or lunch rush; luckily each time I've gone, I've gotten a table. The food is the best deli food I've had in Vegas, period! The sandwiches are gigantic and the breakfast fare is bountiful. Each time I've been I've had a different type of sandwich. There are two sizes of sandwiches, the biggest size is huge, but manageable if you've got a descent appetite. All the spicy mustard they offer on the table goes great with any sandwich. My wife is a breakfast fanatic and each time we've gone she hasn't been disappointed. After our meals we take a stroll next to their dessert cases and after about 10 minutes or so we finally make our decisions. They have a huge selection of desserts that are made on site as well as their bagel selection. If you're looking for a legit deli, with huge sandwiches and tasty desserts, this is your place, you won't be disappointed.

Best Bagels in Las vegas, mediocre service, but who cares?

Their Smoked salmon platter is my favorite, and their menu has so many diverse options like Challah french toast, whitefish spread, a sturgeon platter, a herring in wine sauce appetizer, and a delectable caviar cream cheese. 

I missed Russ & Daughters back in NYC a little less. Thanks Bagel Cafe.
Love the menu.  Everything is always good.  Great place to take friends and family from out of town.  Wish they had more kosher style options...really no turkey bacon or turkey sausage?

We go here every year when we visit Vegas.  Never again. 

It's entirely possible our server was just awful however he took quite a long time to arrive to take our order, didn't return once for 15 minutes to refill drinks, etc (we had to leverage 2 other waitstaff).  Finally returned to deliver 1/2 of food to table.  10 minutes later we had to ask another server to find him for the rest of our food.  Our sever returns shortly thereafter with food, which isn't ours.  When confronted with the fact that he messed up the order he became enraged, left our table, threw the plate of food in the busser cart with a large crash and audibly announced to everyone that he would not return to our table...all because of his own mistake.  Good riddance to him.

Get new staff, you can't have an attitude like that when you work in the service industry.

Just average in my opinion. Waitress was friendly but not very attentive. They were out of half the stuff we asked for, even iced tea. Was reasonably priced and OK for average lunch or dinner. Not on my favorites list but I wouldn't say no to eating there again.

We stopped here on our way to a local soccer tournament. 
Upon entering we found the establishment to be appealing and welcoming.  
The smells of fresh bagels cooking and the smiling greeting waitresses was a pleasant way to start a morning breakfast. 
Our service was prompt and friendly.  
We ordered the lox plate, fruit parfait, pancakes with bacon a plain bagel, and another plain bagel with cream cheese.
Best bagel place in vegas. It's always busy but there is an option to sit down or take out. Big section of bagels. Kind customer service. A little busy but still great. Food is amazing.
Best deli in Las Vegas but makes me miss LA and NY delis.

I have a confession to make... I have an obsession with tongue.

That's right folks - tongue. I love it. Name the animal - duck, pig, cow - it's definitely one of the best eating parts of the animal. (what, were thinking about something else? You guys have dirty minds ;P  !) Being Asian, my parents indoctrined this love at a very early age.

When I discovered that Jewish delis were into tongue too (and liver, yum!), I pretty much loved hitting up inexpensive places to nosh.

I was kind of depressed in Vegas because... well, on the Strip, you pass by all these famous delis that basically rape your wallet.

You can imagine how happy I was to find the Bagel Cafe! 

My hubby got the pastrami and I ordered the tongue sandwich. Perfection. Really. And not hard on the wallet either which is the best part.

I did try a slice of Boston Creme cake and it is totally junky good.

Recommended by my realtor, and I have to say it's spot on!! First off Megan is a rock star. She understands the difference between service and hospitality. I would be back just for the hospitality alone. Megan if you come to California I would love to have you on my team. Second that's the way corned beef Hash should be made. Among the best I've had in my 57 years. Can't wait to bring my wife and New Yorker father in law. They will absolutely  love it!!!

Terrible service we ordered a open face sandwich and they came over with a platter of food instead we sent it back and they refused to take it off our bill when we asked them too. They yelled at us for asking and also refused to let us talk to the manager.... all together worst experience I've ever had. I will not go back ever again!

This joint is right by my house, so trying it was a no brainer. Going on a Saturday means it's busy busy for breakfast, but the wait is never more than 15 to 20 min.
