Mostly, it takes all of 5 min to get seated. I took my New Yorker friend who DIED over this place. It's the most authentic place she's found in Vegas. The food is tasty - I get the Western omelet with sausage instead of ham and the house potatoes. It's always more than enough food, so leftover lovers REJOICE! Each order comes with one of their bagels and cream cheese too. SO. MUCH. GOOD. FOOD. If you just want to pop in for a pastry, there is an entire counter of delicious goodies, too.
The best bakery in Plas Vegas by far can't wait to visit still recovering from surgery I'll be back as sooon as I can get there
I have eaten in this place food is okay.  The cashiers never smile or say hi.  The desserts are fabulous.  Okay to visit once in awhile
This is the best deli in all of Las Vegas. The cookies are always great.

The bagels here are much better than other bagel places in town.  Their creams cheeses are fresh with fresh fruit mixed in!  

Sit down service is up and down, inconsistent. It usually depends on how busy they are. They have the rule: You can't be seated unless your entire party is present, but that isn't consistent either. They will ask over and over about your stroller if you have one...where will you put it, can it be broken down for fear it will take up soooooo much space. During one visit the stroller issue was so bad they said it was a fire issue. I had to let them know that it would fold down smaller than most as it was a jogger stroller. So leave your stroller in the car to avoid snotty questions or if you dislike condescending tones. 

To be fair, some staff members are amazingly sweet. One person at the to go check out gave my baby his favorite cookie on the house and talked to him for a few minutes. 

We would frequent this establishment more if their staff were consistently kind and professional.

Amazing! Incredible staff, very attentive & friendly! Incredible value on the kids meal! Wonderful food! Bagels, French toast, smoked Lox eggs Benedict, crab cake eggs Benedict....oh my gosh!!! Great coffee-best in town for us!! Bakery goods are delicious! Homemade cream cheese spreads are unbeatable!

Probably one of the worst delicatessen I have ever been to. Service was fine, but the food was another story. Was there Thursday night at 7:40 and ordered two corn beef sandwiches to go. They were almost inedible. They were so dry and corned beef had no flavor. I was embarrassed to tell my husband how much I paid. Have been to much better delicatessens.
They have the best French toast made with challah!  Good matzo ball soup and sandwiches.  Def as close to NY deli food as you can get in Vegas.

It been while since knocked off another bookmark. I finally got around to checking out The Bagel Cafe. I just happen to be in a bagel kind of mood start the day so figure perfect opportunity for some yelping. 

Talk about bagels, bagels, and not just bagels. I had no idea since this was my first visit. It felt like almost whole deli section in major chain grocery store. One section that has all kinds of bagels in wire baskets choose from everything and anything can imagine. Each basket is well label and LOVE the way all the sections are displayed for the customers. Clean glass display, clear easy to read labels, and everything looks fresh. The selection of cream cheese again just about had everything and everything can imagine. I ended up going on safer play sun dried tomato bagel with regular cream cheese. Toast the bagel coast you dollar extra find odd. It was awesome bagel. The cream cheese was solid. The veggie cream cheese was looking awesome just wanted stay neutral flavor and enjoy the bagel. In the same section had assortment of cold salads can choose from. On the right have deli section with cheeses, deli meats, and not often seen in deli sections had couple dried fish or smoked fish looked like could get. The dessert section!!!! The biggest section of all of them. Really nothing that I would not pass up to try. I was just in bagel kind of mood. 

The restaurant area itself is decent size with counter area. Looks and feel like local coffee shop decor. I just got bagel to go so have no idea about the service or anything about the restaurant. Not doubt if in breakfast mood The Bagel Cafe is solid choice start the day!!!

Tasty bagels, sandwiches and desserts.  Kind of reminds me of Katz's Deli in NYC, except friendlier.  The bread is amazing.  The bagel sandwiches are huge.  Don't get the egg bagel sandwich for the road.  There is no way you can eat it without sitting down at a table, preferably with a knife and fork.  It's a monster.

The food can take some time but it is worth the wait.  But don't come here and expect to get out the door in five minutes.  If you dine in, they will not let you split a sandwich.  Also, ordering at the dessert counter can be a little frustrating.  We waited for some time and people cut in front of us before the guy behind the counter acknowledged us.  But a minor hiccup for great food.

This place apparently had some great sandwiches, but after seeing their breakfast menu, I couldn't resist the biscuits and gravy. They turned out excellent. The sausage left a little to be desired, but that's the only reason I'm giving it a four. Go and enjoy!

We stopped in here the morning of the 2nd for breakfast and I ordered a café mocha and the pastrami omelet with provolone, and my Mr. ordered the two egg breakfast with bacon.  I was really jonesing for this breakfast because I'd never been to a place that will put pastrami (and some of the other deli meats) in an omelet.  It just sounded good, you know?  

The omelet was great.  The pastrami was really tender and full of flavor.  My home fries were not warm and tasted like they had been sitting around for awhile.  Same goes for my husband's breakfast, which also had his eggs scrambled, not sunny side up.  He always orders sunny side up.  I didn't even notice because I was digging into my tasty pastrami.  He opted not to have it corrected and just helped me eat my omelet.  The mocha tasted like watery hot chocolate and was really disappointing at $4.50.  One of us ordered a chocolate chip bagel with regular cream cheese and the bagel was very nice and chewy.  Really enjoyed that even though there were no discernible chocolate chips in it.

Other than the omelet and the bagel, there's really nothing that was good about our breakfast.  The atmosphere was very noisy.  On one side I had a loud talker blaring in my ear his expertise about car tires, and on the other we had a little poopster who had probably just learned to pull herself up and stand and look around.  She also enjoyed pulling on my husband's shirt and ear.  Not cute or cool.  I wish the people who shot out that kid were paying a little more attention to her.  

I would go back again and try some of their other items.  Maybe it was just a bad day.  Our total after tax, before tip, was $31.08 and it was just not a good 30-dollar breakfast.  However, I trust my Yelp buddy, Loon E.'s opinion, so next time I'll have to try the whitefish salad.  Maybe that will elevate my next review.

This is my favorite place for all the traditional Jewish Foods my grandma used to make for me. The Matzah Ball Soup truly is Jewish Penicillin when you are sick (and even if your not). And their Bagel, Lox, and Cream Cheese is complete with Capers,Tomatoes,and Red Onion! And their Bagel selections are complete with Bagels and Bialys( not sure if that's spelled correctly) Delicious!!
The bakery section is complete with everything your heart desires.
I love this place.

We've been coming here since we move back east in early 2000 iIt was recommended by some Jewish friends. The deli specially the pastrami is comparable back east. The taste, moistness is perfect. The matzo ball is also good. Another reason why we come was for their black and white cookies and Napoleon dessert it was really good. The reason why is only 3 stars... Their coffee is terrible. 1st time we went here years ago I hated their coffee, so we gave it a shot a couple years later.... The coffee still suck!! I investigated and peek at their coffee area nd they use this company farmers coffee. It was so watered down, so I don't come here for breakfast or lunch if I want good coffee or come here order water and head to Starbucks, coffee bean or any coffee house I feel that day

Just because a place is popular doesn't mean it's good. The bagel cafe is a perfect example. This non-kosher and probably non-Jewish deli is a far cry from New York's Kosher delis. Noisy and messy with abrasive service (part of this place's "charm" perhaps?). Part restaurant, part deli/bakery. For Vegas it is an attraction but prices are insane. Every exta (e.g.  toast your bagel, add a slice of cheese, add a slice of tomato, avocado - all at least an extra $1 or more).  $2.5 for a mediocre hamantachen? Now that's Chutzpah.

This review is only for my latest purchase - a Pastrami $ Swiss on Rye. Over the years my experience here has been good, not so much this time. I ordered a Pastrami & Swiss on Rye to go and it was still warm when I got home. I unwrapped the sandwich and it was the same stuffed in the middle item that you would receive in any typical deli - meant to look as if it was really massive. To be expected. I put mustard on it and proceeded to take a bite. It was terribly dry and lacked the wonderful pastrami spice flavor that separates it from a corned beef sandwich. It tasted like the pastrami you can get at any Smith's deli - not REAL pastrami. I opened up the sandwich and noticed it had no fat at all. While excessive fat is a no no, no fat is just as bad. Fat is where a lot of flavor is. The sandwich was so dry that it sucked the moisture out of my mouth. They need to take a look at their purveyor to question the source of their pastrami. I would never purchase another one from The Bagel cafe. Try one and see if you don't agree - if you dare, (unless you are on a fat restricted diet). I really like this place and it distresses me to post this negative review.

Would be 4 stars if you didn't BURN MY BAGELS every time you toast them. Get a new toaster, please! We've been eating at The Bagel Cafe for 2 years now and have never had a non-burnt bagel served to us with our Matzo-ball soup. Love that you have Onion bagels, hate that all of the onion bits are burnt to carcinogen level 5 every time. I'm talking black as night. A tragedy. PLEASE invest in a new toaster, or turn it way down even though it might slow down your turn and burn... (pun intended)

Great Matzo-ball soup, though!

This is one of my new favorite breakfast places.... I ordered the scrambled eggs, potatoes, and sausage with a chocolate chip bagel and cinnamon walnut raisin cream cheese, so basically I had enough food to feed a small village. Everything was delicious, and that was truly the best bagel & cream cheese I've ever had!  It tasted like it was fresh out of the oven... I'll be back on a regular basis that's for sure :)

I wanted to be impressed but having eaten at Cantor's many a time this place leaves much to be desired.

Sandwiches (he had pastrami, and I had a brisket) were so so.... cucumber salad is okay but needs a little "punch" to it. Our other two companions were not entirely impressed except for her chicken salad. Now that was good.

Portions are huge.... but I would rather have a really good medium size meal than a less than stellar supersize.

Waitress was very friendly but got orders wrong. My jewish bubala would be turning in her grave!

Overall, stick with ordering fresh bagels and a shmear to go!
The best bagel and veggie snear I've had. The bagel was light yet full of substance. This place is worth a 30min drive just for one bagel.
This guy is from queens and makes the best breakfast just like back home in NYC. Breakfast is from NY in LV

This place had great service, warm atmosphere and a very large menu. The NT potato knish was probably the best thing we had there. We also both got the sandwiches, which were good but far too big to even hold. The french fries were crispy enough (just the way I like them) and their portions are pretty large. BUT I tried the pizza bagels and they were god awful. The marinara had a really bad, sour aftertaste and the cheese was congealed. So, that pretty much ruined my meal a bit for me although I'd still be willing to go back and try a couple of other things on the menu.

New York revisited!  Been going here for over 13 years.  A little piece of home with that real family owned feel.  Never had a bad meal in fact its always fabulous.  My favorite is the greek salad.  It beats any greek salad in this town for sure!

Several years later, and I may have had a run-in or two with a waitress in a bad mood but I still suggest Bagel Cafe to all my bagel-loving friends! 

Nothing has changed here. It is still a hidden gem of Vegas with signage that is in no way loud. You enter straight into the deli portion where you can place to go order. Pass this and you can be seated. The seats are still awkward unless you are in a booth - but I am the person who always prefers a booth and I will wait. Over the years I have become increasingly impressed with their Hand Cut Nova 4oz. About $17 it comes with tomatoes, cucumbers, pickles, onions, capers, obviously Nova, and any bagel you like. I recommend it if you like this style of breakfast in general. 

I only have two complaints from my visits here. First, the orange juice does not taste "fresh squeezed" like they claim on the menu. It tastes watered down. If this is not the case the quality of the oranges must be severely lacking. Additionally, I don't like that you check out at the counter. This normally would not be an issue but it has happened before that after I ate I wanted a to-go order for my friend at home. The waitress said she could not take the order and to order at the register, and the register asked me to order in the deli line, which took ten more minutes than I would have been willing to spend had I known I had to start from scratch to order after I already ate. The deli line is always long, but they do impressively well at making it move.

Loosing favor...our first visit was excellent, food selection very nice and our order was prepared perfectly; i ordered baked salmon Benedict, Grace ordered Challah French toast.
Today's visit, at 1pm on a Tuesday, we ordered the same items, Grace's Challah French toast was such a large order, the 3 pieces of French toast could have each been a loaf of bread alone! 
My plate was not so good...the muffin was grilled instead of toasted as was the salmon, grilled instead of baked; both spent too much time on the grill and were 'hard-crusted' ..unappetizing. 
Finally, the salmon had an unusual amount of bones making me lose my appetite and my desire to have this plate again in the future..this was my third time having this plate as I really enjoyed its uniqueness. 
With the large selection, I'll find plenty of other dishes to try, but won't be ordering this Benedict again.

Went there with a friend for lunch. Service was quick and friendly. Food was excellent. I couldn't ask for a better experience. 

My lunch partner went on and on about the authenticity of the food. We walked through the deli side on the way out. I think there were 8 or 10 kinds of cream cheese.

I'll definitely return when I'm in town.
Ordered the chopped liver appetizer and my husband ordered the Rueben. Both were delicious and highly recommended.

I'm updating my review due to the extremely RUDE manager on duty on Easter! 

I placed an order for pick up early on Sunday to have picked up at two. I ordered four meals and several pastries from the case. When I was checking out I mentioned that I was to get a side and bagel option with the Benedict I ordered, per their menu online(see picture). Two girls told me no before they asked the manager, Jeremy/Jerry. Who said no but go a head and give it to her, I said thank you. He proceeds to get a menu to point it out. I said ok just to let you know your menu online says that all eggs and omelet dishes come with a choice of sides stated and a bagel. (All in the same section of the Benedict's). He said it comes with an English muffin but I'm not going to make a big deal out of a bagel and that he's never had anyone ask for the bagel. I don't respond because I know better and he agreed to give me the bagel. But I think to myself well I understand that a Benedict comes with an English muffin, I'm not stupid but the menu didn't state a bagel for a substitute. The girl ringing me out said oh the online menu? Well what this guy doesn't know is that I've worked in and managed places very similar to this and I know when a cashier is sympathizing with a customer. They obviously have had this complaint before also by the way he immediately got defensive. 

So I pay $75 AND tip (not to mention the $8.25 for a "large" side of fruit that was a mere pint) and we leave. As were walking out the door I hear ma'am, like I've forgotten a bag. Ha nope! It's the manager coming outside to argue some more. (My BF said after we left that when he came out the manager said I didn't want to argue with you inside....uhhh how about not at all) He tries to speak but I say to the BF let's go and he starts going on and on and I walk around the BF to walk away and the manager says "ridiculous" as he's wailing back in. Ummmm NNO!!! I turn around, open the door and say that was uncalled for and walked away. He comes out again and says next time you can get a bagel instead of the English muffin. Well Manager of the Year, there won't be a next time!! 

Ok so! So many things wrong with this!! First of all a manager following me outside to argue with a customer!!! Outside!! Over a bagel!!! You seriously have nothing better to do? I never had time to do that when I was a manager nor was it something I wished to do and seek out. He was so mad about giving me a bagel he steamed over it and still felt he hadn't said enough! 

Second, let me inform some of you who might not know...those bagels you pay $2.00 and then some only cost about $.25 to make. Hmmm customer comes to my store spends $75, makes a valid point about what your crappy online menu says, give $.25 bagel to make customer happy. Most restaurant managers know the common sense in that! 

I seriously couldn't say enough about this! 
Uncalled for. Unprofessional. A frequent customer is now a nonexistent. I'm not happy about refusing to have their pastries!! But not worth giving any more of my money to them!!

I stopped by Bagel Cafe on a Saturday around 12pm, and there was about a 20 minute wait. I decided to take my order to go, which is convenient and super fast. I ordered a turkey pastrami sandwich on wheat with macaroni salad. While the man at the deli made my order, I browsed the dessert case. They have a wide selection of cookies and pastries, most of which are super sized. I decided on the chocolate cupcake, which looks like a jumbo version of a Hostess cupcake.

I am not a huge sandwich fan, but this one was pretty good. Fresh veggies, and a load of meat. Half of the sandwich was enough to fill me up, and I have a big appetite. The macaroni salad was actually pretty good too. The portion was tiny and it's a little sweet, but I'd get it again. The pickle - don't bother. It had the most odd taste, and it's more like a cucumber than a pickle. Thankfully, was free.

I was really excited about the cupcake, but sigh. The ganache on top is done really well. The cake, however, is incredibly dry. There isn't enough ganache or cream filling to save the cake. You'll need a glass a milk with this one.

I added a bag of chips and CJ's Italian ice to my order, and my total was a little more than $20. A little pricey, but the food was pretty good.

Overall, very good experience. I will check them out again.

I live right around the corner from this place so I make it a point to try to come as much as I can. I absolutely LOVE it here. It's rather small, and it's best to come 1-4 people. It's loud and noisy also. The portions are big and the flavor is even bigger! I recommend the jalapeño cheese bagel with  regular cream cheese or the jalapeño cream cheese. Yummy with a spicy kick. All of their bagels and spreads are homemade too! They also serve breakfast, lunch, & I think dinner.  Their steak & egg breakfast is so yummy. As is their club sandwich. They also have a bakery section where they have all kinds of treats to choose from. Tiramisu, cookies, cakes, brownies, ginormous cinnamon rolls, muffins, pies, and lots of other things.

It's a very cute mom & pop setting with amazing food, service, and a great atmosphere. Not a good place if you want peace & quiet but it's a good place if you want a good hearty meal!

I spent my formative culinary years in New York City.  I know a good bagel!  That doesn't make me Einstein, nor will we mention that name again in a review about bagels.  I am happy to say I have officially named The Bagel Cafe the second best bagel in Las Vegas.  You might think that is no big deal, but it took me more than 20 repeat visits to issue this award.   Now let's get on with the details.

The place is apparently owned by one of two brothers.  I heard the other brother owns the bagel place at Suncoast.  I also heard they don't get along.  It's just a rumor...  but an interesting one.  The bagels here are nearly perfect.  A certain hardness is required on the outside to match a chewy inner bagel.  They come real close to New York perfection here.  They have all the required varieties, and appropriate toppings.  Whitefish salad to Cream Cheese and Salmon they have it all and it's tasty.  The service is typical New York style.  No warm friendly teenagers who want you to know their name here.  More like veteran deli personnel who are bored stiff with your order.   That is not a complaint, by the way.  I love it all.  I feel like I am down on East 14th street all over again.  

The food comes quickly with no fanfare.  The plates and trimmings are all deli standard.  The restaurat is clean and even the bathrooms aren't awful, though the line can get out of hand and make things unpleasant.  If you on weekends, plan to wait in line.  If you are a fan of NY deli... plan to spend some $ after the meal in their deli.  Grab some lox and bagels to go.  I'd even pick up a bag of Wise chips for lunch tomorrow.  (The plain Wise chips still make me salivate at the thought of opening the bag).  Very reasonable pricing so it won't break the bank.  Parking is tight so leave the SUV at home... please.  

Overall, a great bagel experience with all the trimmings.  So are you wondering where the best bagel in Las Vegas can be found?  Well, I might let you know one day soon.  For now I will keep the lines there short and just give you one hint.  The guy that owns the best NY bagel place in Las Vegas... possible the best on the West Coast.... isn't from NY.  He's from Chicago.  Say it aint so.....

I really enjoyed the whole vibe of this place! I didn't have to wait for a server to take my order which is always a plus. The portions were huge! I got the lemon pepper turkey bacon on a sourdough bagel which was great. Only thing is it had no mayonnaise which i guess many people don't like i just thought it was weird that it originally didn't come with it. Any way the experience was great food was great price was good. Will definitely be coming here again and recommended to my co workers as well.

I have been to The Bagel Cafe quite a few times. I've been there for breakfast and dinner. But mostly I go there to pick up a bagel and cream cheese. My favorite is the jalapeño cheddar bagel with jalapeño cheddar cream cheese. I usually get that and then one other bagel cream cheese combo and split them with my wife. I really like their bagels and they have a very good selection of homemade cream cheese. Their other food is good too.

I have wanted very much to come here, as they were touted on their bagels and Jewish deli-ness. I was pleased that it was more spacious than I expected, with tables and a counter for seating. The bagel selection was good and the pastries looked wonderful. But I was here for a favorite--bagel, schmear, and lox. The first annoyance was the lack of a "please seat yourself sign", but that was minor. The next annoyance was that there was no bagel-shmear-lox item on the menu. I had to order a bagel and a small Nova platter. The waitress was good in asking if I wanted capers, as of course I did. The bagel did come with an adequate amount of schmear; I often have to ask for more but here I didn't. The small Nova platter was a major disappointment. There were a lot of greens (more than I needed of lettuce, tomato slices, cucumber slices, and a half a pickle) but an insignificant amount of lox. The good delis I know in Cleveland and New York would have been ashamed. I am sure that much else is good, but this is not.

The best Jewish deli outside of NYC! Bagels are always fresh, the array of schmears makes it difficult to decide on one or two, which results in gluttonous shopping experience...
The rugelachs are buttery and flaky. My favorite is apricot raisin. 
Their matzo ball soup is filled lots of chicken, delicious large matzo balls that looks, smells and tastes like what Bubbie used to make! 
The kids love their black and white cookies, the chocolate mousse cake is delightful!

Service: 5 Stars 

The place was full and we were seated after 30 seconds and had our drink order taken and had our drinks within 2 minutes. I didn't time it was just noticeably fast ! 
Our server was very nice. 


Food quality: 5 Stars 
There food has always been good when I came. Everything seems to be very fresh. I generally order the nova lox. For lunch I order a pastrami. This place has that New York Bagel Deli vibe. 

Parking/location: 1 Star 

Beware this place has the worst parking ratio ever, and people don't know how to park so when there is a space chances are you won't be able to park there so just be patient people. Lol


Presentation: 4 Stars 
I'd prefer my food to be prepared for me rather than them bring out the Nova lox platter for me to make my own bagel. Or at least provide the option.

I came here for a late brunch and we just missed the rush! We were seated right away and greeted with service the moment we sat at our table with menus. (I love breakfast places that have newspapers as their menu!) They have different types of bagels! I wanted the sun-dried tomato bagel, but they ran out. I ended up ordering garlic and onion one and it was okay. I also ordered the lox & bagel. That was delicious! I love smoked salmon and it came with a lot of olives and other condiments, but not enough salmon! Its a very cute breakfast joint, but I wasn't impressed. They do have a lot of desserts, breads, and other pastries! They look better than the food. I want to come back just to try their desserts!

Something has changed at the Bagel Cafe and it is not good!
All new faces jerry the manager and most of the old staff is gone 
Waited 45mins to get seated when they had empty tables 
Owner walks around in a daze doesn't know what's going on 
Maybe time to retire 
Got seated and waited another 10 mins b-4 any one came by 
Won't be coming back here any time soon 
Use to be a great place sorry to see it go down like this 
Time to fine a new deli

Best Sicilian omelet I've ever had, so fresh and amazing!!!! The bakery is off the chart!!!!! The sandwiches are unreal!!! And the chicken noodle soup is the BEST soup I've EVER had, especially with a hangover!!

I recently dined at the Bagel Cafe and I was so surprised at the authenticity of the food offered.  I am from the East Coast and the offering made me feel so at home! Kishka, Salami and other 'old style' food I had in Canada was fantastic.  The bakery was also top notch.
First time in, great bagel! They get one star because employees rude and unprofessional.
The food is delicious. They have organic eggs and coffee :) the staff is wonderful and highly attentive. Great asset to the las vegas community.

The closest you'll get to New York deli in Las Vegas by far. Large selection of bakery items and bagels in addition to the restaurant. We came for lunch and I had the roast beef dip with matzo ball chicken soup, both of which were fantastic. Only giving three stars due to the wait in getting our food (a little slow for lunch, it gets pretty crowded) and I felt like prices were just slightly north of what I'd prefer. Otherwise, another great off-Strip hidden gem in Las Vegas.

This is one of the better Jewish delis in town.

There bagels are better than the chain bagel shops in Vegas, they have a wonderful variety of bagels and cream cheeses, and they do some wonderful Jewish classics as well.

One of their most popular items is their matzo ball soup.  I am absolutely a fan!  Theirs is a classic version that highlights the matzo ball...oddly enough.

I used to live down the street from Bagel Cafe.  I ended up rotating through a series of breakfast bagel sandwiches, but one of my favorite is still over-easy egg, ham, and provolone on an everything bagel.  They have such solid ham for a Jewish Deli!

This is a place I want to go to with grandmotherly woman and enjoy some wonderful conversation over breakfast.

Had breakfast here this AM and it was very crowded. Never had a bad meal in this place. A little pricey but all good delis are.
Bagels are made correctly, boiled and baked. Great assortment of flavored cream cheese and s bakery to die  we will be going back often when I get a craving for a good, big bagel

This is a fantastic breakfast and lunch place.  It also has a great deli counter.  When living in Vegas, we eat here at least twice a week.  The only reason I don't give it five stars is the owner's attitude toward mistakes from the kitchen.  He isn't  really concerned about it, but mistakes happen so seldom that it doesn't matter too much.  A must visit regardless of whether you live in Vegas or are just visiting.  GET OFF THE STRIP occasionally...

I love their Matzo ball soup and their chicken salad. The best combo in the world is the Matzo ball soup with a 1/2 chicken salad on an everything bagel. They actually give you the entire bagel with a "smaller" portion of chicken salad. But, the portion is not small. I can eat one half with my soup and enjoy the other later.

I love the butter cookies and the chocolate rugula from the deli. I usually get these to go and enjoy these at home.

The counter is unfriendly though. I always feel rushed and have to put on my big girl pants to get my order. I don't understand why it has to be this way. The waitresses are friendly. But, I guess they have to go with the rude deli to make it feel authentic.

Had the bacon omelet bacon in Every bite cooked to perfection, with a toasted blue berry bagel and plain cream cheese, pastrami sandwich, eggs Benedict were amazing!! Everything is super delicious. The staff was really friendly and quick with service. Also, stopped at the bakery to grab some cookies super delicious! Will be going back to try their lunch and dinner food items.

The lox and cream cheese is the best I have ever had. The dessert case looked great but I was too full to partake. The restaurant was really busy is you can tell it is enjoyed by a lot of people. The bagels were fresh.

This place is awesome. I take my sister to Fyzical Therapy in the mornings and I was starving! It was first time here and they girl at the front was very helpful. The ordering area is a little confusing but everyone is willing to help you along. My sister wanted a bagel and I wanted eggs. I ordered a cheese and sausage omelette. It can with potatoes (they call them homemade fries) and a bagel. It only cost $13 for both of us to eat and the portions are perfect. My only suggestion would be to made add some seasoning to the eggs and put the cheese in the omelet. Other than that it was perfect!

Amazing every single time. I've been coming here for years with my grandma and they never disappoint. Their bagels & bakery are amazing! My go to is the sourdough bagel with garlic cheddar cream cheese & the mini eclair. My grandma love the olive pimento cream cheese with the spinach bagel & the almond cookies. My husband gets the breakfast bagels and says they are always amazing!! Seriously it's worth the wait here!!!! Obsessed!

I have been a "customer" of bagel cafe for many years. The word customer is in quotes because I never feel like a customer, but rather a burden to everyone.  I always get orders to go, and the guys behind the counter simply aren't friendly, and the girls at the cashier are equally drab and uninviting.

Funny thing about Jewish deli's....it's the one type of restaurant that I'm willing to tolerate attitude from the servers and staff, that sort of New York attitude where they might seem to be rude but really aren't, it's just their style.  And the reason most tolerate it also is because the food is so good it doesn't matter.

However, this isn't the case here. The staff has a terrible unfriendly attitude, and guess what...the food is NOT in fact good enough to justify it. This is no Nate n Al's, or Brent's, two outstanding LA favorites.  This place is marginal at best, and it's amazing to me they are the only deli on the entire West side. Now, maybe Cantor's will change things, but from what I hear of their prices, probably not.

So for now I remain a sad deli fan, sad that the only semi reasonably priced deli anywhere near me treats me like an unwelcome stranger, and in exchange I get food that the people in LA, not to mention NYC, would laugh at.

Unspectacular breakfast and lunch place. The bagels are larger and chewier at Smith's, and half the price of Bagel Cafe.

I tried their french toast. Just basic, and kinda disappointing because I'd heard good things about this place from friends. Save yourself a couple bucks and get a Grand Slam. 

Nothing to write home about, and for breakfast, the Sunshine Cafe on Decatur and Washington has cozier ambiance, and much yummier food.

Wow what a disappointment. Haven't been here in 4 years ( due to moving actress town )  and the whole experience was SAD! 

1- Cold food 
2- Kyle our server was very overwhelmed ( ask for help dude!! ) 

For the price of the meal and the sad experience. It'll be a long time until we return.

The service here is genuine. We loved the variety. There is definitely food options here food any kind of foodies. There's lots of table space compared to many bagel places I have been to. The coffee was flavorfully bold. I had the nova lox Benedict which was the best I've ever had. I'm very much looking forward to coming back!

I just had a good laugh at Misti and Bobby's reviews... the bagel burning and Bobby writing in all caps is too funny.  Okay that's off my chest... now to the review

I kinda really like this place!  That pastrami sandwich, my god I love it.  Even the pickle it is served with is fantastic.  

Corned beef hash... homemade, also fantastic.  I would know which one to pick from if I was here alone.  Corned beef hash and eggs or pastrami sandwich, very difficult decision.

I don't know if I'm being cheap, but the restaurant is a little pricey.  It's like 8 bucks for a cup of soup?  I'm not sure about that, and it says you can't share sandwiches on the menu, I'm not sure if I like that idea either.

Anyway, this place is great, I don't mind spending a couple of extra dollars and having a great meal, I'm excited about bringing my parents here, it's nice to know places like this exist in Vegas.

Potato Knisch! (Make sure you get the Gulden spicy mustard)
Bagels and cream cheese! 
And the most phenomenal bakery case full of gigantic pastries. My goodness! 
This is my go to bakery and Knisch place.

We've eaten at the Bagel Cafe many times and have came to the following conclusion; the experience is truly an adventure. You have no idea whether your meal will be good or bad. My squeeze ordered corned beef hash and eggs. What she got was some peculiar tasting cold corned beef mixture. I ordered chopped liver on a bialy with a slice of onion. I got chopped liver on an onion bagel. Servers that we knew were missing; strangers were in there place. What happened? When we were checking out the cashier asked " How was your meal". Our answer was awful. Her response was "That's too bad". That's too bad!! Forgot to mention that this happened on a Saturday at 1:00 pm. In the past we always had to wait for a table at this hour; today we were told to choose any table and there were at least 6 tables available. What happened. What happened?

This is a family favorite! We came on a Sunday morning & I thought it would be PACKED as it usually is but luckily we were seated right away. Favorites are brisket, fruit cups, bagels (duh) & matzoh ball soup. I'd skip the potato pancakes, they are so thick & never seem to be cooked through enough. Black & white cookies are a staple that you must try!

The lox platter with the works was amazing. The waitress was very prompt and pleasant, over bagel crisp and a dab of cream cheese while I waited for my food. Everything was off the chart. Brought extra napkins with meal, bonus, as eating a tower of cream cheese, tomato, onion, cucumber, capers and thinly slice lox (perfect) can be messy at times. The servers and bussers were around often to refill my coffee mug. Made me feel like I was on the East Coast at a NY Deli. I put the address on my phone screen to press and get me there, as I am new to Las Vegas. Still learning to get around.
I can't wait until I try their sandwiches. They looked awesome at the table next to mine. Best of luck, you have a great product. Got some pastry to go on Saturday back to eat on Tuesday.

I started this review with 4 stars, then changed my mind because I have nothing at all bad to say. Nothing but above average on all levels from service, to quality, selection, and price. I've dined here about 3 times and have stopped in for a bagel or dessert as well. (Jalapeño bagel with jalapeño cheddar cream cheese toasted) And you really can't go wrong with any pastry or dessert. To be honest I've never left without one or four regardless if I dine in. Fav menu selections include: chicken pot pie, crab cake Benedict, and the chicken salad sandwich. Someone in my party had the smoked salmon and it was also great. Grabbed a strawberry rhubarb pie for thanksgiving, again everyone approved. It gets pretty busy, but the staff is on it. If you need something from the deli remember to speak up! This IS an east coast Jewish style place remember. The guys behind the counter are beyond helpful. Bottom line, I'd your in the area, check this place out for lunch or breakfast!

Today I tried the everything bagel and the jalapeño bagel tried them with the veggie cream cheese but it tastes a lot of just onion... by far I think the everything bagel is better. With that purchase I got elephant ear bread I love it. Kind of hard to catch the workers attention though but would love to go again to try more things

I've heard from a lot of NY transplants that The Bagel Cafe is the closest they've gotten to an authentic bagel in Las Vegas so I obviously had to try it.... And I wasn't disappointed! I love the cafe atmosphere and there is such a huge selection of food, and also love the quick counter to grab and go. The 4 stars is for their prices... I think it's a little high for some of their plates but I do agree that the quality is worth it.

Wow!! I'm not an avid reviewer but this place definitely deserved taking the time to write one! 
My experience started with their bagel breakfast sandwich which was the ABSOLUTE BEST breakfast sandwich I've ever had...and I LOVE breakfast sandwiches!

The bagels and speciality cream cheese are perfect as well! 

This is def going to be a frequent stop for me! Very happy I found it!

Didn't feel like the bagels were much like NYC style...bagels were large which is great for quantity purposes but isn't like actual NYC bagels which are smaller

Had the knockwurst and I'm pretty sure that it wasn't knockwurst...the sausage I ate had a dark brown color while knockwurst is lighter in color....regardless of how u cook it...the sausage was an overpriced country sausage that u get cheaper at ihop

I decide to go in for breakfast today. And it was the best choice ever! Everyone was nice and polite. I got the Pastrami omelette. With and Egg Bagel and garlic cheddar cream cheese. For the price that I payed. It was worth every penny for sure. I'm definitely coming back with friends and family.
OMG best sandwiches in town !!! love the New York style coffee style.
It's the only Jewish deli in town.  If you miss a New York bagel, this is as good as it gets.
The crab cakes are the best I have ever had! This is a great place I highly suggest breakfast!

As an ex-NYer, I have a pretty high standard of bagel. These did not disappoint, but I wouldn't say they are truly singular in their yumminess. My review is based solely on these, as we did not try the desserts or anything else. Some of the bagels seemed "fresher" than others, and if you've ever had a NYC bagel before 8am, you know the expectations I have. I also feel like the bagels were kinda skinny, and the holes were big. I'm used to really fat, chewy but pillowy ones. Sigh.

But it really pains me to give anything lower than 4 stars, as they have a lot of traditional Jewish/NYC deli delicacies, which you really don't see out here in LV. If that is your thing, you really should check it out! The rye bread with caraway seeds looked good. The dessert section also piqued my interest. Please don't get a black & white cookie - Hell will freeze over before anyone ever likes those, trust me.

The shop is located in the weirdest shopping complex - it feels like a dr's office belongs here. Inside, it was pretty poppin' (it was Sunday), but the line wasn't bad. 

All in all, I will be back again to try more.

YUM!  Great bagels and great breakfast.  A little pricey for breakfast and the owner guy is a bit of a condescending jerk.  If we didn't like the food so much I don't think we would be back because of him.  Overall the food is quality and the waitresses are friendly.

The food is fantastic and the portions are huge, it's close to my house and it's never a let down.  The only reason why it didn't give 5 stars is because the service always feels rushed. I get that  they have a line of people waiting all the time (that's a great thing) but every time I come I'm still either taking a last bite out of my sandwich and I still have a piece in my hand and they are trying to clear the plate or dropping the check halfway through the meal.  I get that they don't want people hanging out for a long time but I would like to enjoy the delicious food they put out.  

Don't forget to stop at the Togo counter and take home some goodies for later.

Went there today for the first time and probably had the worst service I've had in a while. We sat down for 20 minutes and no one ever took our order or even approached our table and the restaurant wasn't busy. We got up to do take out because we were so frustrated and that took another 10 minutes because of the lack of organization in the back and we were 3rd in line. Not impressed. Don't think we will be back.

First time I came in and I am amazed I have not stopped by since I have lived here for 15 years.  I stopped for quick breakfast snack to keep me energized for my day. Had a bagel and egg and cheddar sandwich. House made bagel was very satisfying.  The counter staff was friendly and helpful during this visit. 

What gets me excited to come back for another visit was the pastry case.  OMG! The desserts looked decadent and crafted with skill. I cannot wait to stop by just for dessert..... And the one of their pastrami sandwiches stacked to the ceiling.

Lox me up and throw away the key!

This Jewish deli is a local's paradise. Come here to get your bagel and lox fix, you will not regret it. 2 oz smoked fish  of your choice, we chose (nova), a bagel of your choice for $11.95. My fiancé and I chose the everything bagel with scallion cream cheese and nova lox since it's less saltier than the belly lox. Very fresh and meaty smoked salmon with just the right saltiness. It comes as a platter with red onion, tomatoes, lettuce, cucumber and some olives. I loved the cream cheese, it tasted freshly made plus they don't skimp. Of course the bagel was the star of the show. The everything bagel was super plump and airy with the right amount of crisped edges. Flavor rating: 5/5

We also tried the belly lox but we felt that the saltiness was a little bit too much for us. Flavor rating: 3/5

We also ordered a bagel sandwich: jalapeño cheddar bagel with pepper jack cheese, scrambled egg, and bacon for $6. Super simple but the fresh bagel really shines and made everything come together for the perfect bite. The jalapeño and cheddar flavor were equally weak, however the texture of the bagel was great. Flavor rating: 3/5

And for the road we ordered a raisin bagel with cinnamon raisin walnut cream cheese $3.50. They hook it up with the cream cheese so that there is enough to spread equally onto the giant plump bagels. I really loved the cinnamon walnut cream cheese! It's sweet and creamy and went well with the raisin bagel. Flavor rating: 5/5

This place is quite the spot to be at during breakfast and brunch hours so be prepared for a hectic environment. The service is a bit scattered and we were a little bummed that the hostess was clueless on the menu when we asked her a few questions (What was Nova? What are the popular items on the menu?) Hopefully they will have their staff trained up and as enthusiastic about the menu as we are!

The service was good, not great.  A very busy place and I'm not sure why?  The bagels are good.  I ordered the corned beef sandwich, I left most of it on the plate, it was so fatty I couldn't eat it and it definitely wasn't worth the money. I won't be back.

Great NY style deli.  We always order the fish platter (lox and whitefish) and they have a wide selection of homemade bagels and spreads.  A bit pricey but tastes darn good.  They also have great lunch food like matzo ball soup and overstuffed deli sandwiches and beautiful desserts!
The salmon plate is perfection! Second visit, with the same order. There smoked salmon is soo good! I would also recommend their potato pancakes! The lattes are great as well!

Why do your bagels taste so good???? Ugh pool seaon is right around the corner and here we are putting away the Carbs.  Oh well extra time at the gym!  Of course they have the most amazing desert selection.... Keep up the good work

I stopped in just to see if they had pumpkin bagels and to my sweet surprise -- yes they do!  They are amazing, just the right amount of cinnamon and nutmeg so yummy!  I also got a few pieces of the apple rugala - soo good! The pastry reminds me of baklava filo dough -- nice, light and flaky!  Check out their fall treats!

I've eaten here several times and its always been good breakfast and lunch food. However my last visit, the food wasn't that good. I ordered a knish with matzo ball soup. The soup, as always was delicious. The matzo ball was pillowey goodness. Unfortunately the knish was a different story. I ordered the one with meat. I cut into the top, unfortunately I couldn't cut all the way through because the bottom was rock hard. Almost as though it had spent too much time in the microwave to heat up. The meat was also very dry. Our waitress was awesome, I showed it to her and she ask if she could replace it for me. I said sure, I'll try the potato pancake. Again, it was overcooked. Very chewy... it did have great flavor. I love supporting local, so I will definitely be back However I may just stick to the bagels. They're always good!
First time in Vegas and really glad I came! Great breakfast if you're on this side of town

It has been years since I have had access to a bagel shop. When I was in Miami, I lived next to a great Jewish Bagel shop that made great bagel sandwiches that I would hit up all the time. But after moving to WV, I learned to make my own bagels, which were good but not quite up to par with the pros yet.

So seeing this place so close to home was nice. I stopped in for a bagel sandwich but didn't realize how big and happening this place was on a Sunday afternoon. Fortunately, everyone was waiting for a table for Brunch, so I was able to make an order for take out right away at the deli. 

The deli is packed with all sorts of goodies that send my mind into a diabetic coma. Chocolate fudge cake, black forest cake, NY cheesecake, Babka, rugelach, all forms of cookies, bagels, cream cheeses and deli meats. My mouth watered just thinking about it. :)

I ordered a toasted poppy seed bagel with eggs, cheddar cheese, and pastrami - plus a slice of chocolate fudge cake. One thing I figured out was they go big here. The slice of cake felt more like the whole cake, and the bagel was very big - I like that a lot.

Once I got home and digged into it, I was pretty pleased with it. Bagel was nicely toasted, and made for a good sandwich. The chocolate fudge cake is everything you would expect it to be - chocolaty and fudgy, lol. It is very large, and could easily have been cut into 3 slices that each would have been considered big. 

While it is not quite as good as my old place, it is good enough to warrant me coming back. :)

This deli is where I first discovered the famed black and white cookie. My life has really never been the same since, truth be known.

Last year, when I went home for Christmas, my mom took me here with a large amount of gift certificates and encouraged me to select whatever I wanted. Thus, I have tried almost everything the deli has to offer, and it's all good. Seriously. From tuna salad to bagels to pastries, Las Vegas has a really great East Coast style deli and this is it.

The closest thing you will find to a real New York Style Deli in all of Las Vegas! This place reminds me so much of places I used to frequent on the East Coast. Pastrami Sandwiches, matzo ball soup, bagels and schmear...the list goes on. Black and white cookies are legit. Their pastry case is to die for! I could just stand there all friggin day. Bagel Cafe, I am happy I found you amongst these fake New York style delis in Vegas that serve mediocre food for way to much money! See you soon

My friends and I stumbled upon this place while trying to eat outside of the strip! Thanks to the YELP APP that helped us discover this AWESOME place!!! We all LOVED it here!!! 

It seems like a family owned place and the service does NOT get ANY BETTER than it does here! Everyone was SOOO incredibly friendly and why are the portions so freaking huge?! Oh, I'm sorry, did that sound like I was complaining--cause I SURE WASN'T!! I had the crab cake eggs benedict--HELLO AMAZING! Combine things I love, eggs, bread, hollandaise sauce, and *drum rolllll* CRAB CAKES--I AM SOLD! I also tried their Spinach Feta bagel with the jalapeno cheddar cream cheese---I thought I was in HEAVEN! Seriously their food is delicious! Huge portions, great prices, and AMAZING service! Their hours are a little odd, but they're in the middle of what looks like a business/corporate area so I assume they're usually open to accomodate the surrounding businesses/offices. 

Friends got a variety of sandwiches boy were they HUGE! 

I think we'll be coming back here the next time we're in Vegas and want to eat off the strip. Plus they're Bakery/Deli area is AMAZING! I'm TOTALLY getting something the next time I come here!

Probably the best bagel place in town! Old-school, NY feel with authentic menu items. The variety is great, but make sure you get here early as the more popular bagels will sell out later in the day. The nova lox cream cheese, black-and-white cookie and Matzo ball soup are definite must-try items.

I love this place. The food is good but the service can be spotty. I've been here several times and I just can't place what it is. It's not that they don't care, it's that everyone is running around frantically. You almost have to flag them down so that they slow down and listen to you. It can be a bit frustrating, especially at checkout when you haven't a clue where to stand and they keep helping the people at the bakery/deli counter. Just speak up and say "Hey I need to pay!"

Great place, sometimes think they need more seating and some healthier options, hence the missing star. 
They are the only ones with spinach knish, not just potato. The matzah ball soup is great! And fresh bagels are great. Best place for brunch meals to go.  too bad it isn't more convenient for me!

My wife and I try to come here once a week. They have great traditional food and amazing pastries. I love thier fresh made cream cheese with awesome flavors, however I usually end up getting the same thing every time. Everything bagel with real nova lox cream cheese. Ive also had the matzo ball soup which is very good.

The food was great no denying that. I'm trying to cut down on my salt intake so when I order the matzoh ball soup I asked for a cup of hot water, yea, well I got the water and when I received the bill later they had charged me $1.00....for a hot cut of water. Thought that was pretty ridiculous, but hey took it off of the bill for so I guess that was nice. 
*woof*

Love this place!

I don't eat breakfast often, but when I do, I prefer The Bagel Cafe. Stay hungry my friends.

Seriously though, this place has the dopest bagels and pastries. The best part about it? They don't taste overly sugary! I could literally eat a cookie, a black coffee and a jalapeno and cheese bagel every day. 

The ONLY reason this place gets knocked off of the perfect 5 stars is because of service at the cashier. Just because it is a New York-style eatery, does not mean you can treat your customers like they're Bostonians. The cashier was pretty rude when I was taking out my money to pay as if I should've already had it out and ready...really?

Anyways, if you don't mind the people when you eat somewhere, definitely come here! If you do mind service, STILL come here, but bite your tongue when speaking to the cashier.

my son stopped by the other day and brought me a black and white cookie.. it was devine. But I knew that because Talia is the best baker and cake decorator there. I will be coming in soon... I need another cookie...


ok....went for lunch...had a half turkey sandwich and OMG they have COKE love it. Hubby had a brisket sandwich and loved it... we bought so many desserts. ok first of all, the turnovers have to be at least 12-15 inches long... huge... bought a apple one a cherry one, we also bought a chocolate cream filled cupcake which my husband wolfed down, lol... I got 2 butter cookies with sprinkles, a black and white cookie, and 2 wedding cookies... mmmmm I had to use my food saver to keep them fresh because with donuts and sweets from Bagel Café. my waistband might pop.. lol

It's a busy place.  Get seated as soon as you can.  Love the newspaper style menu and the waitress was friendly, helpful since it was my first time there.  Lots of breakfast choices  depending on how hungry you are - servings are definitely huge you can probably share it with another!  Limited parking tho - it's located in a business center in a busy intersection. I only had fruit that morning mainly because I was still recovering from a tattoo session -  tho it was carb heaven with lots of bagel choices, egg omelette of every kind.  Next time you are up for a huge, satisfy the craving breakfast after a great workout or cheat meal that's the place to be!
Service and sandwiches were terrific. I love the Pastrami Reuben with col slaw replacing the sauerkraut. Messy but wonderful. Sandwiches are definitely large enough to share.
It's hard to find decent deli anywhere anymore even Las Vegas The Bagel Cafe is very decent.

This place has all the good NYC hometown foods!  Being a native NY-er & currently living on the west coast, I miss my hometown foods!  This place has bagels made like In NYC.  They have the shiny outside & the chewy texture like in NY bagels.  Cream cheese is deli-whipped.  They offer lox, pastrami, corned beef, knishes, a variety of deli meats, & a large bakery section.  We found NY-style cheesecake, Black & White cookies, rainbow cookies & a selection of Wise-brand snacks.  They offer a lot more than what I can write.  Ate there for lunch & everything was delicious!  Highly recommend!

Great bagels, great service, great price! I always get some fresh butter cookies to go because they are so yummy. This is a staple for locals so it's no wonder why it's voted "The Best of Las Vegas" year after year.

Caveat Emptor...let the buyer beware! We have been going here for the last few years and have seen a steady decline in customer service. We come from Arizona and purchased a few gift cards, which they told us we couldn't use because their system was down. Sounds bogus and supposedly the gift card system will be back up on Tuesday 10/14? I wonder...how do they know that? It's fishy to me. Not to mention the so-called host Jerry started screaming at me. Just amazed that these places get too big for their britches. By the way the food is on the downturn too, unfortunately. Bottom line: take care of the customer! They seem to have forgotten that.

I desperately want to like the Bagel Cafe more than 3 stars. I like bagels, I like cafes. Hence perfect match, right? The only think is that I cannot find anything I like beyond the bagels and pastries.

We used to go to the Bagel Cafe every weekend cause it was down the street from my bf's old domicile. I don't know if I am being fussy but I just don't like their omelettes or eggs for that matter. The eggs are always a bit overcooked for me and I really don't like their assembly. The omelette has a slice of cheese slapped on top. And since I am not a fan of bell peppers I do not like their seasoned potatoes. And it seems like every time I go their bacon is undercooked.

So the things I have liked so far are, of course, their bagels. My personal favorite is the sesame, my bf usually likes the asiago. The garlic cheddar cream cheese is good but it is so strong that after a while it leaves a bitter taste in my mouth. I also like the cheese blintzes, they are very large and full of sweet cheese. Tthe potato pancakes are pretty good as well.

Edit: for clarity

I got half dozen bagels, 2- 1/4 lb of cream cheese and 1/2 lb of lox to go, it cost $35.00! It is way over priced. I did not even get an itemized receipt. I could have been over charged for all I know. I was shocked. Their bagels are just as good as Einsteins. The customer service is poor. The cashier and the food helper never smiled or expressed gratuity for coming in.

I finally stopped in after passing it on the road many times. Since it's The Bagel Cafe, it would have been a shame not to order something without a bagel. I decided on the Bagel and Lox platter and I was not disappointed. It came with tomatoes, onions, olives, cucumbers, pickles, and of course lox. Combined with my Everything Bagel, there was plenty of food to make me full. It was all quality ingredients, good food, and served by a friendly staff! I also bought some cookies on my way out, which I also enjoyed. I'm hoping to make it back for breakfast!

Almost 4 years we've been coming to this place. it's still as awesome as ever. The consistent quality is a major plus. I have never had a bad order. Their lox spread reminds me of home...NYC. Their olive spread beasts anything I've tried. Let's put it this way...They could compete with any bagel shop in NY off they relocated there. But pricing of course would have to change on their menu items. That's the premium we pay for living 2500 miles away. 
They have amazing fruit plates, amazing...no, beyond amazing lobster salad (the shrimp salad was good but nothing ridiculous), and my go to standard when dining in is the lox platter...oh, I'm kvelling.
Poor service on a Wednesday not busy at all everyone before us got their food way before we even ordered 20 minutes after we got there we got our order taken.

Walk in to Bagel Cafe on a weekend and it's a madhouse. There are long lines to order from their deli and bakery, long lines to be seated, and a dining room packed to the gills. When you do finally get seated you'll find a large menu full of fairly inexpensive items and portion sizes that beg to be shared. Challah French toast consisted of about four thick, egg-drenched slices. A pretty good version, for sure, but one that was too hefty for one person to finish. On my way out I grabbed a chocolate fudge cake that was too sugary sweet, a creamy plain cheesecake that was light and airy, and a huge M&M cookie for my kid which he quickly devoured.

3.5 Stars

Most disappointing experience ever. 3 of our party of 5 ordered biscuits and gravy which should be an easy meal. Instead when one of our members dipped his bacon into the gravy, he brought up the bacon and there was long strands of hair in the gravy. The waitress was immediately notified and she did promptly take away his plate. The remaining plates were no longer touched and asked to be removed as well. The general manager then came over and stated that the hair was not blended in the gravy and he didn't see the problem!!! Unacceptable!!! Never will I step foot in these doors again and will make sure not to refer anyone here. The manager needs basic customer service training and our waitress needs to not roll her eyes and both need basic manners.
I been coming her since 1995 when they first open and it seems to only get better. Fresh selection of soups, sandwich meats and best bagels in town. Bakery is amazing too.

Good bagels, wish they had pork roll though, if your from Nyc or NJ you get that pork roll is LIFE! Honestly the food is very over priced in my opinion, but it's good and let's face it, where else do we have to go in Vegas besides here for bagels that are good ! I do love the matzo ball soup! 

The only negative , as to why they only get three stars is the customer service! It needs improvement, as I've been there many times and always feel it's lacking! The last visit my boyfriend ordered take out, two soups, and some bagels! Sadly when we got home , we noticed our pricey chicken noddle soup had zero chicken and hardly anything but broth, clearly we were unhappy but whatever we'll just call up and get reimbursed which who really cares, we go there often so even a note on the account for next time works. Well that didn't happen, the manager told us to keep one, and bring it back so we can see before they close, umm we live on the other side of town! That's all they could do in order to give us a new soup? Who seriously  wanted to drive all the way back when we drove 30 minutes just for the soup! 

***So basically if they mess up any take out order, remember to keep the food and drive back and show them since they can't just leave a note for the next time! Seriously guys?**
OMG! I. Forgot to mention their French fries! I think they are double fried or something because it was a pile of salty extra crispy goodness.

This place gets crowded. Waited 20 min for a table at 12:30pm during the lunch rush. it clears out after 1:30pm, no waiting after the lunch rush. The portions are HUGE here with the typical Deli style sandwiches and bagels.  The bakery has great items too.

MAJOR FAIL.  Went to grab some food at the deli. Drove all they way there gave my order which the main reason was for soup with matzo balls.  Get all the way back home and found the screwed my order.  
So if there is a next time I go grab takeout and you are behind me don't get nuts while I stop and go through the whole order piece by piece. Last time I leave a big top too guys

The omelet I received was not what I ordered.  I told the waiter and he offered to correct it, but we had already waited a good 15 minutes for our food to arrive, and I declined his offer as my boyfriend's food had arrived and we were hoping to eat together, as most people do when they go out.  We then realized my boyfriend never received the bread he requested -twice!  We asked the waiter again, but no bread.

Realizing our bad experience, the waiter offered to "comp" my omelet.  We waited, waited, waited, and then the mean manager sat at our table and started an argument about not wanting to "comp" food that was consumed.  When I pointed out the reason why I didn't want to wait ANOTHER 15 minutes for a correct order, and that my boyfriend never received his bread, being the reasons the waiter wanted to "comp" my meal.  

Manager ended up arguing with us, at which point we stood up and left.  We never asked for a "comp", it was offered to us by the waiter and yanked away by a grumpy manager.

Yummy matzoh ball soup served with your choice of bagel. I get mine with a jalapeño & cheese bagel and a coke. Great flavor combo. This place is popular with the jewish locals so it has to be good. More than decent portions. You can make 4 sandwiches from the meat in just one of their deli sandwiches. They renovated the interior so it looks cleaner and less divey than before.

I like perusing their pastry shelves after a meal. Some desserts are hit or miss but you can't go wrong with some chocolate covered strawberries and marshmallow twists.

Best Bagel of 2016!  Not even close, this place is #1.

I am obsessed with bagels.  When I am preparing for a trip anywhere, one of the first things I do is try to figure out where I'm going to get my morning bagel fix.  I don't eat bagels everyday, but I need to know where to score if I need a hit.

A toasted Everything bagel with a nice schmear of regular cream cheese and a cafe latte is just about my all time favorite on-the-go breakfast.  No breakfast burritos for me, thank you very much.  

The Everything bagels here are the best I've had all year.  Absolutely delicious and wonderfully chewy, they are as good as it gets.  

While they clearly know how to make bagels here, toasting them is another thing.  The seeds and other toppings on the top of the bagel were burnt.  Under the cream cheese, the inside of the bagel didn't appear to be toasted at all.  Should be the other way around, minus the burnt.

It was still delicious a delicious bagel, so I'm not deducting any stars. But it sure would be nice if they could address the toasting issue.  At home it's just a matter of switching the setting on the toaster oven from Toast to Broil: the insides get toasted and the seeds/nuts/onions don't turn an unappetizing black.  Surely there's got to be a way a restaurant can toast their bagels without burning the toppings.

The cafe latte here was also excellent, even though it was served at about 1,500 degrees F.  Watch out, McDonald's!

Parking is a huge issue here.  There are some 10-15 minute parking places right next to the restaurant, and if you are taking your order to go , that's fine.  If you are planning on sitting down, you're going to have to scramble for a parking place in the medical center's very crowded private parking lot.

This place is totally legit!  I'm definitely looking forward to trying some of the other things on the menu.  

Mikey C says: thank you, Yelp friends!  thank you, Bagel Cafe!

The food is amazing and if it weren't for the consistently inconsistent service and the fact they really aren't kid friendly they would have got a solid 5 stars from me!  This will probably be our last time coming here, but I would consider this a great place to get food to go like your typical bagel / deli back east.

I love love love this place :-) when Im sick I crave their chicken mazto ball and noodle soup :-) their bagels are great and you gotta pick up a black and white cookie while your there :-) i love their friendly New Yorker attitudes too. It does get busy here but i think its worth it. Try going during the week if you dont like real large crowds. Another thing is they have a $10 min to use your credit or debit card. I actaully came in at $9 and was going to add more to my bill since i didn't have cash on me but the girl smiled and said it was ok. I know it doesn't sound like much but i have been in places where they did make me buy extra when i was a dollar off, these small things don't go un-noticed with me :-)

Good portions and good food! If I lived in Las Vegas, I would definitely be a regular. I had corn beef, home fries, and eggs. My wife had French Toast which was GREAT! I would absolutely order the French toast again! My son had a massive Ruben sandwich. Prices were fair. Our service was a little slow but very friendly and professional.

Boyfriend had corned beef sandwich with potato salad. $13. I had corned beef hash with eggs and a bagel. $12. Ginormous cinnamon roll. $3. Hair boyfriend found in rye bread .... Free. 

After boyfriend found a long hair inside the bread I lost my appetite. He didn't let me say anything but it was so disgusting. Needless to say I was disappointed.

I've been here a few times over the years and I really like the balance of healthy and unhealthy options. The servers are always friendly too and we get seated quickly every time. The most recent time I visited, I got an everything bagel with 2 eggs, bacon, cheddar cheese and avocado. Living in NYC, BEC on a bagel or roll is a typical breakfast here and since the cafe is NYC themed, I figured I couldn't go wrong with that. I found it odd that the server asked how I wanted my eggs since usually they're just served in a patty like form (perfect for eating on the go) in NY. I said over medium was fine. When it was brought to the table, I was surprised that it was served open face. I guess this is so I could add any condiments I wanted to it..? Eating it was a bit messy since the eggs were runny (probably not a good choice; I should choose hard next time). That being said, it was delicious and very satisfying. I also had a mimosa which was delicious and some coffee after that. I redeemed the check-in offer for a free cookie which was really yummy and hit the spot after my meal. I always enjoy my meals here and it's a great choice for brunch; they just need to perfect the art of bagel sandwiches :)
I can't believe the Bagel Cafe charges $1.00 for hot water, are  you kidding me. Get lost. I'll never go back there

Bagel Cafe has the the best bagels in Vegas! Their pancakes and omelettes are on point.  They are always busy, but their service never falters. Their staff is very friendly and helpful. Love this place!

Listen up bagel (and dessert) lovers, this review is for you. I was visiting Vegas and came here with a friend who loves the place. We ended up coming 2, almost 3, mornings in a row because it was SO GOOD. 

When we first walked in, my eye was instantly drawn to the massive selection of desserts they have. I'm talking cookies, cupcakes, napoleons, eclairs the size of your face, and more. I wanted it all. Next to that was the bagel selection - there must have been somewhere close to 17 different bagels to choose from, along with a great variety of cream cheese. Too cool. We waited ~10 minutes to be seated and were quickly served water and day old bagel crisps with a sample of their newest cream cheese flavor. 

The menu is a little intimidating because it's large and there are many delicious items to choose from. I went for the egg sandwich with avocado on a garlic bagel and it was excellent and super affordable - plus, the side of avocado was basically a whole half of an avocado! The second day I got the same, but went for cheese instead avo (both cost extra) and I got it on the asiago bagel, which I preferred to the garlic. I must say, despite how good the bagels were, the star of this restaurant was the yogurt parfait - it arrived in a huge bowl with so much fruit, my jaw dropped - strawberry, raspberry, mango, bananas, kiwi, and more (see photo). Just wow. For dessert we had chocolate rugulah and it was perfection. 

Great service and amazing food. Do yourself a favor and visit this Bagel Cafe!

The Bagels are good.  I used to eat here often but it seems they have gone down hill since my last visit.  Eggs were "weird" Pancakes "soso"  Butter, jelly and syrup are all served in small togo type plastic single serve containers.  Service is good.  But didn't care for my meal more than once.
You must get a bagel! The cream cheese is fluffy and perfect! The jalepeno cream cheese is to die for! Everything tastes home made and great! Very attentive staff!

I have been buying bagels for my office from The Bagel Cafe for 2 years now. Always the freshest bagels and smear. However, this past weekend decided to have breakfast there. My husband and I each ordered an omelet. His was a Salmon Omelet and mine was a Mushroom and cheese Omelet. The time it took to get our order placed and brought in was about 30mins and this was when they weren't very busy at all. The waitress was not very responsive and when the food finally arrived she brought me a Sausage and Cheese omelet and immediately walked away from the table as soon as I noticed the error. It took 5 minutes for her to return and she already knew the error because she picked up the plate before I even started explaining. Within 5 minutes she returned with the correct order and apologized. The food was average. Would I go there again for breakfast dine in? Nope. I think Denny's and IHOP got a better deal and better menu for that. 
Only thing I would highly recommend is there bagels, smear and pastries.
I can't get tired of their delicious food and great customer service, I usually go for breakfast, they have fresh bagels and pastries everyday.
I LOVE the bagels here! I haven't actually sat down for a meal but anything I have ordered to go has always been great :)

My daughter and I had lunch the chicken noodle soup and matzo ball soup which were both very good potato pancake was really good and split corn beef sandwich was awesome I really wanted give give a 5 star but I can not cause our service was not so good but food 5 service 2

Real authentic east coast style deli/restaurant! The bagels are the best and I treat my self and the wife occasionally to a bacon,egg and cheese bagel for breakfast to go.  What more can you want? The lunches are great and the bakery is probably the best in Vegas. Check it out- you can go wrong here!

Best deli in town. Portions are huge but it pays to get a whole sandwich and take half home for left overs. Whether you pick corned beef or chopped liver, you won't be disappointed. The food is great! Most patrons are regulars and there is a friendly vibe going on.

Huge portions, fair prices and a wrap around case of baked goods means a very happy Yelper!  After going to Weiss a few months ago, my friends said "you need to try Bagel Cafe, it's the best Jewish deli around"!

Bagel Cafe has a very home-like feel to it and the menu is printed on a multi-page newspaper.  I went with a half-chicken salad sandwich that was still a decent size.  I kept eying my friend's large 1/2 sandwich he ordered which was loaded with meat and I don't think cost more than $15.

For dessert I went for their smaller sized cookie (the large is gigantic) but there is a whole slew of things to pick from at the entrance!!  Don't take my word for it though, billionaire Venetian owner Sheldon Adelson was at the table behind us!  I can't wait to come back and try more of the menu!
Best place for breakfast lunch or dinner.  Bring you appetite because they have large portions of great food.

The food here is great.  The service has been slow every time we come.  Last time we were seated 20 minutes before the waitress even acknowledged us.  This place is too big and too  busy for only two waitresses at dinner time.  We will keep coming for the Pastrami, Brisket and Black and Whites but we would come more often if the service was faster.

If you are a sandwich lover, welcome home. 
I'm not a sandwich lover, and they've made a believer out of me. I was running late and asked my friends to surprise order for me, and I ended up with a huge Reuben. No regrets! Best Reuben I've ever had and on beautiful, buttery bread! 

My friends had soups and sandwiches with bagels, but there's nothing wimpy about these soups and sandwiches. These are still meals that Nordic Vikings would be happy coming to after a bender of pillaging and conquering.

I've had their bagels before, and I don't think they are particularly extraordinary, but that's just me. Pastry cabinets here are full of very rustic pastries that didn't appeal to me much, but it's been working out for them! Something for everyone at The Bagel Cafe!
Great place for lunch. Soup, sandwiches, bagels, who could ask for anything more? Their pastries are yummy, but a little expensive.

Have been here many times and it is usually very good.  It has a New York feel but sometimes some of the staff have a New York attitude which is not acceptable in Las Vegas.  This time I went with some friends and ordered a chicken salad sandwich and found it to be tasteless.  They do have great bagels which I buy and bring home.  They are so thick I cut them in thirds, two ends and a middle and freeze them.  This way if I want a sandwich I use the two ends and if I just want bagel with eggs, etc I toast the middle.  They do have the best chicken matzoh ball and noodle soup.  Often I buy something from the bakery for my husband and they are all good.  He likes the muffins and I like the vanilla crumb cake.

All the food portions are giant and every ingredient is delicious! I love this place. 

Definitely the best biscuits and gravy I've ever had! And I love the sprinkle butter cookies. :)

When I heard about this place, I had one question - are the bagels any good.  The answer is yes.

Now, nothing beats a proper NYC bagel, but these are as close as you are going to get in Vegas.They have a MASSIVE selection of cream cheeses with which to dress your bagel, and lots of toppings to select as well.  The holy grail of bagels is the Everything, and mine was done right.  The seed and spice mixture was in perfect proportions, and they held to the bagel with aplomb.

I also found their black & white cookie to be spot on - a light and moderately lemony cake with delicate vanilla and chocolate fondant.  I'd go back just for that.

The staff seemed a bit overwhelmed or perhaps bored while I was there, and I wasn't blown away by the service, but I will be back regardless to try breakfast in the dining room.

This place is a great getaway from the usual breakfast and lunch restaurants, providing a wonderful deli/bakery counter that has great buys.  Everything is good here.  I tried their pastries, cookies, breads, and their bagels--of course.  What I love are the shmears that they make.  We had the caviar one and OH MAN was it good!

If you're looking for a great bakery and deli, come here.  They sell things you probably won't find anywhere else.

I stumbled upon this place while on a drive one day. It is a cute cafe, with huge display cases full of any type of sweet you can imagine, all look home made. They also have the biggest variety of bagels and cream cheese i have ever seen. 

I sat down, menus are pretty cute, they are newspapers. The food was out of this world! Everything was fresh and I enjoyed every bit of breakfast. I had the white fish salad and an egg, sausage, tomato bagel.
