I didn't give it five stars because of the service. They were quick to put my order in and i did receive my food not shortly after. However the waitress was overwhelmed with tables to get me my check. That part took almost twenty minutes. The staff does all help each other out and work together, which you don't see many places. I recommend going, just not when you are in a giant rush.

We came here on a Sat mid morning. Place was jammin and had about a 20 minute wait. 

Once we sat down, the drink server was right there to take our order. Food server was right behind her to take our order. 

Our food was delivered in a timely manner and was delicious- eggs Benedict and a nova and onion omelette ( no cheese). The home fries that came with the meal were wonderful. And they have fresh squeezed OJ!!!!

Oh and the bagels were amazing as well!!!  Will definitely be back!

New York Style Deli's are a touchy subject with me.  When done right, they are like staring into the face of God and having him smile back you and say "You are my most precious creation" but when done wrong, they make me sadder than Pauly Shore's acting career.  The Bagel is in the former category and can easily lay claim to best delicatessen in Las Vegas.

Judge a Jewish deli by five things:  The rye bread, the pastrami, the knish, the sweet & sour cabbage soup and if they sell the black & white cookie.  Alright, that last one might be homage to Seinfeld, but the other 4 will definitely tell you if a Deli is worth it's salt.  The Bagel has them down.  First, the rye bread is fresh and the perfect consistency.  Its got a nice crust and the heels are a perfect complement to any of their soups or sandwiches.  Speaking of soups, their sweet & sour cabbage soup is dynamite.  Chocked full of cabbage and with a simple beef bouillon to absorb the flavors, its a nice lunch on a cold day...to remind you of back home in Jersey.  The pastrami is like butter and practically melts in your mouth and if you want to get fancy, upgrade to a Reuben.  Finally the Knish....where do I began?  You are so good, I'm officially declaring myself on "a gravy train with knish wheels."  

So you're probably wondering why no five stars?  Well, the Bagel is excellent but I cant dis the original gangsta deli's like Brent's in LA, Manny's in Chicago or Katz's in New York by putting it on the same level so consider the Bagel 4 1/2 stars as it pays homage to the grand masters.  For Las Vegas however, you can't do any better.  

Ohhh, and you're probably wondering why I never even brought up their namesake as well.  Bagels here are good, but bagels are bagels.  They do have an impressive selection and to go is available if you're not dining in.  They also have a bakery that would make my Bubby declare this place "Meshugganah!" the portions are so large....

You've never had a French dip sandwich until you've had one made with brisket at the Bagel  Café ... Probably one of the best sandwiches I've ever had. The beef is tender, juicy and is piled high on a delicious crispy roll.   Maureen  had a pastrami sandwich on rye and  she absolutely devoured it. Both sandwiches were huge but we couldn't stop eating them. Suzy had her favorite, the stuffed cabbage. She loves this one and it too was huge.  
Sides of potato salad and coleslaw were excellent. Can't say enough about this place I wish it was closer to where we live in Henderson. Too far to make the trip more than once every couple months but we look forward to it.

My family and I have been eating here since the restaurant opened and have enjoyed the food. We hail from New York and felt at home here, even meeting weekly to catch up. But last week after my aunt ordered a cup of matzo ball soup with the matzo ball on the side we had a serious problem. When the soup was brought to us, the cup of soup was half full. We asked for more soup. We, after all, were paying $1 extra to have the matzo ball on the side.  We were told it was a measured amount....that's how they do it. Except it's not and we know because like I said, we've been regulars for YEARS. We asked for the manager who, instead of offering more soup, tried to justify the half cup of broth. So, it would seem that a few cents of broth was worth losing regular customers who have been loyal for almost 2 decades. All we wanted was a cup of soup! They were unwilling to budge and have lost our business.

I've literally been coming since I was a kid, same exact place with some incredible pastries and bagels!! FYI - it does get hectic on weekend mornings & one cashier could smile more but still it's all about the food!

Great service, always busy place, but the bagels are too heavy and too much dough. Some people may like it but for those who are on a diet, I have doubts you can lose weight, especially taking 14 bagels for a dozen, which is a great deal. Nice personal, everything would be OK, if these guys would make them less heavy. Maybe I should specially order them, because they do  taste great.
Place smells good I reccomend the snickers coffee drink it's like a frappuccino. Had the corn hash it was mediocre.

Bagels are amazing and fruit platter is so fresh! I will definitely be coming back here. I really felt like I walked into a diner in NYC. I lived in NYC for 3 years and it made me miss it so much! The service we encountered was fine, despite some of the other reviews and everyone was very helpful and patient with my mom and I as we decided on which yummy pastries to get. I can't wait to go back and try more!
Always good food old style deli.  Enormous bakery goods! Friendly staff. Busy on Sunday

Mega cool place. It's close to my house but somehow I never try it. On the outside looks like after church hub. Wrong big time. 
NY style type of breakfast place. Variety of food. Everything! I have many fav things now. It's a must go place !

Stopped in here today, after telling my dad I was getting a little tired of eating cereal for my b-fast and was thinking of bagels. Usually I go to Costco and pick up their bagels, but my dad ever the bagel fiend, went online and hunted for a bagel bakery. Lo and behold - Bagel Cafe! So I googled it up, and looked at the Bagel choices - YUUUUMMMINESS! There are 22 varieties - japeno cheddar, asiago, spinach and feta, sourdough, the everything bagel! Ok mouth is watering now. You can call your take out order in, and have it ready for you even! So I picked out my bagel choices and handed my dad the list to walk in and get, and figured on a 10 minute wait or so. Two minutes later he's walking back out bagels in hand! So have to give mad props for prompt customer service! Will have to wait another time to eat out, but will definitely come back this way.

Soup and sandwich is the best way to go b/c I'm always torn which way to go.  

Go with the matzo ball soup with either a Pastrami/Brisket/Corn Beef/Tongue. Sometimes I'll mix it up with the Lox and Bagle, which is scurmdiliumcious.  Honestly you can't go wrong with any sandwich.  For a hearty appetite, go for the 1/2 lb sandwich and soup.  You won't be dissapointed. 

Save your appetite to take home some bagels, cookies, and cake.  

Whenever I hit up this spot, i feel like I'm chillen with my J-Crew at the JCC - holla

This is the best breakfast joint in Vegas! Fresh bagels, awesome omelettes, freshest fruit cups,  delicious corn beef hash, eggs Benedict that will blow your mind, and the most amazing variety of pastries you'll ever see. 

I love that there is a also counter service: super fast, no nonsense, good stuff.

I love this place and I am sad that I don't get to have lunch here as often as I used to. This place reminds me of the Canters in LA, especially their deli and bakery.  They have a great menu. My favorites are the pastrami/corn beef sandwich, spanakopita (spinach pie) and matzoball soup. YUM!

a little pricey but the food is authentic east coast all the way
from the bagels to the corned beef, you feel like you are in a east coast deli
they also make amazing pastries etc.
probably the best bagels in vegas!!

Went here the other day with my family and grandparents. I needed to find a Deli style coffee shop type atmosphere to please my 80 year old grandparents who were visiting for a few days. My grandparents are Polish and Irish but this Jewish Style Bakery/Deli was right up there alley. My Grandpa and I ordered the appetizer size stuffed cabbage because for about $8.00-$9.00 my gramps had a hunch it was a pretty big portion. He was right! It came with rye bread as well. I'm sure the normal portion would be huge for the $12.00-13.00 range. We were very happy with the taste and I was also informed you can get the sauce on the side if you want to add to your desired liking. Another family member enjoyed the Pastrami sandwich which I am looking forward to trying soon.

With a few more great meals in the future at this place, I will have to elevate my rating to the 5 Star level. 4 for now until I'm wowed a few more times!

Oh my god, how I MISS The Bagel Cafe! My fiance and I moved to paradise, excuse me, North County San Diego, two years ago from Las Vegas, and we don't often miss it there. But I still think about The Bagel Cafe and I get super peanut-butter-and-jealous when I see my friends check in there on Facebook. 

If you're wondering what's good here, the answer is everything, seriously. The best part of coming here is buying deli stuff on the way out. My fiance was obsessed with the pumpkin cream cheese for awhile, and I liked bringing the deli tuna home and eating that for a few days. It kept fresh for awhile and it is the best tuna I've ever had. Nothing else compares. Obviously their bagels are the best. You cannot beat them. Also, I have to mention my family is Jewish and I hardcore judge any Jewish deli's chicken soup and matzo balls. Theirs doesn't beat my mom's, but it comes damn close. It beats mine, as hard as that is for me to admit! Plus when you order a soup, you get a bagel! My fiance loved their eggs and sausage specials and he'd try a different bagel/cream cheese combo with it every time we came. I'm a huge fan of ALL of their desserts too. They have a ton to choose from. It's been awhile so I can't remember specifically, but we'd always leave with a few and there were never any leftovers past the first day!

On top of the food being delicious, the service was always on point. Even when my brother and I took our mom there for Mother's Day and they were super busy, the service was great and quick.

My fiance and I still have not found a deli in San Diego to compare to the Bagel Cafe. Next time I visit, that's the first place I'll be hitting up!

Saying this place has the best bagel I have ever eaten is true, although I am prone to hyperbole, IT IS COMPLETELY TRUE!!! Oh my goodness, the salads are also darn good, but it may b e that anything you eat with these bagels will taste yummy.  Goodness, they are really Tasty. 
Darn, now I want one... or six.
They have the best bagels in Vegas! It reminds me of NY bagels and deli! Love this place!

No smiles from any staff member at the counter. Seemed bothered to have any customers. Grumpy atmosphere. Slow service. Took nearly 20 minutes to get a to-go order that was supposed to have already been ready.
Ordered from Uber Eats. I had the biscuit and gravy. It was great. The gravy had a bit of a kick to it and the sausage was good as well. I would recommend the biscuits and gravy.

Love, love, love this deli!  I have never had a bad meal here and actually get cravings for their hot pastrami sandwich with swiss cheese, cole slaw, and Russian dressing....oh, dear, feel another craving coming on!  See you this weekend!

A friend recommended this place to me, and I am so glad she did. Being from NY I really have missed the cafes and bakery options. This one is a Jewish cafe with plenty of Jewish food, but there's also lots of NY inspired options as well as typical cafe American fare. The latkes are amazing and probably the best place in LV to get them. Pizza bagels are a New Yorkers dream. But the standout item at this place are the HALF MOON COOKIES. I know, I know. They call them black and white cookies anywhere outside NY. Seriously, you need them in your life.

What's a good way to start Saturday Morning in Las Vegas....Bagels and Starbucks! 

The breakfast bagels came with cream cheese and we probably got about a dozen bagels. The bagels were tasty, definitely a little hard on the outside but still good. 

Got the bagels and headed to the Starbucks drive though :)

I had a disappointing experience here.  I like the unpretentious (if downscale), neighborhood feel of the place.  But other than that, Bagel Cafe has little going for it. The bagels are not that great--I'd take Einstein Bagels any day over bagels from this place.  And the service is not particularly pleasant.  But the worst thing was that I walked in for the first time and ordered a bagel and cup of tea from the counter.  Being my first time I didn't realize there was table service.  But despite half the tables being open, the wait staff refused to let me sit at a table and enjoy my bagel and tea.  They were more concerned about "policy" than letting a new customer enjoy himself in their establishment.  Very disappointing.

I use to seriously love this place, being from Jersey but I went yesterday with my two friends and have a horrible experience. I don't even know where to start, we had more than three different servers none of them even said hello or introduced themselves. We literally ordered french toast, eggs, bacon, and toast. Approximately an hour later the food arrives, there is a HAIR on the plate with the eggs. The server takes the eggs and then five minutes later comes back out with new eggs minus the hair. Great.. so when we got the bill of course the eggs were still on there even tho we had waited almost an hour for the food and when we got it there was a hair. I gave my card to make the payment not even looking at the bill (which was my fault) and when they brought it back i took a look and of couse with my luck they charged me $4 for bagels we didnt even order!! The manager said there was nothing he could do we could pick a pastry we should have reviewed the bill before paying. SMH great service, thanks for the hair! Wont be returning here ever again!!

We are 1st timers here at the bagel cafe, great 1st impression I must say! Hugo was our server on this busy St. Patrick's day. He could tell I was slightly disappointed that they don't have green beer but he made it happen for meHe brought me my green beer and made my day. Brunch was delicious, atmosphere was busy but survivable, and desserts were AMAZING! Thanks Hugo for an amazing experience :)

The Bagel Café is as good as it looks! This is my husband and my favorite breakfast/brunch place to eat! Everything is so delicious! They have the most amazing homemade bagels! My favorite on the menu is the combo/reuben sandwich! Its so huge and delicious!!
They have the best bagels. I really mean this,  you can not get the same bagels in California.

Always wonderful food and service at The Bagel Cafe.  It's a convenient spot for breakfast/lunch with engaging always nice wait staff.  Love their chicken soup and really, their bagels are the best outside of NY!
The food was okay. Nothing special. Very pricey. On top of that they gave us a moldy orange. Won't be back!
Everything is good everytime you go. A bit pricey at times, but plentiful and worth wvery bite.

Since my office recently moved near here, we are often here!  Whether its the amazing salads, omelettes or delectable desert, they never disappoint! Great food and great service - love the Bagel Cafe!

Don't let the name fool you- the restaurant has way more than just bagels. When you walk in you're greeted by an extensive dessert display (it all looks so good). The food menu has even more choices. The service is great and the food is delicious. The prices are relatively cheap for the generous portion sizes. Every time I've visited it's been packed which is a testament to how great the food is. I definitely recommend this place.

In summary The Bagel Cafe = Large portions. 
This is a great place for breakfast or lunch. The atmosphere is comfortable and the staff is busy but try to be attentive. The restaurant is usually  full and parking in the private lot is tight. 
It's hard to pick a favorite but the eggs and corned beef hash is excellent. A large portion of hash with your style of eggs, choice of bagel and fruit or cottage cheese. You can't go wrong with any of the sandwiches for lunch, large enough to take some home.

Sugar intake portion control?  Fuhgeddabouditt!  No hope for that here.  You'd need to install a deterent magnet on yourself (like they have on some shopping carts) to stop you from entering this cafe.  

True story: A piece of Black Forest Cake lasted me 5 days. I ate it every morning for breakfast with plain coffee. Kept it in the fridge in the box, covered by a plastic bag with a loosely tied knot. Works perfectly to keep the cake moist. Really good cake, not too sweet; but again it's sugar.

Tried knish for the first time. My best description is they look like food stuffed donuts with a thinner dryer dough. Favored the spinach stuffed one much better. I find it heavy, so eating half made me full. I liked it!

But guess what? You know how you go to the store to get one thing and end up with more than you intended? It may happen to you at this cafe. It totally happened to me, dang. I only meant to try their cannolis. Then I saw the humongous black and white cookie, tiramisu, all sorts of cakes... 

Weaknesses. Easily hypnotized by no effort.

I have been coming here for years. Love the bagels and everything they offer to put on them. Their bagels are the best in Nevada and the closest you will find to a NY bagel (Harrie's Bagelmania is a contender too!) The homemade soups are great. You will never leave hungry because they serve very large portions! Breakfast is great too. After a sit down meal we  always buy bagels to go as well as items from their bakery which makes my bill quite hefty (this place is quite expensive). BUT lately I have been leaving this place quite annoyed because of the crappie service and all the employees seem very miserable and it's starting to get on my nerves.

On my Trip to Vegas, we ate at this amazing Deli w/my Mom & Jim. This place is a Goldmine! A TRUE Jewish Deli! I wish Phoenix had a Deli like this one! Their Matzoh Ball Soup is to die for!  I want to go to this deli every time I visit Vegas! ....Please open a location, here in Phoenix!!... We NEEDa you guys here, too! ...You would be a TOTAL HIT here!  :)

Outstanding!  
Have nothing to add, everything has been said by all the previous insightful posters.
Sorry I cheated on you by trying the worst bakery I have ever had. Carlos (Cake Boss) at the Venetian.

I recently moved to Las Vegas from Connecticut  and have been missing a really good bagel. The bagels there remind me of the ones I used to get back home. Their breakfasts are delicious including their very tasty coffee. And if an amazing  breakfast isn't enough for you, visit their bakery full of freshly made sweets of all kinds!

I've heard so many things about this place that we just HAD to try it!  It was also second on our list of places to go when Baby Cakes Cafe had an over 45 minute wait. 

First, parking seems to be at a premium at this location.  Good luck finding parking.  

Second, it  took us about 5 minutes to be acknowledged / seated.  They were busy but it was acceptable.  What stood out to me here was how irritated the older folks behind me were getting.

Third, the service - like I said it was busy. Extremely busy.  We did get our drink orders in and our actual orders in quickly after we put our menus down.

Fourth, the food!  The food came out after a 15 minute wait.  My wife ordered the multi-grain pancakes which were HUGE!  I ordered the colorado Omlet with a Raisin Bagel w/ Raisin Cream Cheese.  

My wife's multi-grain pancakes smelled AWESOME!  They even tasted very good.  ;)

My Colorado omelet, which consisted of Bell Peppers, Cheese and ham was just "meh."  It was dry and kind of cold by the time I got it.  Nothing to write home about.  What did redeem the meal was the bagel.  Very good!

Over all, the place was clean, the staff was busy but still friendly.  I would come here again to try something else.  It'd have to be after breakfast was over though!
Whyyyyyy has it taken me so long to go here ?! Fabulous NY style deli and bagels . Casual atmosphere , great food , what more can I say ?

Best bagels, breakfast, Nova, corned beef and pastrami sandwiches, and desserts. Everything is home made and pure yummy. Eaten here for years and by far the best quality, quantity, and bang for your buck! Honestly no other bagel or breakfast place has even come close to the Bagel Cafe. Five STARS absolutely! not a bad thing to say about this amazing family owned restaurant. If you haven't been, your definitely missing out :)

I really felt like I was walking into a bagel shop/bakery in New York City.  I was blown away by the selections when I walked into this place.  I don't know what was more impressive... the selection of bagels, the bakery selections with cakes and cookies, or the deli counter with all the authentic meats, fish, and condiments.  And that was just on the selection of items to go.  My suggestion is if you're coming here to eat, come at an "off" time.  One of the drawbacks is the parking and the parking lot.  It is in a strip center in which they have parking marked for designated businesses, so be careful where you park.  The other thing is I got there about 11:15 this morning.  And I got here just in time.  The parking area filled up fast, and so did the dining room.  And when I was leaving, there were people circling around trying to find parking spots.  The lady who took my spot, gave me just enough room to let me get out, before she started pulling in.  I took a seat at the counter, because there were only two available tables, and they were for four people, so I didn't want to take up a table for four (although other people alone were).  My server was a very nice young lady, who was very fast .  I ordered an Egg Bagel and a Sun-Dried Tomato Bagel, both with plain cream cheese and a small Black & White Cookie.  It took about ten minutes to get my order, which was fine given how busy they were.  Now, the other big drawback was that the bagels come in single baskets and the cream cheese is on the side.  Trying to spread the cream cheese on to the bagels, while in baskets is a chore, without making a mess.  I would prefer my cream cheese be already on the bagels.  If people want it on the side, they can ask for it that way.  Now, if you've ever been to New York, there are two things you will never get better anywhere else... pizza and bagels.  It's something in the water there that makes both of those things turn out so good.  However, these were the closest bagels I've ever had to real NYC bagels.  They were chewy with a little give, and the cream cheese was whipped perfectly with a great taste.  I enjoyed them both.  The Black & White Cookie was the best I've ever had!  It definitely made the meal complete.  I also had a glass of their Fresh Squeezed Orange Juice, which was awesome.  It was $14 for all of that, which I think was a pretty good deal.  I look forward to eating one of their over-stuffed deli sandwiches next time I go in there.  They looked awesome!   Also want to try their Potato Pancakes!  Definitely a great find and a great place to eat!

We swung by here on Christmas morning to grab some bagels since Christmas Eve beget leftover smoked salmon. Bagels and lox? Yes, please. My relatives raved about this place, and rightly so because they weren't the only ones! It was packed when we ducked in around 9, but we ended up making it through the line fairly quickly. Service all along the way was great.

The bagels themselves are delicious. They were so chewy and doughy that I just wanted to eat more and more (but I didn't.) The cream cheese was very fresh and delicious as well. We opted for plain and the cheddar and garlic, and needless to say, it's hard to pick a favorite as they were both excellent.

Best. Bagels. Ever.

This is my favorite place to take friends, family and visitors for breakfast or lunch. It's always busy because the food has a reputation for being great and consistent. 

PROS: The bagels
             Corned beef hash
             Nova Lox spread
             Pastrami and tongue sandwich
             Matzo ball soup
             Black and white cookie
             Whitefish salad
             Chopped liver
             Full service bakery and deli 
             
CONS: Sun dried tomato and chicken pizza bagel

Can't afford a trip to NY? No problem, just come here and eat your heart out. Bagels are authentic NY style, food is too. I had the bologna omelet and there were no regrets. Wish it was closer though cuz on Sundays it would be nice to pick up some of the baked goods to offer guests after a fat-a$$ Sunday dinner. :)

Don't get me wrong, this is a really good deli ... for Las Vegas. I had a tongue tip sandwich, and it was enjoyable. But the only disappointment was the size of the sandwich. I actually toyed with the idea of getting a half ... a common practice at the finer NYC delis. And by the look of the picture in the menu, a half just may have worked so long as you settle for accompaniments like fries, potato salad, slaw, etc. So glad I went for the whole. C'mon Bagel Cafe, if you want to compete with your eastern counterparts, you're gonna have to put some more meat on those sandwich bones. The rye was very good, and an excellent pickle, but please do something about acquiring a house deli mustard. As for the bagels. What can I say. When it comes to bagels, size matters, but not the overriding determinant in quality. While they were big enough, they were way too dense and somewhat lacking in flavor. Yeah, I know, I know. Having grown up in the streets of Manhattan, I am way too spoiled to make comparisons. Maybe one day, I'll find a LV bagel that can compete with that of my alma mater. But Bagel Cafe, although good by LV standards, when it comes to comparing to those of dozens of Big Apple bagelaries ... puhleeze!!!!

By far the best deli in Vegas!my husband and I come here for breakfast every Sunday.
From the time you walk in the door you are greeted by out of this world friendliness (which is hard here in Vegas)! Their food is no exception to out of this world goodness! You have a variety of breads, bagels, meat options, cheese options- and the beat part is that you can never go wrong with whatever you order. The best part is their veggie spread!.... Save the best for last!

I've been coming here for a couple years now and the food is really good.The staff is friendly very friendly(thank you guys!) But let me tell you about this "manager" jerry. He is a joke!!!, very rude and inconsiderate. This "man" has no respect or manners for his guests, honestly I will not be returning here if this p.o.s is still working here. Anna is amazing .. She should be running this show :)...

Another place you pass over & over but don't think of when it's time to eat out since we don't do breakfast out very often.
It was a Saturday morning & it was busy. As in the past, it took a little while to put in our food orders. As usual, everything was great. A little pricey but not compared to other places where the food is not nearly as good.

If you value your time and sanity avoid this place on weekends as an army of blue hairs invades, fueling up for a hard day of bingo and slots. At other times, this place is generally pretty pleasant. The food ranges from decent to excellent, the service is acceptable, but the pricing seems quite a bit higher than it should be. Recommended, but with some hesitation.

An awesome place and the food is out of this world.  I grew up back East in an Italian Jewish neighborhood and even though my nationality is neither I loved the food.  This place captures that.  The sandwiches are huge and the corn beef or pastrami has that traditional flavor.  There are early dinner specials here.  The bagels are fresh every day and wonderful.  Different types of cream cheese.  The deli section has all kinds of bakery products, deli meats and other food for take out.  They even sell Wise potato chips, a true Philadelphia-South Jersey icon.  This is a "must" place for both locals and visitors.

There were a few things I liked and a few I didn't about Bagel Cafe. To begin, the deserts and presentation of the restaurant looked great and very NY. The inside was huge and I'm glad that a local place like this was so full when I went for a late lunch around 1:30pm. The wait staff was slow but again pretty true to NY style in that part.  

The corned beef was very good but not fatty enough for my liking. The pickle eh. The matzo ball soup was quite good - very hearty. I thought the bagel greatly underwhelmed as the place is called Bagel Cafe. 

For $11 a meal the price seems high. Yes there's a lot of meat but honestly it's not as much as you'd expect for the price. Usually they are stacked double high (maybe $3-4 more but worthy of two meals). I was full but there was definitely not enough for a second meal. I would give Bagel Cafe a try if you're nostalgic for a NY deli, but don't expect the authentic experience. You'll get a good feeling for the food but not quite there.

Disgusted by the customer service experience. This is a place my husband and I went to when we lived in Las Vegas. We were back for our anniversary and thought we'd head here for breakfast. The food was fine, but the service was really upsetting. The waitress delivered our food and asked my husband if he wanted more coffee and then didn't return until it was time to deliver the check. I observed a young man bringing coffee to all the other tables. He never came to ours. After paying the bill and leaving a tip I wish I hadn't, my husband and I went to the bakery to buy some cookies. I went to the counter and one cashier served another woman ahead of me. I went to the other cashier who was serving someone and once she was done, she literally turned her back on me and started rolling silverware. 
I have never received such horrible customer service here. Awful and so disappointing.
average pricing, good service, the best tasting home fries that I have ever had, and they put pastrami in an omelet... I'm coming back! :)

The ambience of this place is really cool. I love walking in and looking at all of the desserts. It's always crowded when you go in and it's funny to watch the elderly people their fight over tables because they think they're all regulars and on the place. I wanted to try something different then "the bagel ". I tried it with lobster salad sandwich. Of course when you go to a place that is not known for a lobster salad sandwich you pretty much get what you pay for. I'm not sure there was any lobster in it but it was pretty good. And they serve it on a sourdough bread. Which was my fault of course but I thought that it would actually come on a roll the bread was so thin that it soaked through the salad sandwich and to be quite honest was subpar. So my recommendation when you go to this place is go for what's not on the menu I'll try the matzoh ball soup next time

We had breakfast here for the first time and I didn't find anything that really stood out about this place, yet it's very busy. I had a chili omelette and it was very plain. We grabbed some deserts before we left and not anything exciting to talk about there. In my opinion it's a tad overpriced for very average food.

I love this place.  I moved here from DC a few months ago and having lived in New York City for years prior this place felt like home.  We have been for breakfast 4 or 5 times now and the french toast is awesome; the rest of the dishes we had (omelets/corn beef hash) were just okay.  You get a bagel with every dish so it's  A LOT of food.  You definitely get your money's worth here.  But after so many visits I will say I think the bakery side outshines the restaurant itself.  Every single thing we have taken to go has been amazing.   The knishes are a good way to rate a New York deli... and they are fantastic.  Not the ones labeled "New York Knish" but the round homemade ones; that's the real stuff.  The almond and coconut lemon rugelach are awesome.  The homemade hostess cupcake is amazing.  But never ever ever leave without a lemon bar.

This is one of my friend's favorite places. And I'm not a big bagel fans. Maybe I have had 1 or 2 a year, and 4-5 in last 10 years.

Just let me spell it out right now, my breakfast was edible. I can't even remember what I had. Typical and boring. My bagel and cream cheese were edible too.

Why 4-star? Well, let me tell you the story...

While we were waiting, I had a chance to glance at the dessert and pastry sections. I don't have a sweet tooth. So the selection was just yawning. And against my religion, they were twice the price than those in southern CA.

Why 4-star?

Well, I spotted the sugar free apple and regular peach pies. They were heavy and delicious looking. So I bought one each on the impulse. After I tasted it later, the flavor were GOOD, but it's too mushy underneath. I had to "bake" it upside down and inside out, to firm up the texture.

Well, that's not a 4-star experience. You're right. There are more to it...

While I was biting my breakfast item, I saw this bread with the corner of my eyes. This pile of breads was sitting on top of the shelf hiding behind the row of tall metal trays of baked carb. Memory flashback....

I had munched on freshly baked ambrosia tasting bread cooked by a friend in a ranch just half a year ago. It was good not just when it came fresh out of the oven, but as good when it was French toasted in thick slice on a grill.

The bread was challah and it was braided. So I bought one large loaf on the impulse. $5. That's the 2nd time in one day in one restaurant. And it was good and delicious.

So diners, I bet the items on the menu were good. That's why the restaurant was busy. My eyes were really set on the Challah.
Great food, healthy quantities.  Not giving 5 stars because it CAN be a bit pricy.  But otherwise, I love that place.

Omg yum! That's all I have to say. Yeah right. This place makes me want to buy everything. 

It's a seat yourself dining. Service is great! Cashier to when your food is ready. The matzo ball was delish. Very fulfilling and has great chucks of chicken and lots of veggies. Made me wish it was a bigger bowl. I also order some cookies but didn't get to take a picture of it. I got it and ate it quick.  I wish I got coffee but the cookie was just the right amount of sweets I can get. Yes coffee is part of my sweets. I also ordered a plain bagel mmmm very tasty. 

Would I come back?? Of course I would I have to try other things and there is so much to get.

Finally made it here been wanting to come here for 15 years. Drive by here so many times. 
Bagels are so delicious here. Very light and warm. 
Sad to say that the rest of our breakfast wasn't as delicious as the bagel. 
Either way I love the bagels

By far one of the greatest but not well known breakfast places in Vegas/Summerlin area! Food is spectacular, prices are fair, and reminds me of New York more than any other place. Excellent bakery too! Totally recommend if In the area! Service is always the best as well, always helpful, and willing to bring out whatever you need! Excellent!
Everything is delicious here. The pastries are unbelievable. Definitely get the matzo ball soup and the Reuben!

It was an hour and half wait for our party of seven! lol But we also came on a Saturday around 12:30pm. 

We came here because a friend wanted to go and it was in my list of places to come check out! :D 

So really quickly it's a bakery/deli and a restaurant/cafe. They seem to get pretty busy on the weekends, seating for smaller parties went by faster than for our large party (typical). Oh! You also need to make sure your whole party is present or they won't seat you. 

So I ended up with an Asiago bagel with jalapeno cream cheese and biscuits and gravy! I couldn't decide on what I wanted so I settled and thought, "you can't go wrong with biscuits and gravy." Yeah......nope! My bagel was much more appealing in taste than the biscuits and gravy. So a complete major disappointment in that. I liked the gravy but it could have used a little more flavor, there were large chunks of sausage in it which I think they could have cut up a little bit more. I like my biscuits in gravy with a LOT of gravy, like my biscuits need to be covered. I ran out of gravy before I ran out of biscuit, so it's a little disappointing to me. The bagel was good though!! I enjoyed getting chunks of jalapeno in my cream cheese :D 

Service wise - well it was alright. They were busy and we also had a decent size party so it's difficult, won't give them too much of a hackle for that. 

Overall it was a good experience, enjoyed some of the food but I want to try more stuff!!

Pricy and not clean!
We first time went to there.It was so busy.We didn't like hot tea was cold.Milk container for tea makes mess.
First impression of Food didn't look good.Not like a for proffesional looking. Their Plates are so heavy and not clean.Pancakes are salty.sausage are fine. We didn't try bagle tho.I don't Know why this place is so busy.I feel not honest business here.

Very busy at 10am. I ordered the biscuits and gravy. The flavor was good and the portion large, but only had two small pieces of sausage in my gravy.  The scrambled eggs were spot on as was the bacon. $3.00 was a little steep for the 1-1/2 cups of coffee I had. My co-diner ordered the eggs Benedict and thouroughly enjoyed it. Good food. For $3.00, I should get more coffee.
1st time in.... Good food.. Pleasant  wait staff.... I will totally be back!!! With friends... Come with a appetite!!!

Oh, Bagel Cafe. I've praised this place for its delicious sweets that are proudly on display. Too bad dining here was a disappointment. 

Everyone seems to brunch here on the weekends, so the wait can be up to 20 minutes. Not a problem, because staring at the dessert case is the best form of entertainment.

My boyfriend and I were seated at the very back of the restaurant, which I don't believe is ideal. I felt like we were left there and forgotten about until staff members came by to ask if they could take our extra chairs, and if they could use our table to hold dirty dishes for a few moments. I didn't mind at first, but this happened several times.

We were both first-time diners, so we didn't know that the menus were the newspapers shoved in between the condiments and the wall. I ordered the spinach and feta omelette with a side of whole wheat toast and a medley of fruit. Water from the feta leaked out from inside the omelette. 

Our waitress forgot our corned beef hash, which we looked forward to trying. She took note of our order once again, and disappeared only to return 20 minutes later with our check. 

I might return for the sweets, but never again for an actual sit-down meal. So much for that corned beef hash.
Seriously yummalicious baked goods! Huge sandwiches. The corned beef can be a little dry. The best mazoh ball soup in Vegas. Good smoked fish. This is the best Jewish deli in Vegas.

Been going here for years, never wrote a review.  I go about once every two or three months.
I always get the same thing-Pastrami on Rye, its simple the best traditional NY traditional sandwich in town. Its enormous and enough for two meals.  The staff is a plus and is always so friendly  

Go  here

I placed an order via grub hub and they were wonderful the Manager at the Begal Cafe was very defiant.  I ordered a Vege Omelet with Turkey Bacon on the side and had ham in my Omelet. The Manager said he spoke to the cook who told him it was Turkey Bacon in the Omelet. Either way I did not order any meat on my food and the Manager refused to refund my Food, until back and forth with them and grub hub until I had him call while I waited. Poor service Manager. Needs to be retrained in CUSTOMER SERVICE.
Top Jewish deli in town.  Pastries.  Huge portions. What more could my heart doctor ask for?

Fabulous,  fabulous and fabulous. Went there for lunch and happy I did. I had the 1/2 lobster salad sandwich an a cup of matzo ball soup. There was so much  lobster on that 1/2 sandwich its was more than 2 lobster tails. My friend had 1/2 pastrami an matzo ball soup it too was huge. We topped it off with all huge piece of Tira Misu cake, for him and for me........ Cheese Blintzes with strawberry preserves and sour cream.  We were so full,  we couldn't move.  Try it,  you will love it, an if you don't..... well then there just something wrong with you!

This place has the best bagels since moving out of NY over 25 years ago. In addition, everything I've had there, either dining in or take out has been fantastic. Cold cuts, deli salads, rainbow cookies (made the right way with almond paste), pastries, etc. etc. have all been outstanding. Wish I lived closer, but will be a must-stop every time I visit my family in Summerlin.
I love this place!! Best food EVER!! homemade corn beef and hash and matz ball soup !!

The bagel cafe has delicious FRESH bagels! A family owned business that truly cares for their customers! The ambiance is casual and very clean. My favorites are the delicious nova platter, matzo ball and hearty cabbage soup. Unforgettable! They are busy on the weekends but that means they are loved by many so come early and check in with the hostess. They have even added beer and wine to the menu! Oh, and don't forget to try the black and white cookie for dessert!

Best place ever and I didn't think that being vegan I could order anything.  I ate a vegan wrap in a spinach and herb bread with cucumber salad. The rest of my party are carnivores and were very satisfied with their corned beef sandwiches and matzo ball soup.

The soft drinks were awesome because the diet soda had just enough seltzer.  

The service was very good and the employees were very attentive. So we highly recommend eating here to all our friends and colleagues. 

Now on to the bakery case, large portions guaranteed to please. It's a very good thing that we don't live close to this café. 

TIP- if you are dining in you can request a military discount just for the military member (s.) If you are just picking up food then this discount is void.

The location is very convenient to Trader Joe's to shop for items.

This is a great deli! It's authentic! The servers are friendly and the service fast.

Had the matzo ball soup bowl and there was enough to take home since it was so hearty and filing. The bagels are delicious and the blueberry spread was yummy.

I love Bagel Cafe. I've never had anything that wasn't spectacular from bagels to sandwiches, soup and pastries it's all delicious.  Their biscuits and gravy is amazing and I don't even like gravy usually. My only complaint is they aren't closer to my house. It is right next to my dr office however and I will be stopping in as soon as I'm done today. Lol

I have been coming here since 2001 I really really love their breakfast their omelets are pretty big actually enough for 2 people. They have the best crab benedict with hollandaise sauce. They give you a ton of crab meat and it's real crab meat not fake. If you love sandwiches there corned beef is incredible stacked super super high up. This is probably one of my favorite breakfast locations in Vegas I come here probably three to four times a month. If you're in the area definitely stop by and give Bagel Cafe a try.
This place is amazing!  Food is terrific.  Cookies are "to die for".  I wish this place was back home in San Antonio.
The food here is top-notch. Really great bagels. The service can suffer when they're busy, which is fairly often.

I have been back several times before writing this review update just to make sure all the inconsistency that I have been experiencing is now the way of Bagel Cafe and not just an off day they were having. I'm prepared for the loyal fixtures to be upset, but if you really have been eating here since it opened then you know it's not the same. I first started eating here at Bagel Cafe (I was a teenager) after it opened. It was worth the long wait to get a table as the food was spot on excellent. Sure we all know the best breakfast in town is at the Omelet House on Charleston, but this place definitely came close behind at one point. In the last 6 months I have experienced meals here at Bagel Cafe that were just not worth the money or wait for what you got. They don't even use Boar's Head deli meats anymore! WTH?!?!?!? They use some brand I have never heard of. The taste and quality of the deli meat just isn't the same as it used to be. They claim the bagels are made fresh daily yet they are rock hard. I have never liked the bagels here, but if it's in your name.... live up to it!

As you can tell from my previous review and pictures, I really used to like this place. Consistency is a major issue. The sandwiches used to be made with Boar's Head deli meat and was piled high between the bread of your choice and a real winner. Now you get some other brand of meat just bunched up in a ball between 2 dry pieces of bread. I can do that at home! Then there is breakfast. I usually order breakfast here. The last 3 times the coffee has tasted bitter and nasty. Getting a refill was a major chore as well. I noticed the servers didn't have name tags on my last visit or I would give a proper shout-out to the waitress who has messed up my order lately and has terrible customer service. I ordered "One Egg any style W/Bacon" priced at $8.95 and asked for eggs to be scrambled with shredded cheddar cheese on top. Such a simple breakfast right? Apparently not For Bagel Cafe. The breakfast also came with a bagel of my choice and breakfast potatoes. When my food arrived I noticed there was a slice of cheddar cheese on my eggs. UGH! If you don't have shredded cheese just let the customer know so they can maybe make another choice. I would have had the egg over medium or easy to dunk my bacon in if I had known. The "Asiago" bagel I had was so tough and hard!  I was with another yelper one of my last visits and showed him how I was able to bang the bagel on the table and it just broke in pieces.  The bacon was terrible. From the picture it looks heavenly, but let me tell you it was rock hard and seemed like it was honestly pulled from the fridge or something. When my meal arrived the bacon was missing, so I informed our waitress and she replies to me "oh did you want bacon?" to which I'm like HELL YES why would I have ordered a breakfast that comes with it if I didn't want it? She then brings me the cold/hard bacon and when the receipt comes she charged me $3.50 for a side of bacon. Seriously? It was supposed to come with the breakfast I ordered. She made me feel like I had done something wrong when she actually is a very lousy waitress. The potatoes I had were the only thing edible on the plate and even those aren't the same potatoes as they have had in the past. With this place not being consistent and having waitresses who can't do their job right, I'm going to  BabyStacks Cafe and Omelet House from now on for breakfast and will make the drive to Henderson to eat at Weiss.

Fantastic NY style sit down deli restaurant. We love the homemade chicken soup with matzo balls, the fresh bagels and rye bread, the lox and whitefish salad, the corned beef, and the omelets. In sum, it's all delicious and the service is always friendly.

I live right down the street so needless to say I eat here a lot! Literally every time I visit, the food is fresh and amazing.  Never once have I been let down.  The service can sometimes be iffy, but it's understandable seeing as they're always busy.  It's noticeable that the staff works their butts off and always try's their best to keep customers satisfied. My favorites here include ALL bagels, the spinach and feta omelette, and the eggs Benedict. Everything is good though.

I wish I was in town longer to enjoy more affordable delicious food at Bagel Café. To the Over stock of amazing deserts to the freshly made bagels and cream cheese. This place was a total HOME RUN. 

We stopped in for breakfast (my buddy recently moved to vegas and he lives right down the street) I had the nova lox Sammy, it was soooo good. The menu has a huge variety and there's many options for everyone. If your looking for an affordable place for breakfast or lunch this place is a no brainer.

I love this place. I stop in to buy bagels and cream cheese often. They have such a great variety. Sometimes there is a little bit of a wait but that's because they toast your bagel and put the cream cheese on. 
The desserts are also amazing. It's impossible to stand in line for a bagel and not drool over the desserts. 
I've never eaten inside but it looks like it would be pretty good. 
In 2007 my Husband passed away and we used Bagel Cafe for the gathering afterwards, it was delicious and convenient, and they were so nice about everything. 
My Uncle passed away in 2013 and my Aunt remembered how good the food was at my Husbands funeral that she decided to use them for the gathering for my Uncle as well.

Plethora of goodies!

I shouted to the bagel master, make me whatever you want! And viola - he came out with a blueberry muffin with strawberry cream cheese!

Ok Ok -- i really came for the Matzo ball soup (taste just like Chicken Noodle soup) as a special request, but I couldn't help myself with the fresh baked good, homey ambiance of the locals that were enjoying their meals. 

I shall return to sit down and experience a little bit more when I'm back in town.

The service was great.!

This place is right in my neighborhood, but I never went until now, as I am moving away. 

They have takeout, but I dined in. I had a bagel sandwich (hot and fresh, but not chewy like I prefer), coffee (truly terrible), and a side of citrus fruit salad that just tasted bad. It didn't seem fresh and had an off taste. 

The service was good, and I would not hesitate to come back for takeout bagels. I would just make my own coffee.

After reading this before posting , the sound of this review may sound as if I may be  affiliated with this place . I can assure you I am not in any way. I am a relatively new customer of theirs and the following are my impressions after about 3 visits. 

 Doesn't get better in Las Vegas . Grew up in NY and have struggled to find a good deli / bagel place . This by far and away is the closest to NY. They have takeout for most things sold which includes deli / bakery /bagel items. They also have a sit down restaurant which is great.  Breakfast items I have tried have all been excellent .  Standouts are the Corn beef hash , two styles of knish (3 are stuffed one is NY style )  Bagel sandwiches are fantastic. Looking around the dining room will only make you have ordering remorse as you see the awesome selections other people have ordered. The menu is very large offering many traditional Jewish dishes which are staples in NY  and traditional american breakfast plates . 
The one thing that truly stood out is the service. I have gone to 5 star restaurants and have spent more than a mortgage payment on meals that included sommeliers and waiters with assigned assistants, and not received anywhere close to the service and unbelievable upbeat  attitudes as the staff there.  
So from bagels with numerous cream cheese options , to the diet killing bakery counter with things like cannoli , black and white cookies , rainbow cookies , gourmet muffins etc etc to the NY deli staple the classic (bagel) breakfast egg sandwich , this place has it all .   

minor cons not worth even bumping them from a strong 5 star review. 

#1 Take-out does not have a large menu posted  to know whats available at the takeout window when ordering. 

#2 (I'm sure they have heard this a thousand times) The parking lot is tight and cramped . Be on your toes and bring along a little extra patience . its worth the minor inconvenience . 

#3 No chocolate-milk in the bottled  beverage cooler. I think in NY its is part of the licensing agreement for anyone selling bagels to have it on hand. I guess not in Las Vegas. 

#4 it can get crowded on the weekends. It has been around fore a long time. keep in mind there is a reason people will wait 20-30 minutes.  Early bird rules apply .

Solid food, good service and easy access...

The location is on Buffalo, right off the Summerlin parkway. 

The bagels are delicious, the cream cheese is really fresh and they do some serious meats! (The bacon, sausage, cornbeef and chorizo are all great) 

Great spot for a solid east coast breakfast/brunch.

Enjoy!

For a taste of my home town, New York City, this is the only place in Las Vegas.  I don't know how they do it but their bagels taste like bagels not dough balls.  Their food is fabulous and the service is great.  Love their huge salads, especially the shrimp salad.  Their Sicilian Omelette, egg salad, etc. etc. etc.  I have been for breakfast, lunch, dinner and take-out.  Reminds me of Sunday mornings when I was very young and the bagels, lox, cream cheese and white fish brunches at my grandparents.  LOVE this place. Desserts are huge and they have the all important Black & White cookie and their sugar free Rugalah is awesome as is the regular.

The perfect Jewish New York deli! The counter has everything you miss from back in the neighborhood and it's all homemade. The diner is great for an on the go meal. Service is friendly and fast. Suggest the chicken liver pate and the bagels and locks.

Great food!!!!  Bagels are awesome. All breakfasts come with homemade bagels and homemade cream cheese. There are many different types to choose from. Their matza ball soup is my husbands favorite!!!!!
They have a great deli with lots of choices and amazing selection of fresh made pastries. Give it a try. It's our favorite place for breakfast and worth the drive!!!

Black and white cookie:  More cake-like than cookie, not horrible but I wouldn't order it again.

Red Velvet Cupcake:  I was told it was buttercream frosting in which case it was not good buttercream frosting.  Add to that just by appearance the cupcake to frosting ratio is a little off and it was a tad dry.  I can get a four-pack of cupcakes from Trader Joe's for $3.99 that taste better.  

Hostess cupcake:  I did not like the taste of the filling and it seemed like that ratio was also off as far as too much filling and it didn't help disguise the dryness.    

I've heard good things about this place and the dining area was packed so I would like to come back and try items off the regular menu but now I know to just steer clear of the desserts.

The food is super good (the deli and bakery is awesome - great black-and-whites!) but you'll leave smelling like Bagel Cafe for the rest of the day. Pro tip: the corn beef hash is out of a Hormel can.

First time here with the baby sis and it was great! Nice little spot and the bagels are insanely good! They have a "cream cheese" of the month platter they give you as an appetizer and my baby sis and I fell in love with your Tropical Fruit cream cheese. Food was excellent and very good portions. They also have a deli and bakery which made me extremely happy to find some Black & White cookies - hopefully they are as good as the ones in my hometown bakery in Cali. Will be a regular here for a good breakfast spot.

My most recent visit has made me have to dock a star...the service wasn't up to par and neither was the food. I don't think it's gone down in quality, but I think we just caught the place on a bad day. 

My bagel and cream cheese was still delicious, though!

Note to self: I'm there for the matzoh ball soup or pastrami sandwich. Anything else is a huge mistake. They drown their salads in dressing - make sure to ask for it on the side.

We FINALLY made it to The Bagel Cafe in search of a breakfast spot we had never been to. Why the heck did it take us so long!?!?!? Better late than never, right?

This place was packed when we stepped inside, but luckily for us, a booth was waiting with our name on it which was great because I'm not much of a fan sitting at open tables in the middle of the dining room of a . Talk about selection here!!! People really look like they're reading the Sunday Paper! That's how extensive their menu is...our waitress checked back on three different occasions laughing because we were kinda overwhelmed on deciding what to get.

I knew I wanted a bagel, and it'll almost always be an Everything Bagel with Nova Spread. 
Wifey wanted a cup of their popular Matzo Ball soup(which was also a first for me, I think)
and the Challah French Toast. Along with my bagel, I had to have a Potato Pancake with sour cream and apple sauce, and I've never had a Knish, so I added one of their meat and potato ones. The Matzo Ball Soup was very good, and my bagel was as I imagined-nicely toasted and chewy like a NY bagel. The Nova spread was pretty bomb too. The Potato Pancake was simple, straightforward, and delicious. Something in the flavor of the Knish was kinda foreign to me, and after 2-3 bites, I was done with that...At least I didn't knock it before I tried it! Wifey also failed to read that the soup came with a bagel, so she chose a Cinnamon-Raisin Bagel with cinnamon-raisin cream cheese which we enjoyed. The French Toast arrived and this plate looked like it came from Hash House A Go-Go!?

Bigger doesn't necessarily mean better IMO....all I could taste was egg, egg, and more egg. The challah wasn't soaked enough either. A little cinnamon, sugar, and vanilla extract does wonders! Overall, it was a great first visit. Tasty food, great service, and a great local spot to start your morning....ALOHA!!!

Shaka Meter:  \uuu/  \uuu/  \uuu/  \uuu/  \u   4.25

YELP 365 CHALLENGE 2014-(37/365) "A Taste Of New York In The Desert"

The Bagel Cafe deserves its name. It really does bagels well. They are more than a cut above what you can get from your local supermarket or Einstein's Bagels or some such thing. They are doughy and delicious, and come with fresh ingredients to accompany, such as lox, cream cheese, and whatever else you want that is kosher. The desserts are very strong, too. I would not put too much stock in the rest of the restaurant fare, but as for the bagels and the dessert, you cannot go wrong.
Best bagels in Vegas, hands down! It aint NY but its pretty damn close!

Best bagels ever! Best breakfast in Vegas! Best cannolis in Vegas!  Excellent service!

I came to The Bagel Cafe dozens of times when I lived in Vegas and especially when I worked in the same business complex this restaurant is part of on Buffalo, right off of the freeway.  I visited recently while on a trip and it is the same amazing place.  Voted 13 years now for Best Breakfast by readers of the Las Vegas Review Journal, this cafe with fresh bread, bagels, pastries, desserts, a deli and serving lunch too is a real gem.  

My fave bagel was the pumpernickel and they still make it.  Damn it is good.

I love the spinach and feta omelet.  The cannolis are superb, the real deal, and they are huge.  I recommend the latkes, eggs benedict, and chopped potatoes.  The chopped potatoes have this tomato zing to them that is just right on the dot.  

For lunch, get a sandwich that will have enough meat on it to feed three firemen.  Try the corned beef.  Yummy!  Salads are great too and yes, my friend, they come with a bagel and cream cheese.  If you can't eat it all, take that bagel home for a snack later because you can't waste heaven.

When it's warm and sunny, there's outdoor seating which makes the situation even better.

You can order ahead for carryout or go to the counter to your right upon entering to get your bread, dessert, sliced Boar's Head or anything else they offer to go. They also offer catering.

Portions are nice and big.  I couldn't finish my omelet but I shoved it in because you can't waste food like this.  I took the rest of my bagel to go.  Oh man are the bagels the best.  And big.

Get some kind of dessert and take it to go if you're going to explode.  You won't be disappointed. You've got the black and white cookie, hamentashen, Mexican wedding, and holy mother, they even make cheesecake the right way - the NY way.

There's never been an issue with service here.  A little blunt when they have a line out the door for people paying their tab but not at all rude, just busy.  

You get your choice of the bread you want when you order breakfast, which is served all day.

A taste of New York in Vegas.  Don't miss this.  

Parking stinks because the cafe is in a business park that lacks parking to begin with and it super busy due to the popularity.  It's worth dealing with it though.  

The atmosphere is that of a deli.  Simple but good tables and chairs with a NYC skyline painted on one wall and everything's clean. It gets pretty noisy when they are busy which is to be expected.  You may have to wait 30  minutes for a table; they don't take reservations, this is a casual restaurant.  However, it's worth the wait and service is fast.

I would not bring kids here simply because of how big the portions are and really, the food is just so amazing it would be wasted on a kid's palate.  It is family friendly though so I'm probably just being a snob. ;)

Food: 5
Service: 5
Ambiance: 4
Parking: 3

I'm from New York and Jewish so that's a double whammy for this place.  Expensive isn't close to the right word.  Dr. Brown's sodas are 2.50, give me a break the local supermarkets sell them for 1.25.  Smiths has kosher food that is 1/2 the price.  The quality is ok but really overpriced.  Also you can't get a great bagel in Las Vegas because of the water out here which is terrible.  It's ok but don't go out of your way.
Fantastic bagels and homemade cream cheese.  If you're looking for a New Jersey dinner / bagel deli in Las Vegas, this is it.

We come here a couple of times a month for bagels and pastries. Occasionally we eat first. I love there sweet and sour cabbage soup.  Love there bagels and often get there scallion cream cheese. The kids love the black and white cookies.  Slightly pricier than other breakfast places but from NY and like the bagels compared to other places in town.

Ok, so maybe it's a bit ironic to call the Jewish Deli/Bakery the "Holy Grail" of Jewish restaurants, but we recently moved to Las Vegas from LA, and I've been looking everywhere to find a place like this.  As it turned out it was less than a mile from our new house.  They have amazing bagels, pastry, and other jewish food, and great breakfast too.  It's a can't miss place!

Yum yum yum! I got the egg everything bagel and the nova cream cheese. Oh man, they were delicious. They didn't skimp on the lox at all! It was delicious and a great surprise. My friend got the spinach feta bagel with (I think) scallion cream cheese. She ate hers as fast as I did!

I also shared a slice of the cheesecake with fruit on top with my friend, the cheesecake by itself was soo good, but that fruit stuff was weird. It was this strange, artificial strawberry goop that just tasted unpleasant. However, I would recommend ordering the cheesecake plain! 

Come check this place out! The bakery is huge and impressive, so even for the free sniffs, stop on in!

Gets a 1 because zero isnt an option. Charging $13 for a sandwich is insane in itself, so to be a "New York style" spot, I put my faith in the sheer cockiness of charging such an outlandish price expecting a phenomenal sandwich. What I got was a unbelievably generic below par sandwich. Run of the mill bread, two slices of store bought cheddar, over cooked and under seasoned brisket. That's it. Nothing else.. IT WASNT EVEN WARM. Cheese not melted at all. They have the nerve to put packets of mayo and guldens mustard in the to go container with the sandwich.  Can't be bothered to dress their own sandwiches. Only thing good about this order was the pickle on the side.
Shame on you for charging people 2x the normal amount for a sandwich of this quality. Even at $6 it would have been disappointing.
Great New York deli style food with amazing foods and dessert. Large portions and good value. Staff and management are super friendly and nice. Highly recommend for breakfast, lunch or dinner.

I have been to the Bagel Cafe a few times now. It always leaves me satisfied! The food is good, for a nice breakfast or lunch, however prices and crowds might scare some people away. 
It's definitely very good and I love the staff. The bakery is phenomenal! But if you're not into crowds don't go! Unless is an off night/day which might be better!

A great NY deli style cafe/bakery with wonderful food.   Although it can get very busy especially on Saturday and Sunday mornings, but that just goes to show you how good they are.   I love having my bagel and lox there when ever I can.

I'll start with the good. The portions are huge, loved the philly steak. The egg salad sandwich was nothing special but then again, it's never special. LnL definitely has the superior macaroni salad. My pickle had an identity crisis, it couldn't decide to live life as a pickle or a cucumber rinsed in vinegar.

The service was weird. There was no greeting when we walked in. We stood by the "Please wait to be seated" sign awkwardly until the cashier told us 3 minutes later to seat ourselves. Look, the sign told me otherwise, how was I supposed to know what to do?

Once we sat down, we waited for someone to take our drink orders and to give us menus. Took us a second to realize they have those crappy newspaper menus like Egg Works on the condiment stand. Invest in regular menus please.

The waitresses were completely unorganized, two different ladies tried to take our drink order.

I wouldn't come back, even if their dessert case was the only display I appreciated.
Bagel Cafe has an impressive authentic deli full of real deal pastries and fabulous cheese selections meats and breads.

This place deserves 5 stars but the service and way we were treated when we went to pay and buy additional baked goods was horrible. We were ignored by guys behind the counter. Waited by the side cashier for 10 minutes while she said "oh you have to wait for a guy to get your ordered". By then we had it. Put back the $14 pie we were going to buy and lost a sale for additional items. Would have been nice if when we told the waitress we wanted a few things she could have made sure someone helped us out at least when we walked but but she was MIA half the meal too. Guess we'll make the trip to Weiss next time because at least we will get great service.

Corned beef cabbage was delicious. Matzo ball soup was OK. I had it better in New York.  
Fries were very good as well. Salads are huge.  Share it with someone portions are big.
I had brunch last Sunday and the eggs Benedict was amazing! The black and white cookie didn't disappoint either! Will definitely go back!

LOVE LOVE LOVE breakfast here... The omelets are amazing... Bagels are fresh and cream cheese that you cannot find anywhere! Their desserts are incredible and have something that appeals to everyone in your party! It's a bit tucked away, but if you're ever in the area, try it! You won't be disappointed!

This place was a disappointment. I made an order through GrubHub and the asiago bagels had a few specs or spots of cheese. The cheddar jalapeño lacked both ingredients and my daughters fruit parfait had a moldy raspberry.  Only two stars for the chives cream cheese. I spent over $50 and was very disappointed.

Came here for breakfast, very unfriendly welcome from the staff, very unprofessional set up,mediocre quality and portions, but above all, very expensive $15 for a thin lox bagel without coffee, when at Station Casinos breakfast is under $10 everything included? Never again...Actually, they deserve 0 stars, not even one.

We went to the bagel cafe to get some bagels and also some pastrami to make sandwiches at home.   
  I ordered a pound of pastrami which was over $16 and asked to see what it looked like, and it looked fine.  However, when we got it home it was dried out a bit and very, very lean that it tasted like corned beef instead.   I warmed it up and it was totally dry.    It had no fat on it which maybe might be good, but this had no taste at all.  Very disappointed in the pastrami.  If it doesn't have any fat in it, it is tasteless.  I will not buy this again.  Bagels, yes, pastrami, NO!  Sorry!  Bought some sable fish also, which was good,but $50 a lb???? wow! ( only bought a few slices and  it was over $15)
Great pastrami sandwich! Make sure you request the navel versus brisket pastrami. Follow that up with some butter cookies! Yum, yum!

Love, love, love this restaurant! If your looking for a huge meal look no further than the Bagel Cafe! I love their breakfast, lunch and dinners! The pastries and the fresh baked bagels and in house cream cheese are all amazing! Come hungry! The staff is All amazing too! A+++++

I had a special request for a Las Vegas themed wedding cake for my son's wedding in November & The Bagel Cafe did an amazing job! Their wedding cake looked perfect & was so delicious!! I love this place great food & a phenomenal bakery! I highly recommend them if your looking for an amazingly delicious dessert or cake for your special occasion!

Ok, so returned for a 2nd visit and this went much better than breakfast on my last visit. Had a bowl of chicken soup and it was terrific. Took some dill pickles to go, big disappointment... Weiss beats them hands down. But the soup was a winner...
Love the food but also heather is an amazing server!!!! I will be back soon to continue to enjoy the food and the wonderful service !!!!

We took bagels and cheesecake to go--which reminds me, I still have the cheesecake in the fridge. BRB FOOLS. 

Yum! Now that I have been reminded what a delicious cheesecake this is, I feel I have the strength to write the rest of this review. My friend and I got the strawberry cheesecake for our late-night Netflix girltime dessert fancies, and bagels and cream cheese for the next morning's airport run shenanigans. 

I tend to like a more dense, fatty, hilariously-bad-for-you cheesecake, but this one is light and airy and is a-okay for me. The fruit on top is good, but I don't like the red-40 laced syrup they drizzle on top of it. Next time I'll just get the plain because it's a good cheesecake overall.

However, the real winners here are the namesake of the Cafe--the bagelssssss. I got spinach and feta, my friend got the egg bagel with everything on it. Both were good, though after spending the night in the fridge, were nearly impossible to cut. I eventually got them both in the toaster and gobbled all those carbs at 7am (which led me to sleepy time for most of the rest of the day). 

All in all a decent place. I want to try it as a restaurant instead of a deli, too. Good thing it's right down the street from my best friends' house so I have an excuse to visit!

This place is always good, chopped liver and potato pancakes are my favorite thing. The variety of the menu is great the bagels are good, the cream cheese selection is great as well. I'm not a fan of the service as it's inconsistent, one visit it's great and other visit it's awful. 

The cookies are not good, black & white cookie is more like cake and the chocolate chip big cookie is beyond dry I could probably break drywall with it.. but the cakes I've tried are pretty tasty. 

Overall, avoid the cookies, everything else on the menu is good and beware of inconsistent service
Best bagels in town! This isn't some bagel chain store, they truly put heart into their baking and food. Everything is so delicious and their baked goods display is so beautiful!

I LOVE bagels!!! Did I mention that I LOVE bagels?? 
My current hometown does not have a bagel spot and so it's either a grocery store or bakery that I have to find bagels at and then all the yummy goodies that go with bagels are non existence with the above options so I'm left with having to concoct my own or just adding some cream cheese, again nothing fancy, just store bought...... meh.
Sooooo, when traveling and breakfast is a must, I tend to look for bagel shops and this yummy place popped up on Yelp, so we made our way over. Location is not the best, it was a Saturday so that didn't help but parking was sparse and crowded and once we walked in the place was HUGE! The greeter was super nice and I asked how long it would take to be seated as there was so many people and she advised if we where on a time constraint that we should order at the deli, this was greatly appreciated. This cafe is basically a full fledged restaurant in the rear with an open deli/ bakery in the front and it's a great concept!
We where super pleased with our food, LARGE portions and so many options! A great place for breakfast and BAGELS!

I've been living in Las Vegas for years and for the longest time I would constantly drive by this place but never got the chance to check this place out. Truthfully, whenever I think about bagels I would think about Einsteins and didn't have the desire to stop by. However, my sisters (fellow Yelpers) and I decided to try this place out since its been bookmarked in our Yelp all for a long time. 

From the moment you step into this place, your transported back east to New York. The cafe set up is straightforward with a large dinning room on one side and a bakery/deli on one side for takeout. There is a constant flow of people coming in and leaving. It's apparent by the many awards and celebrity photos with autographs that this cafe is very popular.

We ended up sitting in the dinning room and ordered 3 different omelette, lol. A cool thing about the omelette dish, it came with a choice of a side item. We all opted for the homestyle fries and was very pleased with the flavor and consistency of the seasoned potatoes (highly recommended). Each dish came with a Bagel and Cream Cheese of your choice, which was unexpected since our omelettes dishes were very sizable in portion. We ended up getting a plain, everything and asiago bagel. All the bagels were fresh and delicious with no compliant, just prepare yourself for a carb craze meal. The 3 omelettes we got were the Mushroom and Cheese, Veggie and Spinach and Feta Cheese, which was our favorite but they were all good. Overall we had a great experience and our server Kayla was good and knowledgeable about everything including the history of The Bagel Cafe. We will come back to try out more of their delicious food!

2017 Yelp Review #25

Upon walking into this cafe everything looked delicious and fresh! In addition to the multitude of bagel and cream cheese selections, there were also several pastries and such to choose from. I had the spinach and feta bagel with the cream cheese with smoked salmon mixed into it and it was good! They put A LOT of cream cheese though, and the spinach and feta bagel didn't really taste like spinach or feta. I will definitely stop by again when I'm in the area!

Let me start out by saying that the nova cream cheese is no joke. Absolutely delicious. And the bagel is on point.  I've had the sandwiches here before and they're damn good too but pricey.  I'm  very disappointed with their "omelet" however.  When I think of an omelet I think of ingredients bound together by egg.  Apparently their definition is different. 

I got the Ruben omelet expecting to have meat and sauerkraut and cheese throughout the omelet.  What I got instead was a Ruben sandwich with an egg wrap.  That's right. An egg wrap.  With the cheese on top.  I was extremely disappointed. I ended up just eating the meat.  Everything should have been mixed together with the egg.  And for the price is was absolutely not worth it.  The bagel and nova cream cheese were delicious which is the only saving grace.  I'm never getting an omelet here again!

Awesome awesome awesome! The ONLY reason I'm not giving 5 stars is because they really need to clean their bagel case. I was looking at it and on the top left I saw spider webs and a lot of dust all over. Nasty... but yes, I still got a bagel with my breakfast and it was the best ever. 

JUST PLEASE CLEAN YOUR BAGEL CASE!

Oh my goodness this place is the best. No matter what I have ever ordered it's always amazing, they have the best matzoh ball soup! And this's family owned restaurant really does have great severance.
Great locals place for breakfast or lunch . Delicious matzo soup // and crazily their fruit salads are the best in town

The food was absolutely disgusting. My egg benedict just made throw up and their potatoes are also just as disgusting. I literally threw up a little when any of their food touched my mouth. Service is also slow. Would not ever go there again
Super impressed by this place! Amazing size portions and very helpful staff. Food was amazing! Prices were a bit higher but when I saw the portion size- made complete sense! Can't wait to go back!
Best bagel in town hands down! Reminds me of bagel stores in New York. A bit pricey but then again you get what you pay for. I usually get bagels and some pastries.

Absolute WORST customer service ever!!!! Ordering from here twice within a week on grub hub, Same EXACT lox platter which is like $18+ platter. First time it was delicious, less than week later ordered same EXACT platter and it tasted like someone dumped entire container of salt on the ENTIRE platter, absolutely disgusting!!! I called to complain and the rude manager didn't care.. kept saying the lox I ordered is the salty one... didn't even acknowledge that I told him everything on the platter was salty even the olives and tomatoes, didn't acknowledge that I mentioned that I ordered less than a week ago and no excuse for the inconsistency.. he was so rude and didn't care one bit! NEVER AGAIN WILL I ORDER FROM HERE. I'll take my business elsewhere. Zero stars! We would have been regulars if their was consistency in their food and decent customer service when a problem arises. Gross!!!

After reading restaurants reply below: Again, I explained to the manager that I ordered the SAME EXACT PLATTER twice in a week & have receipts on grub hub showing identical order, I ever offered to show them...yet you cannot even acknowledge the severe inconsistency in your foods from one day to the next instead you insult me and say I used profanity and blame me for the item I ordered . Yes, I ordered the belly lox, both times...so in that case why was the first platter not salty? Horrible customer service any other establishment would have refunded or sent new item! Unacceptable gross place never again will I eat here I'll send my business elsewhere 

I did give him a chance to fix the issue by Calling and he didn't do a thing. Waste of time and money 


I will Call grub hub too now to complain thank you for the idea!

I was so excited to come here after having this place bookmarked for a month or so and driving by on a weekly. My boyfriend and I finally came in on a Sunday morning and it was packed!
