The coffee was aromatic and flavorful. Service was standard, nothing to write home about. 

 I could not stop there, though, and had to take something home. The chicken pot pie looked too good to pass up. Reheated, the gravy was buttery and creamy, reminding me of a rich cream base you would find a clam chowder, just with chicken.

 I will return with a few things to on my mind to try, including the lox, and the huge eclair.

I am an advent bagel lover so obviously I needed to check this place out. I've had them a few times when coworkers brought them in and I loved how fresh & delicious their bagels and cream cheeses were, but never actually went inside.

This most recent time I finally came in for a take out order. I like that the set up is separate for take out orders vs sitting down and dining in. I decided to go with the pepperoni pizza bagel on a garlic bagel. The portion was huge, definitely worth the money. I really liked the flavor of it, but wasn't a huge fan of all the oil which made the bagel itself kinda soggy. 

Overall I still think this place is great and would certainly come back again for some take out bagels or to try their dine in options. Such a cute little home towny place!

Best bagels in Vegas. I really miss this place since we moved back to California. No bagels even close to this good in OC. LA yes. I used to eat here 2 - 3 times a week. The everything, sesame, and poppy bagels are great. The cranberry is also awesome. The flavored cream cheeses are excellent as well. Black and white cookies and others sweets are good too.

Love the Bagel hated the customer service when I came in there was no smile on nobody's face everybody look like they hated their job it was just a bad environment to be in I don't think I'll be going there again I'll find another bagel place also that was my first time going so I didn't know where to go and they all just looked at me like if I was stupid PS they ruined my morning

I have eaten here a lot.  Had cob salad with blue cheese.  Found a noodle in my blue cheese dressing and it was water thin.  Gross gross, the cheese looked like cottage cheese in the dressing.  Gross gross.  Don't order this.

This is for the bagels only. Bagels are good; better than the average decent bagel in the world. The crunch of the exterior is just snappy enough, and the insides have the proper cushiony bounce without tasting fake. The few flavors I tried all worked: The plain (duh), the egg (yes), and the spinach feta (thought, what the H -- turned out great.)

It's been years since I've actually eaten here, so I can't speak to current strengths/weaknesses of the dining experience.

The bagels, however, are good, if a bit pricey. You'd do better to get a Dozen (which really means 14) than just a handful. But get what you need - it'll be worth it.

Thank god I don't live closer to this place. They have the one of the best varieties of bagels & shmear choices in Vegas. Almost reminds me of NYC (not quite:( ), but close.. They have cakes (whole & per slice) ,cookies, rugala to meet your every sweet tooth craving. This place is big & normally pretty full. Doesn't take long before being seated. If I lived in Summerlin, this would be a regular stop. They serve breakfast & lunch, large menu, food is all good. Looking at the pictures of the bagels make me want to go!!( Bad bad bad)

Garlic cheddar cream cheese changed my life. Super slow service though. The matzoh ball and chicken noodle soup are both good. They also offer a grilled cheese with tomato and bacon which I always plan on ordering but then the bagels just look so good.... don't go here on your lunch if you work in corporate america like me and only get an hour break unless you work literally across the street. They have a huge dessert selection. Staff is nice, they just are not in a hurry. I totally recommend going here and getting a dozen bagels and cream cheese for your co-workers in the morning. They are the best bagels in town.

This place is ALWAYS packed and after visiting a few times, I can definitely see why!!! It's a restaurant, bakery, and a little meat market all in one! They give you HUGE portions. I don't think we've ever left without a doggie bag! Everything we've ever gotten has been so fresh and delicious. Their potato pancakes are gigantic. The first time we ordered them, we were thinking about getting another order because the menu said it would only come with three, but when they came out, we were glad we stuck with our ONE order. Usually, I find, the bigger the portions, the sucky-er the food, but not the case with this place!

This was my first time here. When you first walk in the first thing you see are the deli cases, the display cases with the bakery items, and a variety of bagels. They have several different kinds of cream cheese, cakes, pastries, meats, salads, etc. We were told to seat ourselves and a waitress would come to the table. I also noticed there were a few people waiting for take-out at the counter. The menu is huge. It pretty much has everything you would expect at a deli of this size.

I'll go over each item.

Pastrami Ruben: The bread was too greasy from too much butter. The pastrami was definitely not made in house. The sandwich was okay. I probably wouldn't order it again. The fries they serve are pretty awesome though. I definitely like the fries! I also like the cucumber salad they serve on the side. Oh and their deli style pickles are also freakin' awesome!! Great pickles.

Matzo Ball Soup: I never had it before. It was pretty much chicken noodle soup with two dumplings. It was okay, but not something I would order again.

Lox & Bagel: The platter came with the smoked salmon, tomatoes, onion, capers, cream cheese, and bagel. Everything on the platter was excellent except for the bagel. It did not taste like a fresh made bagel. It was more like something from the store. It was not bad, but I was expecting better.

The potato knish and the potato pancake were very good. This was the first time I ever ate a knish. I would probably order it again.

The service was good. Our server was very pleasant. Overall the food was not anything spectacular. Sorry to disappoint all the reviewers who gave them 4 and 5 stars, but I didn't eat anything that made me want to rush back here. It was just okay.

Passing through Vegas and found this place on Yelp. I am very glad that I came in.  There is soo much to choose from and everything looks absolutely delicious! Thank goodness for good staff, Clayton helped me decide what to order & was very kind, helpful, and had exceptional customer service. Food isn't the only thing that makes a place great. I believe it's all about who works there. Well at least for me that's how I know if I will revisit a place. Thanks to Clayton and the yummy food I will remember this spot, return in the future & recommend to my local friends.

I'm give this place 4 stars for its amazing service and smoked salmon. I ordered the all nova lox and boy was it big. I was full by the time I was half a bagel in. I will say, it was salty with the olives, pickles, and salmon, but I put more cucumber and cream cheese and YUM. The smoked salmon was actually imported from Brooklyn, NY. It was very thinly sliced (UH-MAZING) and super fresh. I ordered the plain bagel for my lox, but even when they heated it up, it was still cold and not that soft. I looked around and almost all the people in the restaurant ordered breakfast items rather than the bagels. 
I also ordered the cup of soup with a side of garden salad and it was really good! I had the matzoh soup and it was good. It tasted almost like chicken noodle soup but different. The garden salad was very big and delicious. I had thousand island dressing on the side.

I know it's a bit much but I had, bar none, the BEST chicken breast I've ever had!!!  I didn't even know boring old chicken breast could be so mouth wateringly delicious but it was.  Melted Swiss on top with a side of homemade sliced fresh cucumber salad and a dollop of fresh cottage cheese, farm fresh lettuce and tomatoes made it a meal to remember.   Oh, and the service was five star!!  I'll be back soon.

Great selection of  quality bagels and spreads.
Sweets look good too, can't wait to try them

Their coffee and bagels are great. My omelet was big, bland and boring, though. 

Also, I never, ever trust a bakery whose pastries are that oversized; they're usually trying to compensate for lack of flavor or quality.

I'd give them fewer stars, however their name is BAGEL Cafe, and their bagels ARE pretty decent.

We've been here several times and always leave satisfied. The matzo ball soup is good, sandwiches are tasty, and the fries are really good. Prices are typical for a deli. We've never had service issues either. I docked one star because the breakfast portions are on the small side and hubby isn't a fan of the chopped liver.
Good variety of food.  Has a bakery.  Easy seating and the food comes out fast.  The parking is probably my only complaint!

Great breakfast, but the bagels (and endless variations of cream cheese) kept me coming back. My mom lives in Vegas and I tried this place on my last visit, which led to me visiting it two more times the entire week I was there. Definitely a must try for anyone who lives off the strip or wants to escape it for an hour or two.

We were running errands with a long list of to dos when the hunger pangs bit.  Bagel Cafe was just at the next offramp. So an instant decision was made to duck in for a quick bite.  After all it was well after 1 o'clock and the lunch crowd should have moved on.  Sure enough, we were seated immediatly and put in an order for soup and two sandwiches, a glass of water and a soda.  Anxious to move on with the day's agenda we got our soup and drinks instantly.  Then we waited and waited and waited some more for two simple sandwiches.  After a number of apologies from our server and another 30 minutes, they finally arrived.  Food is always great here, but the kitchen staff needs to step up its speed game.

This is a very popular breakfast/lunch place. When you walk in you are tempted with tons of delicious pastries ( not a good place if you are on a diet, but probably worth the calories) if you are coming to eat here over the weekend expect to wait from 10-30 minutes.. Is the wait worth it? The food is not bad, but personally I only wait for amazing food. Another thing I did not like was their warning on the menu. The ask to please not to share the sandwich!!!! Come on!!! It bothers me a lot when restaurants tell you what to do, its not like I'm not paying for the product, it shouldn't be your concern what I do with my food! Good thing I dont like sandwiches but the warning is just annoying
I ordered the crab egg Benedict and it was too fishy for my taste. I know it sounds weird but I hate when my meal smells and tastes too fishy!  I had to opportunity to try the turkey sandwich and it was pretty fresh. However, the sandwich was not extraordinary! Overall, decent food and good pastries

Great breakfast place! On our vacation we came here on the first morning and had bagels to go. And on our last morning here in Vegas we came back to the bagel Café to sit for breakfast. Love that they have pumpernickel bagels! And the  coffee is hot! Definitely recommend this place!!!!

My husband and I have been trying out new spots (for us) for breakfast and if I could give this place 10 stars!!!! We had the biscuits and gravy and a sausage and cheese omelet.  The biscuits in the biscuits and gravy were absolutely awesome!!  Better than grandma made!  Everything on out plates was delicious and the service was friendly and timely.  On our way out, we stopped by the bakery in the front and took home some toll house bars and apple fritters!  WHOA, they were so good!   We will definetly be back and recommend to everyone one we know!!!

The service is very friendly and they have an amazing selection of hand-crafted eats. The bagels and lox are amazing and I love the freshness of the bagels. The scallion cream cheese was delicious. We will definitely be visiting again.
Awful!!!!  Do not go here.  Poor service, really bad attitudes, food is just average and overpriced!!!!  Bagels really aren't very good.  Want good deli  food go to Cantors, they rock!

Busy mornings I must say, took a second to get us seated but busy means good!
There's a cafe and a bakery separate from each other inside! You can also choose take out! As for pasteries, there was a lot to choose from! 
Very very loud inside, but since I've only been here in the morning I don't know how it's like during lunch.

The menu is really big, so I took the longest time trying to pick something. Don't get me wrong though I love variety! 
The food came out fast, and had us filled! Will be back!

Awesome lunch. Traditional NY deli and the sandwiches are big enough to choke a pig.
I got a baked salmon salad, and I had to bring half home.
Definitely going back

Born and raised in New York the warm and soft bagel is a part of my heritage. It seemed that I would have to board the Concorde if I was to have a New York bagel in a reasonable time. That was until I stepped foot in the Bagel Cafe.

  The Bagel Cafe is a slice of the Big Apple approximately ten miles northwest of NY-NY in the Summerlin community of Las Vegas. The four times that I have had breakfast here in very recent times, my mind literally left Vegas and entered a New York bagel restaurant. As soon as I stepped on line, displayed right to my left were Wise Potato chips. Wise Potato chips are a popular brand of potato chips that are extremely popular in New York, but sold in a few places in Vegas :( . When I looked to the right, standing out from the display cases of cookies were the rainbow cookies. Since leaving New York, I have rarely laid eyes on them in Las Vegas. The closest rainbow cookies that I have seen to Las Vegas were at Chompie's Deli in Phoenix. After being seated sitting in front of me was the warm and soft bagel. Three times, I ordered egg salad on a bagel and once a BLT on the warm and soft bagel. The quality was superb. The bagel sandwich was overflowing with egg salad that was topped off with lettuce, onions, and a tomato. The BLT was the antithesis of the pathetic BLT that I recently ordered at Panera Bread. It was overflowing with crunchy beacon. With each sandwich, I ordered potato salad and coffee. The coffee tasted just as good as the bagel shops that I remembered before Starbuck's came on the scene. In actuality, the coffee is just as good as Starbuck's.

  Just like New York, the Bagel Cafe is crowded. Parking is a challenge, and it is almost guaranteed that some walking is required. The Bagel Cafe is located in a professional park on the west side of Buffalo Drive south of the Summerlin Parkway. Unlike the New York City landmarks, it blends in with the professional buildings. On account of the parking lot being linear with the popularity of the Bagel Cafe, each time I had to walk the distance of two professional buildings (not complaining. I went here before hikes). On weekends, there was a wait. The Bagel Cafe is relatively large and the weekend waits were no longer than 15 minutes. On the other hand, it was less crowded on a Wednesday at 1 p.m., and the "Please Wait to Be Seated" sign was turned around to "Please seat yourself."

  The Bagel Cafe differentiates from the prices of the New York bagel shops that I know of in New York. Unless inflation at the New York Bagel shops went up in double digits, the Bagel Cafe prices seem steeply higher than those of the bagel shops that I remembered. From my experiences here, it is the Waitresses that can make and break the price. The first two times that I had my New York moments here, the sweet Waitress passed on a tip that if you order a sandwich on a bagel instead of bread (Did not come here for bread) that you get a full sandwich for the price of a half sandwich. Fast forward to the last two times, and the impersonal Waitress was charging me for the full sandwich (check with tip came to around $15). But what could I do?  It would still be far less expensive than flying in a Concorde to New York.

  If you grew up with the New York bagel, or are just a fan of it; I recommend the Bagel Cafe. On the four visits that I visited Bagel Cafe, I have made it a point to stop by on the way to a park. Admittedly I planned to hike in a nearby park a couple of those times with the excuse to check-in here. I am so confident that I will get in a mood for the New York Bagel. With that said, I see Bagel Cafe check-ins in my future.

****Please note that there are other establishments using the Bagel Cafe name or similar to it. The one in the Sun Coast I rated 2 stars.

Love this place! Old school Jewish bakery feel. Bagel sandwiches are super fresh and amazing!! Serve variety of breakfast and lunch items, but I love their bakery items more than that. Great for picking up quick treats for clients that you can't find at a grocery store.

Worst customer service for a walk-in I have ever experienced. Walked in on June  26th, 2017 at 7:15am in the morning. I was waiting in front of cash register to place an order to go. One employee was organizing silverware the other sitting in the counter having his coffee. After standing there for 2 minutes employee organizing silverware asked if I was waiting to place order. I replied with a yes, nothing happens for the next 2 minutes. I turn around, walk out the door get in car and leave. I think the person drinking his coffee was the manager. Well, we don't want his coffee getting cold. By the way, place was empty.

Always awesome here they have all kinds of desserts, super fresh salads and great soups. Usually a short wait and it's always worth it because when you sit down you're given great service. Open on holidays which is really great.
The parking lot is horrible no one parks in the lines and it's really too small for such a popular bakery surrounded by offices but that's usually the only negative.

Homemade Potato Pancakes with Sour Cream and Apple Sauce ($10.95). The exterior had a nice crisp, but since the pancakes were so large and dense, the interior was not as pleasant in texture or flavor (imagine somewhat-cooked, mushy, grated potatoes with no seasoning). They looked more like burger patties than pancakes. The sour cream and apple sauce did not help.

Side of Homemade Corned Beef Hash ($6.95). Tasty with a decent crispiness. Definitely one of the better corned beef hash I've had in the valley, though not amazing.

Crab Cake Benedict with Lump Jumbo Crab ($15.95): The crab cake was good and the portion is very generous. Decent hollandaise. The home fries were just okay.

Combination Platter 2: two bagels, two cream cheeses, 9 oz. fish ($33.95). I chose Everything and Egg bagels, Scallion and Olive Pimento cream cheeses, and Nova, Lox, and Smoked Whitefish. Each of the Smoked Fish Platters come with tomato, red onion, cucumber, olives, pickles, and capers. The bagels are great. I got them lightly toasted (the best) and they had great taste and texture. The cream cheeses were also good and I really enjoyed these particular flavors. I did try a bit of the Garlic Cheddar and that one good, though I preferred the other two. The Nova and Lox were great, however, the Whitefish was not as smokey or tender as I'd like. Not a big loss for me since I'm more concerned about the salmon anyway. Lastly, I loved all the fixings! The pickles were great and all the vegetables were fresh and plentiful.

The food was a hit or miss for me. Though I enjoyed the Smoked Fish Platter, everything else was just all right. In addition, service was shoddy. Our server was very nice, however, she rarely came to check on us (we had to flag her or someone else down three times). We didn't receive a single water refill when we began to look around the restaurant and wondered if that was typical. It wasn't; other diners' cups were refilled moments after I saw them empty. Our cups remained empty while we continued to look for someone to assist us.
come hungry! best bagels, cream cheese, omelets!!!! love every thing they make (except desserts, i don't think they use butter, so desserts are just ok) highly recommend!

The to-go bagels are fantastic, incredible quality. However when I went in for lunch today, the corned beef sandwich gave me pretty severe food poisoning. Currently writing this from the bathroom.. like I said, stick to the bagels and you'll be fine. A bit pricey, but totally worth. 

EDIT:

As you can see somebody from the restaurant aggressively responded to me and essentially called me a liar.  I had eaten nothing else that day, and my illness was most certainly not caused by anything other than my meal at this restaurant. I have never had the flu, a stomach virus or food poisoning before eating here. 
They have just lost two customers and I will be sure to spread my opinions to coworkers and friends. 

Downgraded to one star due to their response. It was unnecessary, rude and simply inaccurate.
Good kosher food, excellent deli, and best bagels in town. Deli staff is rather direct, borderline rude, but that's the traditional deli way I guess. A hidden gem

All I have to say is when my friends come over with Hamantaschen on Sunday's for our weekly Walking Dead parties
I go bananas 
I lived in lake Las Vegas and this place was in Summerlin so it was a way out for me

The hamantaschen was rockin

Rarely can a place garner a 5 star review from multiple critics and diners alike. But the bagel cafe has done what do many fail at. Give you amazing service , and some of the best damn breakfast you can get while at it. From walking in the decor is just welcoming. The staff greets with smiles acknowledging you the moment you step in and doesn't have that hectic busy , let's get everyone out of here were in a rush type of vibe.walking in already simply inviting. Its also good to just do something different and that's what the bagel cAfe does. Different . the menus are printed in newspaper and give you bagel chips with cream cheese that changes every now and then. Giving the freedom to the staff to experiment is also a giant bonus in my book and man can they pull it off. Bring any tourist to this spot and you're guaranteed positive feedback. Trust someone who has. The Apple and orange juice are as fresh as you can taste and just gives you that smile on your face from every sip. From the delicious omelettes, sandwiches , and bagels that they serve, to the freshness of the juice you drink down, and all the way until you step out the door of this amazing restaurant , you are sure to have a smile on your face. And that can be surprisingly rare in today's food industry. 

Kudos to the owners and the chef! 
And thank you to all the staff for making this a five star restaurant !

Food is excellent. If you need an idea for lunch try the tuna sandwich. The potato pan cakes were fabulous.

I ordered a hamburger with cheese got home and no cheese on the burger. Really???? I called the they said they were sorry.

Excellent Bagels! Much better than Einstein Bagels. If you're in the area you should definitely try it. Very nice inside and a wide variety of other things I wasn't expecting like smoked whitefish, sturgeon, salmon, and also pastries of all kinds. The cashier could have been a little friendlier, other than that the Bagel was awesome and they really slap on a lot of cream cheese. It was a meal in itself. I also couldn't resist getting some fresh squeezed orange juice.Thanks!

Fantastic place! Easy to see why it has been "Las Vegas Best" , so many times. 
From the super stacked sandwiches to the salads and bagels and baked good from their amazing bakery. There is so much to choose from, you won't leave dissapointed!!
Oh wow this place is always amazing! Corned beef, lobster rolls, matza soup and bagels are so delicious. And their pastry and sweet selection are insane. A tad bit pricey but worth it.

I'm from out of town and I've eaten here probably a dozen times.  This place is a "must go to" for anyone who truly loves Jewish deli food.  Let me just say I am very hard to please as far as real Jewish food goes.  I usually hate restaurant matzo ball soup but saw someone else order it and it looked great so I ordered it.  It was perfect.  A hearty chicken noodle soup with loads of noodles, chicken chunks, onions and carrots.  The matzo balls were perfect.  Not those typical light fluffy things other delis serve.  A solid 10 out of 10.   The blitzes were the same.  Super perfect and delicious.  10 out of 10.  Potato knish was good, not the best I've had.  Maybe a 7 out of 10.  Sandwiches look amazing but I've never tried one.  They have an amazing bakery too. Had many wonderful things from there.  Cheesecake is an 8, carrot cake is a 9.

One of my favorite breakfast places in town!!! It's really chill and the ambiance feels like I've been transported to New York. Get anything with lox here, matzoh ball soup, and you have GOT to make sure you check out their pastry selection. They are to die for. Boston cremes as big as my head! Everything here tastes fresh! So explore ahead without fear~ *Note: DON'T FORGET THE DELI.

My only gripe with this place is every single time I've been here the service is terrible. Been left here waiting for 15-20 min at my table to get my order out...and it's not even busy. And splitting checks is always hard---SO BRING CASH. Regardless, I love the place still...just not enough for a 5 star..4.5 starts please?!
As good as it gets!  Great breakfasts and crazy good desserts at a fair price with good service.
Amazing cheesecake!   Haven't met a pastry at the Bagel Cafe I didn't love!  Great variety for breakfast and lunch.  Sometimes a little crowded or a bit of a wait, but worth it!

Just take one step into this place and you'll know why it automatically gets 5 stars.  The enormous case of gorgeous desserts, alone, is enough to earn them.  As for the menu, I can't think of anything that doesn't appear on there.  It is so hard for me to decide what to get, that I always know before I even order that I will be in pain from over-stuffing myself by ordering multiple items.  Sourdough bagel with strawberry cream cheese! The oatmeal!  The eggs benedict!  The potatoes!  Black and white cookies!  The only things I'm not impressed with is the coffee (like coffee-flavored water) and the matzoh ball soup (my mom's is waaaay better - her matzoh balls and broth have flavor).  Everything else is amazing.
Simple review:  Nothing but the best!! Real bagels, lox, cakes, whatever your NYC/NJ heart desires will be found here!

I'm from NJ, so this girl knows what makes a good bagel. These are definitely very good bagels. I got an egg salad sandwich on a bagel with a side of potato salad. The egg salad was alright - a little bland, but it was still pretty good. The egg bagel was sweeter than I am used to. I actually ordered it on an everything bagel, but they got the order wrong. The homemade potato salad with also alright. It had more veggies than I'm used to, but wasn't bad. Big fan of the Dr Brown sodas in the fridge. I think the $13 for my bagel and soda was pretty steep for what it was. I might go back again, but only for the bagels -- probably not for a whole lunch.

Best bagels in las vegas! Serioualy! Im a born and raises new yorker transplantes here. The first thing i tried to find when  i moved here was a good deli,pizza and bagel joint. As for bagels,this takes the cake. Fresh and juat like back home! Also their other bakery goods! Rugulah,real black and white cookies...soo good. Thwy also have the hard to find matzo bal soup! Its good but mine is better lol! Great place for breakfast or lunch, w friends and familu
Easily the best bagels in Vegas. Little pricey, but portions are huge! Have had the chicken salad sandwich here before. The onion super egg is my favorite

Ive been going here almost 10 years now. I just recently started bringing my boyfriend and it now our favorite breakfast spot.  He likes it a lot too.
I love corned beef hash and they make one the best ive ever had.  I get that almost every time.  The other things i get are always also very good too. Their portions are huge and they almost always come with a bagel on the side which are also best in town.  They also have giant NY city style oversized sandwiches. So good!! The salads and soups are also very good too!
They have that deli and bakery counter on your way in and out where they put out all their delicious oversized pastries. I mean cinnamon rolls, turnovers, cakes, and cookies that need to be picked up with two hands.  They make it impossible to leave without stopping by and picking up a pastry or two or three. ...or four...bottom.line.  This is a good place to eat.

I'm really getting sick of the service in this place. I walk in and ask the lady at the register if I should just grab a table..she does not even look up and acknowledge me or welcome me...they have zero servers in here..I got.my drink and told the drink lady I was ready to tell my server..I sat there for 10 minutes ..then there were screaming babies which just added to the total unpleasantness of the whole experience...I always drop at least 125/150 in here I always take a bunch from the deli but quite frankly I'm sick of their bs attitude and service..then that jerk I can't stand in the deli is screaming something accross the entire restaurant totally unpleasant and obnoxuous...and to the owner don't start sending me angry messages defending this crap people pay a lot of money to eat at your place and quite frankly it's not up to snuff.. I really don't care if you like it or not it's honest ..that's it
I love this place - it is a small slice of NY in Vegas! The bagels are the best and just like the ones I grew up on! I eat breakfast here at least 3 times a month!

So by now you know we eat out a lot.  We eat out with our kids at restaurants probably more than any other family in LV!!  Bagel Cafe is about a mile away, so it's been another stand-by...but not anymore.

First, their breakfast food and sandwiches are still great.  That's probably never going to change.  But we don't go there for dinner anymore like we used to.  Maybe you don't order a steak at a place called Bagel Cafe, but the last two times my wife wanted steak (while the kids wanted Matzoh Ball soup and stuffed cabbage!), the steak was nearly inedible - gristly, thin, not cooked evenly, and I would hate to see the expiration date on the meat, as it tasted pretty rancid.  I can almost picture a "Gordon Ramsay discovers something disgusting" Kitchen Nitemares moment, covering his mouth over a trash bin after a tirade of expletives.

Which brings me to my other HUGE gripe about Bagel Cafe....and it's not pleasant.  The bathrooms...are disgusting...'nuff said.  Maybe it's a result of the huge traffic they get for morning/brunch, and they simply can't stop to check/clean the bathrooms during the day??  There's no excuse for disgusting bathrooms at a restaurant, and probably no greater turn-off, not to mention the health issues.

Clearly, dinner is not their target meal, though they still list many great specials, at least the nights they're open past 5 p.m. (any day except Sun-Tue, I thnk).  To be fair, the traditional NY Deli type items are still great (yes, I too love tongue, liver, whitefish, and other hard-to-find deli sandwiches; knishes, etc.).  Bagel selection?  Fabulous.  The pastries still LOOK as good as ever, but sometimes, after 2-3 bites, I wish they were less sweet, less BIG, and tasted a little more 'special'.  Matzoh Ball soup?  Excellent, if you like the rich, thick, ultra-brothy variety that sometimes even have the layer of fat/oil floating on top.  Now I happen to like that, but today's finicky health-conscious 2010 diner may be immediately turned off....and watch out for the occasional bone shard! 

My last gripe about Bagel Cafe?  The tabletops are too small!  Maybe I have a sense of false entitlement for comfortable seating, but with the huge platter-size dishes (and additional plates for 'sides') they use, a 4-top with 4 people, even when 2 are kids, becomes a challenge in space planning and creative plate stacking.  OK, maybe this gets people in and out quicker...but I have to note this here as a legitimate complaint.  The booths are slightly roomier, but not much.  I feel like I'm sitting in the back row of a Southwest 737 with my seatback and traytable in their upright positions....

I wish I could be nicer to this place!  The servers are friendly and fun, and the kitchen staff often comes out and yuks it up with the clientele.  Maybe they oughta have someone also make rounds of the bathrooms, too...   All this adds up to my first 1-star rating...

Oh yeah...someone else mentioned the cashiers.  YES, I've had problems related to this also.  About 2 years ago, I saw triplicate charges coming through on my credit card about a month after dining here.  They resolved the problem by running credits through after the fact, but I had to bring it to their attention.  Also, if you watch your account like I do, you'll notice that they take FOREVER to clear your payment, which is always an indication that their internal controls and policies may be lacking.

Terrible service terrible communication Bob behind the bar was actually the manager is beyond rude

Screaming at me at the counter and how many cookies I wanted so he knew the proper box to put it in just take my order dude and then you could put it in whatever size box. 
I drove all the way from the strip to come here because of this the reviews reputations never again and the food was just okay former Jewish New Yorker just okay.
OH AND PS if u order a lox platter they'll serve u two measly ounces of lox without a bagel for 11.95 bagel 3.50 if your smart you'll order it at counter and eat at home for 4 ounces it was 10.95 and the bagel was 1.20. RIPPPPPPOPP off if u eat in!!! Oh and the lox they say us nova is actually salty belly lox. It's way cheaper. They think we all a bunchA schmucks ova here!!!!
Yum is all I can say! Great for families and fast! Great cream cheese you can buy and prices are average
This is one of las vegas's off strip hidden gem's. 1st time in this restaurant and very pleased with the food and service.

Always love coming here, but what a cluster.   From the organization at the front where they hostess stand is to waiting more than 10 minutes for the waiter to even acknowledge us, they need to re-configure their process, or hire more staff.   When I mentioned to the waiter that we had waited so long, he didn't seem to care and just asked for our order, with a little attitude.  If it was a food review alone, I would have given a 5, but service is so important that I'm only giving a 2 star (mainly due to the attitude).   

I'll try it again and will review or adjust this review accordingly.  

*** SERVICE RECOVERY UPDATE***
The waiter came very quickly with our food order, apologized for the wait and said "I put your order up next so you wouldn't have to continue waiting.  I also noticed your Yelp review so hope this helps".  I'm impressed not only with the service recovery but also that they are paying attention to these reviews.  Impressed.  Well done.

dont be fooled by the name! here you can order anything from bagels (duh!) to stuffed cabbage to piled high deli sandwiches to pie and cookies and cakes. oh my.. what an amazing selection the bagel cafe has. it gets pretty packed so if you dont want to wait you can order from the deli and take it to go!

i ordered a bagel with belly lox. came with lettuce, onion, tomato, and cucumber.. all on a platter so you can layer it however your heart desires. i tore the bagel apart in 4 pieces so i can mix it up a bit. lol. lox was perfect.. fresh.. salty.. and not fishy! 

friend ordered a spinach and feta cheese omelette. spinach was fresh! and the feta cheese melted perfectly.. was expecting it to be crumbly.. nice surprise there. on the side was a spinach bagel with jalapeno cheddar cream cheese. how awesome does that sound!!

other friend ordered stuffed cabbage and a bagel with strawberry cream cheese. tasted like they make all their spreads right there!

definitely will be back for more of their hearty portions. they have so many items it'll take a while to try them all. it was pretty busy so service was not too great but the food was well worth the wait.

Omg in love with this place! I saw it on an Instagram account and the breakfast sandwich sounded so yummy I had to check it out.

I didn't realize it until we arrived that it was a NYC Italian Bakery as well as a restaurant. There were so many different Italian desserts I wanted to try everything they had! They also offer meats, bagels and cream cheese spreads to buy in bulk as well. 

We got there around 11am on a Sunday so there was about a half hour wait. If you want to get right in I would suggest that you get there earlier.

I was so hungry and ready to eat when we sat down! I decided to get a breakfast sandwich on a jalapeno and cheddar bagel with an over-easy egg. I then added a sausage patty and chive cream cheese to it. Although it didn't look pretty it was amazing! I need to visit again so I can have this or the pizza bagel!

Love having local places like this!

Sorry I can't give you five stars and this is why......I haven't had all of your food yet. I'm from Long Island New York and been living in Vegas for over 15 years. I've been to many towns, cities and states in the U.S. and this by far is the closest thing to New York. If I closed my eyes I would swear I was in New York.

The service was great and hospitable. I ordered New York style potato knishes  and it was fresh hot and melted in my mouth. The mustard (spicy golden brown) was on point. I also ordered pastrami on rye bread. The rye bread was home made which also tasted like it was home made (amazing) pastrami was lean with little to no fat. I wanted to stand up and give you an ovation.  The black and white cookie was no comment (very Effin good)!! 

I haven't noticed any advertising other wise I would have been here sooner. Congratulation, any family member that comes to town and visit me, we are making a pit stop.

I'm obsessed with this place. My mom suggested we go here a few weeks ago and, at first, I was a little skeptical. It seems so small from the outside that I didn't think they could fit a whole restaurant inside. Well, they do!! They have a full breakfast and lunch menu AND on your way out you can pick up some killer bagels and baked goods. SO good. And their prices are great. Everything I have tried has been great - crab cake, and lots of others, Benedict mmmmm! And I love bringing their bagels home for the rest of the week.

Always outstanding.  They have the most wonderful offerings of fresh baked pastries and bagels around.  The deli is also packed with the best ready to eat treats.  Coming here has been a tradition since moving here, and I love to bring visitors.  The egg salad in jalapeño bagel with their house salad is enough for two meal, so I usually get the half portions on their sandwiches.

Some of the best food around!  I had always just stopped to grab bagels for the office for breakfast, but one morning when I was waiting for my order I looked around and the food in the restaurant part looked really good!  We decided to stop by for breakfast and it took a couple of tries before we were able to finally get in as they are busy and you need to get there early.  Both my boyfriend and I had the corned beef hash and eggs and it was delicious!!!  I've been craving it ever since.

I went for dinner a couple of times in the past week and their dinner food is just as great as the breakfast.  I had the beef stroganoff once and the chicken marsala the next time.  The chicken marsala is the best I have had!  So flavorful!  The meal also comes with roasted vegetables that are always really good.  I cna't wait to go back and try other dishes.  This is one of my favorite restaurants in town!
We've been patronizing this restaurant for several years.   Everything is always consistently good!

Best bagels in LV! 
Omg. I didn't even know I liked bagels that much until I had 1 from here. My favorite is the spinach and feta bagel with light scallion smear. 
We always get a bowl of the chicken matzo ball soup because it comes with a bagel. The chicken matzo ball soup is also the best in town! It is packed with so much chicken and is perfectly seasoned and the broth is not oily. 
Service is nice and fast. I also like placing an order for take out at the counter and looking through the pastry selection... The Rugula is worth giving a try too! 

Hot Tip: Apparently, you can't call in an order of matzo ball soup for pick up... You HAVE to come in and order it at the counter....but it doesn't take that long anyways.

This place has amazing bagels.  I'm a huge fan of the cinnamon raisin bagel with cinnamon raisin cream cheese.  I also like the chili here, and my hubby loves the chicken noodle with matzeball.

The reason I give it only three stars is because every single time I go, they're out of something.  In an effort to not waste food, they only make a certain amount each day.  The problem with doing this is that they are always out of something, and they expect you to change your order to accommodate their currently available items.  I hate this, and it's really frustrating.  Last time I went, they were out of three items before I finally just left. 

It's good food when they actually have their menu items.  I suggest going early before the lunch rush to avoid them running out of every other item.

I always want to order off the extensive sandwich menu, and love the reuben, whether with pastrami, corned beef or better yet a combination of the two (for slightly extra) but I inevitably fall on my favorite: the Matzoh Ball Soup. It is literally (not figuratively but in the very real sence) the best Matzoh Ball Soup I have ever tasted. They use both white and dark meat chicken (dark meat being where the flavor comes from) and are sparing in their use of white onions. Most soups with onions taste like onion soup with carrots and a tiny bit of chicken stock thrown in. Chicken is both the predominate flavor and ingredient. Spooning through it is like wading though a lake of chicken and flavor. It is divine.
I always order the bowel sized, it is good for two meals and comes with a bagel and the topping of your choice.  The spinach and feta bagel with the garlic-cheddar cream cheese is my favorite, but the jalapeno cheddar bagel/schmere is a close second.
And the pastry case! Cheesecake is the light and fluffy variety, I suspect they use mascarpone, and the fruit toppings are divine, rugelach, cookies, they even have "spinach pie" which I suspect is spanikopita but have yet to try because I always order the additively wonderful Matzoh Ball Soup.
Cannot recommend enough, but I have never eaten in, as the space is always oppressively hot, being a bakery and all, and I prefer to take the magic home and eat it in air conditioned luxury.

Their food is bar none.. A bit pricey but so worth it especially if you miss the east coast experience.. Irene a lovely woman from Greece was exceptionally sweet and courteous and in my opinion should be a waitress..not a busperson.. The same can not be said for Debra our waitress ..she was non-professional, short and at times right out rude. Otherwise I can only say.. This place is a gem.. Go and try it!!!

Best matzoh ball soup in town. I love getting breakfast here, best bagels and cream cheese, all made in house. Ive heard they have an amazing deli, but I've never had a chance to try their huge deli sandwiches.

Wow!!!!!!
What's going on at the counter???
Crazy music and guys cursing each other in Spanish? I speak Spanish and I don't appreciate this.
Please fix or we will stop coming in, we love this place for over 10 years but this will not make me want to comeback.

Another wonderful experience at the Bagel Cafe. I'm not sure how 100% can be improved. Service is wonderful. But I would suggest avoiding the high traffic times. Week days after 1 pm is my go to time. This late lunch is enough to carry me through the rest of the day. I'm just too full to think about dinner. Las Vegas prices with New York quality.

This place was excellent.  I live near Lake Las Vegas, so it's a hike for me.  I was up in Summerlin seeing a friend and decided to eat breakfast here.  Since it was a traditional NY style deli, I of course had biscuits and gravy.  I will say, the cream gravy was very good, had chunks of sausage in it.  Could have used a little more pepper.  The knish was good, but too thick for me.  It was crunchy and had good flavor, but if it were thinner, it probably would be the best I have ever had.  Service was great, although I went before 8 AM.  So, not even close to 1/2 full.  The deli case looked awesome, I wish I lived closer.  Given the drive, probably won't come back that often, but we certainly will come back some.  It's worth a half hour drive.

This place is wonderful! No complaints at all! Service is friendly and willing to help since it was my first time there. Ended up buying pastries for the go. Bought a pound of assorted rugulahs which included the Almond, Lemon Coconut, Chocolate Chip, Sugar Free Chocolate Chip, and the Apricot one. They were all AMAZING! Especially the Almond one. Will be coming back soon for sure!
They have The matzo ball chicken noodle soup on tap here. The food is amazing, delicious, and priced low. I could not believe all the stuff we walked out of there with and only spent like $30

Sooooooo good. We visit relatives in Vegas every Christmas and we are always begging to go back to this place. Portions are big and the service is ALWAYS friendly. The bagels and omelettes are always perfectly prepared and it's quite a benefit when they bring you bagel chips and the seasonal cream cheese to try.... (gingerbread cream cheese is delightfully delicious)! The coffee is always refilled with a smile and don't forget to grab a cookie or cupcake for your post-breakfast dessert. Sure wish we had one of these in Charlotte, NC!

Clean, upbeat, French cafe'ee. Liverwurst, even at breakfast! Yay! My Mom is totally fouled out. Heh.
 Different coffee drinks, hot or iced, coffee is tasty and good. 
 Fast service, and a good crowd. Eclectic, yeah. Ok, my family is grouching  I spend more time on here than with them. I give my family 5 stars, but that's another story. :)

I lived in Las Vegas for 25 years and have been coming to Bagel Café since they first opened 20 yrs ago with a very small deli & bakery with just a few small tables to sit at while you would wait for your order to go.  I loved it then and I love it now as it's grown into a full fledged restaurant with many wonderful dishes to offer.  There aren't too many places that make matzo ball soup as good as my own, but Bagel Café's is so good I don't need to bother making my own when I'm here.  I have never had any problem with the servers here, they've all been pretty good with staying on top of everything. I no longer live in Nevada but you can always find me here for my soup and bagel when I come to visit my grown kids.  The prices are little high, but still worth it to me. As always, I will be back again and again.

Met up with some other people at the Bagel Cafe, we were presented some Bagel Chips, which was nice while we waited, I ordered a Matzo ball soup which comes with a Bagel and was expecting just broth and Matzo, but it's more of a chicken soup with Matzo. Which is fine, just a little different than I normally have.
Someone else got pancakes, which they did not finish, and another had pastrami which split with a Knish. 
On the whole it was fine. We stopped by the bakery and got some macaroons. Crunchy on the outside, soft on the inside. Just the way I like them.

The food here is always good. I enjoy coming here with family and am always in the mood for the deserts. Just a tip though: check the hours before you sit because if you come anywhere close to closing time, the service goes downhill fast. We asked for dinners but apparently they don't serve them close to closing time and we heard constantly from the waitress that they were closing/or were closed. Felt like we were being kicked out even though we sat down and it was still a little over a half hour till close. Doesn't take super long to eat sandwiches. Oh well. Like I said the food is good and that's where the second star comes in but watch your clocks.

Getting a bagel here is like getting a bagel in NYC.  After moving here from the east coast I pretty much gave up on ever getting a decent bagel again.  That was until I met a former New Yorker who tipped me off to this place. His pizza suggestion was kind of a bust; but the Bagel Cafe really lives up to expectations.  I wouldn't go anywhere else west of Pennsylvania.

Really depends on what you get.  If you get the pastrami sandwich be prepared to love life.  Nice, slightly peppery and with a decent fat content.  Sometimes you get pastrami that's a little dry so their consistency of quality could be better.

Also have sat down to have breakfast there a  number of times.  Sometimes it's delicious and sometimes it's surprisingly mediocre.  Stick to their french toast as opposed to their omelet.  Bagels and cream cheese are always top quality there as well.  

Their desserts are huge and I've found them to be incredibly mediocre.  I know Jewish delis traditionally have those big desserts - but I'm not interested in paying like $5 for a big pile of flour and sugar thrown together.  Make it smaller and I'll pay the $5 for a quality product.

Mmmmmmm Bagel Cafe! On our weekend of adventures Jessie B and I stopped here. She'd never been and I've long loved Bagel Cafe. (They used to have a location in Henderson.) It was a Saturday and pretty busy, but we only had to wait like 5 minutes. 

Jessie and I looked over the menu. I knew that whatever I ordered I wanted a garlic bagel to be involved. Bagel Cafe's menu is huge and everything is tasty. After much back and forth I decided on the shrimp salad sandwich on a garlic bagel and a side of potato salad. Jessie choose the tuna salad on an everything bagel with a side of pasta salad. I also ordered an ice coffee! It was huge, but seriously watered down. I was so happy when our food came cause I was so hungry. My sandwich was piled high with huge shrimp, lettuce, tomato, and red onion. Yummy! It was heaven in my mouth. The shrimp melded so well with that soft garlic bagel. Tasty! It came with my favorite kind of pickle, the half done dill pickle! (Swoon) I didn't really care for their potato salad which I remember being good. I think I've been spoiled by Weiss's potato salad. Jessie also gobbled up her tuna sandwich. I was so glad she liked it. 

The service was good considering how busy it was. I love that their dining room is large and you can even just hit up the deli and take whatever you want home. 

I always love Bagel Cafe. The food is beyond wonderful. You may think the prices are a little high, but for the quality and portion size it's so, so worth it. If you've never been go now, right now!!
The sesame bagel and lite scallion cream cheese are amazing. Out of this world bakery. And a huge menu! Have to go back to try some more!

I ordered an egg and cheese on asiago bagel to go. There was a long line and the restaurant was full so I thought this is gonna be really good. He asked me if scramble was ok. I said over medium please so it's not runny. I also asked for Munster cheese. He said it would be ready in two minutes. I got my box to go. The bagel is not toasted the cheese is not melted and the egg is so runny all of the yolk is all in the box. Meh at least it was only $5. I wouldn't come back though.

LEGIT!!!

Having grown up in NY but now living in LV, we've missed legitimate delis like the Bagel Cafe.  I can seriously eat their CB and Hash special every day.  Their bakery has favorites we thought were gone forever after we left the east coast.

Thank you for the amazing sandwiches, bagels and baked goodness!

Our food was good. Our experience over all, not so great. Our server argued over something trivial with us instead of just saying, " Ok, let me get you a new one."  ( It was a cream cheese issue) We asked for the fan over our table to be turned off three separate times as it was freezing in there. Each time we were told ok. If you can't do it, just tell me instead of irritating me with an affirmative response. 
We will give it one more shot as everyone deserves a second chance. I know from experience that all people and places have their off days.
As for the food, he had a bagel and I had pancakes (due to oral surgery, I can't really chew yet). He was pleased with his bagel, was almost as good as back home (NJ). My pancakes we're amazingly good for a NY style deli place!! We can't wait to try some of the desserts we saw while there.

If you're looking for a Jewish NY deli style breakfast/brunch you should definitely stop by this place! 

Probably the best most authentic Jewish deli in Vegas. 

Yummy food. 
Big portions. 
Comfy booths and large space. 
Lots of parking. 
Friendly service. 


The menu is like a newspaper and you actually get a cool vibe while being inside. 

I would recommend to go with the:
Lox platter- smoked salmon is heaven made. 
French dip.
Eggs Benedict.
Most Sandwiches. 
Home fries. 

The only thing that might be a downside is a waiting list over the weekends. 15-25 min.

Great place overall! Highly recommended. 
Trust me. I know food! :)
Cute place. Love the menus!  They're little newspaper to give the NY feel  bagels were so yummy. LOTS of choices of the menu from breakfast- dinner and desserts!  Highly recommend.

Been a patron of The Bagel Cafe since I was a kid. It's not far from my house, but I would travel clear across the state for their food. I've lived in New York, arguably the capital of deli perfection. For me, The Bagel Cafe beats NYC's finest, shall we say, *efforts.* The corned beef is my personal favorite and unbeatable! Their bagels are top notch, and their desserts?! Bliss in the form of pastries!

To top it off, the staff- from the servers to the gentlemen in the deli/ to-go station- is always friendly, helpful, and welcoming.

I was so happy to be able to have lunch there today. And I look forward to the next time! Maybe tomorrow ;)

The food is so delicious! So many options it's over whelming. Lol. They don't skimp here on anything. The portion size is great for the price. Fresh desserts and bagels made everyday. The wait staff is very friendly and attentive. They even have a deli that you can get cuts of meats and other goodies from. Definitely a must for any bagel/New York style food lovers.

This place was amazing! I love the whole seat yourself concept. The service was really good. Our server was very attentive, apologetic if she forgot something, and found a conclusion to make it better. ( she forgot to refill our water after 10 min and said sorry and brought us a huge cup haha so cute) 

This place was super busy on a Friday morning. We got the normal eggs Benedict, crab Benedict, pizza bagel, and potatoe salad. Everything was cooked to perfection. I couldn't eat my pepperoni pizza bagel because I was so full from my Benedict! Overall I will be back to try their sandwiches and normal bagels :)
I felt like my Jewish grandmother was trying to fatten me up. best smoked sable ever!

This sandwich and rugulach habit is getting ridiculous. The BF and I have come back several times in such a short span. 

The first few times we got breakfast and I highly recommend for eggs benedict fans to get it here. I love hollandaise and they are not skimpy with it, ham actually has flavor, perfect poach eggs. I tried the crab cake version too, and surprised I liked the original better. The corned beef hash was another we tried and I thought it was tasty. I love their potatoes the brekkies come with and the bagels of their name sake actually are quite nice. 

Then I decided to try their corned beef sandwich and was prepared to be only mildly satisfied. I have a little Jewish corner of my heart that beats for childhood Saturdays at Langer's. The corned beef was flavorful, juicy and the marbled bread I chose was great. I always eat mine with  coleslaw and Russian dressing (aka thousand island). I'm normally into pickles, but theirs is closer to cucumber than pickle so I'm not the most fond of it. The sandwich was so good, I was a bit sad to  share with the BF and take the other half of the benedict even though I love the bennie. 

So we came back several more times to get our own. I have to say that the way to go is the soup and half sandwich deal ($10.95- $11.95). It actually comes out cheaper with more food since the sandwich was just as big as a 1/4th lb, you get soup and can even get a side if you wish for $1. The matzo ball soup here is decent, and the sweet and sour stuffed cabbage was nice though I dropped my phone in it trying to Yelp it. We also tried the lobster salad sandwich and that was solid, but I'm gonna stay with the meat sandwiches..... I should mention I lean towards mostly eating vegetarian and this place is testing it. 

Service is pretty decent on checking up. We also don't go during busy times as this is the type of place that gets swamped during regular breakfast/lunch hours on weekends. Beat the busy by heading in a bit later in the afternoon. 

While the sandwich and benedict have been stellar, the dessert counter has been extreme highs and lows so much so that I can't justify a 5star. 

The best: The rugulach are awesomely good. I normally don't like chocolate ones but I love them here, the almond ones are great, all the fruit ones are great. There is not a bad one so even though it is priced per pound, I feel this is worth it. 
The subpar: I'm not fond of the black and white cookie being more like cake. I know a lot of delis do this and I'm just more of a shadortbred person.  The rainbow cookies were okay, but not quite up to my standard with it being too wet though the sponge flavor was right on (those are one of my favorite deli sweets). The homemade twinkie was a bit dry.
 The bad: we got a slice of buttercream cake which was painfully sweet with the frosting tasting like boxed. It was thick, sticky and you can feel sugar granules in it with the cake itself also rather sweet. It was a throwaway so I will not be getting anything else but rugulachs. The desserts aren't cheap for what they are...Spent $27 with only the rugulachs being the only thing we are gonna eat the entirety of. 

This is great place and I do highly recommend this as a go-to if you're in the area, just know how to navigate the deli and massive menu through recommendations.

This is absolutely my favorite breakfast joint :D they have so much breakfast choices and all of them are delicious. They make their bagels and breads fresh because it's a bakery :P and they have a wide variety or desserts as well. I could be a happy fat kid if I lived near this place :)

The sole singular reason I come to this restaurant is they have the BEST cream cheese I have ever had. They use fresh ad ins which really ups the game on that. Their fruit yogurt parfait is also super amazing. The rest is pretty standard breakfast fare, but seriously don't miss out on the bagels and cream cheese. You are seriously missing out of you do.

Best bagels in town! My boyfriend and I love how fresh the bagels are made to order. We always come here for breakfast and this place has been consistent with great customer service and delicious food. We also love their dessert and baked goods. We never had a bad experience. One thing we definitely have to do is try their lunch menu because everything looks good. It's def our go to spot for great breakfast and baked goods when we're in this side of town.

If I could, I would give it six stars. The breakfast is fabulous and the service is great. I love lunch there too. I always leave with a dozed deserts and love to bring Iyummy filled with goodies for my staff and church. The service is AWESOME
I brought their homemade twinkles to go. The menu covers just about every craving you may have.  It's impossible to eat healthy here so don't even try.

This place is great in that it has an amazing in house bakery. All kinds of baguettes, bagels, rolls, cakes, croissants, you name it. The ambiance is great, almost feels like your in Brooklyn. A kosher menu to boot. 

Our server was great. The food was good and there is a dedicated coffee person who's sole job is to make sure you get your 3.00 worth of coffee. I ordered a jalapeno bagel with 2 eggs and bacon. 7 bucks and it was great. 

I encourage anyone to check it out. Be prepared to wait as its extremely popular. In my opinion, its the best breakfast place in Summerlin. Also a full lunch and dinner menu which i have not yet tried.
This is one of the most iconic breakfast places in all of Las Vegas, if your from out of town visiting drive your button to Summerlin and find your self in new York style deli & dinner!

Great menu, quality and selection, but I just never see how anyone can charge $15 for a pound of any type of meat.  It doesn't cost $15 for the whole damm corn beef.  Their keiser rolls were just over $1 for EACH. Yes they were big but still that is pricey.  

I think this is a great place but just pricey is all.

This is a review I wish I would have been able to write about a year ago when Mario S first told me about the Bagel Cafe. I never made the drive (which is not as far as I tell myself it is) and now that I have finally tried it, I feel like I have wasted the past year of my life. 

A good NY bagel had been pretty much impossible to find until I walked in the doors to this place. Now I wish I lived closer... preferably in the kitchen of this place. ***Will work for bagels and rainbow cookies***

Tasty NY Bagels... check
Rainbow cookies... check
Black and white cookies... check
Linzer Cookies... check

The rainbow cookies are where it's at. I never thought I would find rainbow cookies as good as the ones my mom makes but these are right up on that same level. If my mom had charged as much as they do for hers... I wouldn't be living in an apartment right now. Although, I would owe her a LOT of money.

Anyway... they need to open more locations. If anyone from Bagel Cafe reads this... please, please, please open more locations! I'll help with construction. Just feed me!!!!

I'm biased but this is my favorite breakfast spot in town. Always busy and for a good reason. Besides the fresh squeezed orange juice and delicious hot food/sandwiches the pastry counter is just pure decadence. My dad is gluten free and they have the best snacks that I can find for him. The only problem is finding a place to park. Enjoy.

It's always crowded here with old people. Icky.
The waiters and waitresses tend to be grumpy a lot. I would be too if I had to work around all those old people.

Prices go up and bagels get smaller, used to go with wife for a lunch now and then but to poor service and fear of prices still going up we stopped.
And with the high prices they even have the nerve to have a tip jar near register making awkward for  people just getting some take out.

I am sooo thankful to have found this place. I've been craving a reuben sandwich and here was the best sandwich I ever had!! They also have sooo much more stuff I have to still try.
 I will definitely be coming back without a doubt!!

Thanks to "Chip off the block deli" I had the worst experience. their reuben sandwich was salty n nasty it gave me a stomach ache all night n they really have the worst customer service especially the owner. I was on a mission to find the best places to eat at n I didn't have to look too far.

When walking in I found the deli counter and ordered their Rueben sandwich that came with French fries and potato salad and everything was absolutely delicious and the corned beef and pastrami were very tender.  I also ordered their French dip and it was good but, the roast beef was a bit dry for my liking, the last thing was a piece of their strawberry shortcake and it was ahhhmazing and so fresh!! I can't wait to come back to try other items on their menu

Ask any New Yorker what they miss most about back home and every single time you get the same three food related responses. The pizza, the Chinese food, and the Bagels. While the former two are admittedly debatable there is clearly one great Bagel place in this town. The Bagel Cafe is just like back home. It's even worth a drive if you aren't very close by. I've tried Brooklyn bagel deli, big apple bagel, and a bunch of other "New York bagel" joints and nothing comes close. They are either too hard even when "freshly made" or just not right. I'm sure a lot has to do with climate here, I make pizzas here and understand that it's tricky. But this place gets it just right. You can order a dozen which actually gets you 14 and a pound of cream cheese for like 16 bucks if I remember correctly. The cream cheese is great here too. I get the regular but they have all sorts. They also have awesome desserts here as well. I'm a sucker for good rainbow/venetian cookies and cannolis! Mmm. They also have tons of other stuff I haven't had there yet, I go for the bagels. 
They have a large dine-in area also. And it's often busy here, though never really bad enough to have a wait. I can't recommend this place enough! That said I'm not huge on dining in here. But I never really dine in at Bagel shops. Not even back home except for when I was still in high school and one was right next door. So take that for what it's worth, I get mixed experiences the few times I've dined here for breakfast and lunch.

Awesome breakfast and wonderful customer service!  
Wonderful selection of bagels and other bakery items.  DKAkins has competition!!
Service was slow and the food was just ok. I think I was expecting more of an eat coast diner feel. It was edible but I wouldn't go back. Life's a bagel has way better sandwiches and bagels.

It's no secret that I love sweets.  I was kind of excited to hear that Carlo's (of Cake Boss fame) opened up at the Venetian but with all the bashing they've been getting on their reviews it went lower and lower on my to-do list. Oh well. If they're still there the next go around then it can't be that bad right?

Anyhow I always wanted to try a chocolate babka. Blame it on Seinfeld. That episode left an indelible mark on me because I still think about it to this day. Let's face it, a babka is as foreign to me as a spam musubi would be to a New Yorker. And Bagel Cafe fits my needs perfectly because I'm not planning to go to New York anytime soon.

So my visit to Bagel Cafe is strictly for their bakery/deli side. Those bagels looked pretty darn good. But I was on a mission to get my chocolate babka and thank goodness they still had some. I think I got the second to the last one. I also got a rainbow cookie and chocolate rugulah both sold by the pound. 

Chocolate Babka - A loaf of coffee cake filled with chocolate. That loaf must have weighed 3 pounds. I swear. It was heavy. I hand carried this back to Honolulu. I thought it would taste like Hawaiian sweet bread. But nope.  It's a very dense bread that has a wisp of sweetness to it. I gave some away to share and had a nice french toast breakfast with the leftovers.

Rainbow Cookie - So pretty. Layers of almond extract soaked sponge cake layered between chocolate ganache. So, so good. Moist and very sweet. Wish I bought two or three. 

Chocolate Rugulah - This chocoholic had to get it. It was delicious. Not overly sweet. Wish I bought two or three.

I can finally lay my babka fascination to rest. I would love to go back again. Maybe try their restaurant side which looks kinda casual and quaint. 

TIP: When looking for this place, they are facing N. Buffalo so it's pretty hard to miss. You will see their big signage on their building that kind of look like townhouses.

Haven't had a 5 star breakfast in a while!

What's so different then?  FLAVOR!

I am a sucker for a great omelet...I glanced in that area on the menu and noticed something odd...PASTRAMI as a meat choice!  Let's give it a try :)

Pastrami Meat Omelet ($9.95). I wasn't sure how this combination was going to work out, but I am SO glad it did! Very flavorful pastrami, and everything here was perfect! Love their "home fries" aka breakfast potatoes and it comes with a bagel as well!  One of the BEST omelets I've had to date.

All the omelets come with a choice of side...including a Bagel.  I gave the Jalapeno and Cheddar bagel with Jalapeno Cream Cheese a whirl. So good!  A lot of the flavor was in the cream cheese...love how they pair em up!

I also grabbed some goodies from the bakery side....give the ITALIAN COOKIES a shot if you want a super rich, thick chocolaty cake like dessert.  Not sure why it's called cookies, but I am not complaining on taste!

Pics :
I've been here twice now and both times I had to leave my table to ask a waiter to take my order. Bagels are great. But food isn't as good as it could be if you the service isn't up to par.

Not much to say except fabulous. Great great great food. Baked goods are amazing and the kosher deli is fantastic. Always a great crowd and the service is always top notch. I recommend the brisket sandwich on marble rye.....amazing!

Confused about all the fuss.  Parking is horrible and limited. The restaurant is plain and very loud.  The food and baked goods are OK. Not so great that I would go there again.  The corned beef sandwich I had was also OK.  It was busy the afternoon I ate there.  People were coming and going like crazy. There was nothing extraordinary to bring me back to The Bagel Cafe.

What a cute little place! We stumbled upon here while looking for a place to grab brunch and I'm so glad we did. 

When you walk in, there is a fresh bagel section, along with cheese, pastries, and desserts!

= FOOD =
All of our meals came with a bagel that was freshly made! 

+ Corned Beef Hash: I've never had corned beef hash before, but this was really good and filling. But, I didn't eat my third egg because it looked weird and had an "off" color. (4/5)

+ Nova Benny: My sister said this was salty but I really liked it. I highly recommend this and would get it over the Corned Beef Hash! (4.5/5) 

+ Egg Whites with Canadian Bacon: Not my dish (obviously too healthy). 

= SERVICE =

Service was just OK. I'll cut them some slack though because it was super busy but my sister had to ask for something 3x (coffee with whipped cream) but they forgot it so we just gave up. I actually even asked for dessert (strawberry shortcake) but they forgot that too... which was fine because it would have been too much to handle at that point.

My wife and I went into the Bagel Cafe on Wednesday June 7. The food was OUTSTANDING and the service provided by Katie Ann was superb. We ordered from the daily specials board and selected eggplant parmesan (only $13.99). This meal came with soup or salad, the entree, a beverage and dessert. To say that the portions were huge would be a gross understatement. I had a very difficult time finishing my meal. You can feed two people with all of the food you get with the meal. We live in the neighborhood of the Bagel Cafe and had been lax in going into there to dine. That will not be the case anymore. The Bagel Cafe is now our "Go To" place when we want to dine well for a VERY reasonable price. I HIGHLY recommend this place to everyone.
The most darling little restaurant. It was packed when we went and I can see why! The pastries are all made in-house.. the coffee was so yummy. Great service and a happy crowd.

I usually just pick up sandwiches from the takeout counter. On my last visit I dined in... What a mistake! The service was disorganized and sloppy. They definitely lost me on this visit. No one to greet us, no one to seat us, I had to ask someone to seat us... It was far too busy for us to find a table. The servers then didn't visit our table for about 15 minutes. The busboy didn't know anything about the menu... And when the server arrived, he was rushed and didnt ask if we had questions. The server then told me they wouldn't add pepper to my meal in the kitchen, and to just use the one provided on the table. 15.00 for. Plate, and they won't prepare it with pepper? Then he didn't bother to up sell the baked goods or dessert, just gave us our bill... We weren't frugal either... Our bill was over $100 for 4 of us...

I really wanted to like this place. 
Unfortunately the costumer service
Was so extremely! Horrible we will never! 
Return. I visited this place with my parents 
Who are from Ca visiting and wanted them to 
Have a good experience. I also had my 2 children 
With me. We was excited because everything on 
The menu seemed really good. We ordered a lot! 
Of food. We hadn't eaten that day, saving our appetite for this place. My daughter had a corn beef sandwich and it was just Ok. Nothing great. 
My parents each had a full sandwich, I can't recall what type. They each had a hotdog as well. We also had bagel chips and each of us had a knish. And I had a grilled pastrami and corn beef combo sandwich And we also had a few desserts.. everything was was just mediocre. Some things were not good at all. Especially the fries, yuk! The biggest issue, however was not the food. Even though it wasn't very good, we still ate it and didn't complain. But my 6 year old son ordered the kids meal chicken strips, which was like $4.99 or something and the chicken was hard as a rock! There was no way he could have eaten it. Now, mind you at one point our waitress was missing, she never came back to check on us after the food came out. And everything came out one meal at a time, which was very annoying. Especially when there's five starving people. She was very! Slow and took forever. But still no one said anything. She finally came back and asked how everything was, I told her politely that everything was fine except for my son's chicken strips were not edible, especially since he has difficulties swallowing. She took them away in a very rude way and said she will tell the manager. The manager, I wish I knew his name! Was probably one of the worst! Managers I ever seen in customer service. He approached me in a very rude way and the first thing that came out of his mouth was, your son didn't even try a bite! How can I take them off your bill! I explained to him that he did try, but was scared to eat anymore because he has difficulties swallowing hard food, and then the jerk said, that's YOUR PROBLEM! as a mother you should have known not to order him chicken strips. I was in Shock and disbelief. I told him my son was totally fine eating chicken strips, but those were like trying to eat a rock! It seemed very clear to me that I was getting nowhere with this rude cranky manager. My parents were also in disbelief because of his ugly attitude. He didn't take it off the bill and we just paid and left. Over all, this place was a nightmare. We paid a lot of money for the mediocre food we just wanted to be treated with kindness and consideration like anyone else, but no the jerk MOM shamed me over a $4.99 kids meal.  I hope every day he has to endure extremely negative customers just as bad as he is.

Matzo ball soup! I know the name says bagels, but I when I think of this establishment, I think about this soupy treat. When the craving for it hits, a trip to The Bagel Cafe is a strong call.

On my last trip I had a cup of soup with a garden salad, and of course, it comes with a bagel. Service was sweet, but a little haphazard. I requested an everything bagel, but they were out, so I went with garlic (pretty much the smellier the better for me). Fast forward and a sesame bagel arrives on the table. Apparently, they were also out of garlic, but not really. To make a long story short, I eventually ended up with a garlic bagel, but I was a bit baffled by how someone could think that sesame was an acceptable replacement for garlic. The other troubling thing about bagels here is that they are incapable of toasting a bagel with accessories (such as garlic bits or onions) without burning the little bits. They claim it is impossible, but I don't believe them, and there is nothing quite as unappetizing as burnt garlic. But, I digress.

I am a fan of the matzo ball soup. It has huge chunks of tender chicken, carrots, a delicious ball and a nice balance of seasonings without being overly salty. The cup of soup with a bagel would be enough for a smart-sized lunch. Next time, I would probably skip the salad and avoid getting my bagel toasted. The salad was pretty fresh and tasty, but kind of a hassle to eat and heavy on the black olives. Plus, who needs salad when you've got the matzo?

I went here on Sunday around noon with a group of 6. We waited 20 minutes to be seated, but that is not bad at all considering this is probably the best New York bakery in Las Vegas. 

The wait also went by quickly because they have tons of baked goods to nosh on. I grabbed a perfect black and white cookie. 

For breakfast, I ordered 3 eggs, bacon and a super egg bagel with nova schmear. The bagel and bacon were great, but I was a little disappointed by the eggs. 

One thing I missed out on were the coffee shakes. Next time I come, I'll try one of these. 

Considering how busy they were the service was good too. 

See you next Sunday.

We started going to the bagel cafe in 96 when they opened.  When we werr living in Vegas this became my favorite breakfast place.  I think while pregnant I ate here once a week. Sadly, 14 years ago we moved to Cali and we haven't been back to the bagel Cafe since. On our trip back to Vegas this week we made the drive from the strip so I could eat here again and see if it lived up to my fond memories.  It smelled the same upon entering had the same great, friendly service and as always it was busy but they never rush you. This is the best deli I have been to (sorry NY spots).  This visit I had a meat combo sandwich of corned beef and pastrami on rye.  Just as I remember it!  Perfection!  Yum house made pickle on the side and cole slaw that is somehow not too sweet, has great flavor and not dry like every other deli out there.  My family members each had breakfast items which made me remember how insane I was for their bagels!  We ended up at the deli counter on our way out for bagels and cream cheese to go so I could bring them back to Cali with me.  They were kind enough to give me a bag of ice to keep the cream cheese cold on our drive back.  Can you tell how much I love Bagel Cafe?  Yum!!!

Been here many times always delicious. But PRICEY
Pumpernickel bagels and Bialys  are awesome, but they go fast 
Their new cream cheese with cucumber and cilantro is awesome. 
Parking can be a challenge on weekends and breakfast weekdays. Park far and walk rather look for a close spot.

Awesome experience!  I have been to this place twice and both times it has exceeded my expectations.  The food and service are top notch.  I had the lox platter which was splendid.  I highly recommend!
