Great deli just off Summerlin freeway at Buffalo.  Been coming here for years and decided it's time to give them the props they deserve. I'd probably give this NY style deli 4.5 starts but since I can't they don't necessarily deserve a full 5 star rating.

Let's go with the good then I'll drop my tiny bomb on the bad.  The food is high quality and always fresh.  They have amazing breakfast that nearly all come with a bagel and one of their amazing cream cheeses.  Love the scallion cream cheese.  Lunch is crazy good and HUGE!  They offer gigantic salads all with fresh produce, meats and cheeses.  The also offer great dinner specials.  

Today we had a tuna melt that was made with great tasting tuna salad and fries.  We also had a cabbage roll that was served with a cup of soup and of course a bagel with cream cheese.  Loved it all!

Parking isn't an issue as there is plenty of it.  The place is always packed but there is never a long wait so don't fret!  The biggest negative is the staff and their "I don't give a shit if you're the customer" mentality.  They kids act like their stuff doesn't stink (imo).  Anyway great food and will be back as I can get over the negative...

I have no idea why I gave this place a 4 star rating originally. There is nothing wrong with this place other than it is so damn good that the line is long. The sandwhiches are piled high, the portions are huge, and the prices are appropiate. Get the salmon schmear for a buck more, it's worth it.
Great service. I had a reauben omelet for the first time. It was great!  Looking forward to the next time.

Fabulous deli, bakery, and restaurant.   A little unorganized to get seated but worth it because the good is wonderful.   Love their whitefish salad YUM  they make a good bagel and Bialey sugar free cheesecake amazing.  Please go.
This place has big portions and the food is usually good. The Manager is very very rude. I will never go back

I love their pastrami here. Matzo ball soap is always good although its always lacking of broth. They will give you extra but for a full price of soup, definitely not a good business practice. 

Pastries are not good, just sweet, with the exception of almond rugalahs. 

2 stars because of customer service. We come here a lot, and you want to charge me full price for an extra broth??

The Bagel Cafe is a great place to grab New York style bagels cream cheese, a variety of desserts, and Deli Style Food without having to go into the restaurant. I highly suggest that you stick with the deli and desert side of the restaurant because the food to me lacks luster and doesn't prompt a return. However the bagels are Simply Delicious and reminds me of good old New York which prompts me to return.

Items Selected:
Coffee
Vanilla Crumb Cake
Blackberry Muffin
Cinnamon Roll
Black & White Cookie
Buttermilk Pancakes
Malted Waffle with Strawberries and Jam
Challah French Toast
Cheese Blintzes with Sourcream and Jam
Corned Beef Hash with Overeasy Eggs and Everything Bagel

Only visited once in the past, but a place to which several others have been referred when craving a good local deli, it was in reminiscing of Langer's a week prior that breakfast was enjoyed at The Bagel Cafe, certainly not the landmark sort of place found in Los Angeles but a very good meal at a fair price just the same.

Laid out with a grab n' go area, bakery, and deli near the door as a spacious but tightly packed dining room fills the rear it was just after 8am on a Friday that our party of five entered and with family getting seated while I perused the pastry case it was mere moments before the menu was navigated; orders placed and rather weak coffee poured.

Perhaps the youngest people in the place, my 60+ year old mother included, it was not long before pastry selections arrived tableside, the daily muffin and huge slice of crumb cake each buttery soft  while a warm cinnamon roll was unfortunately a bit overbaked, the black and white cookie fluffy and thick although frosting tasted a bit artificial.

Moving onward to mains, the kitchen expediting orders at breakneck pace with  the dining room 2/3 full, it was with faux-Maple syrup cast aside in favor of the real stuff from home that French Toast, Pancakes and Waffles were gilded, the last a flavorless disaster when compared to the textbook alternatives; the the hash simply not my style and the blitzes failing to live up to the high standards set by Langer's and innumerable others.    

Slipping a bit since my first visit, perhaps an effect of such a large crowd or perhaps a result of me overrating the place based on excellent ordering the first time around, The Bagel Cafe remains a competent spot for those craving Deli foods or what is still, in my view, the best bagel in Sin City.

I'm a huge supporter of family owned and operated restaurants like the Bagel Cafe. My dad always says, "If you see a lot of senior citizens at a restaurant, then you can't go wrong." They are on a fixed income, so they want delicious food and large portions at a reasonable price. Although I am not yet age privileged,  I want those same things too. With that being said, I hit the jackpot because at the Bagel Cafe, there was a sea of silver hair.

It is your typical Jewish deli with an amazing bakery in the front. I have probably tried all of their pastries a few times over. Today, I grabbed a booth and enjoyed brunch with my family.

Their servers work very hard and they are top notch! One of my biggest pet peeves is when a server is either too anxious or too slow with the check. My server's timing was just right.

We ordered the Challah french toast, veggie omelet, with home fries, and a bagel and a Belgium waffle. Everyone in our party was satisfied. Next time, I'm going to try the matza ball soup.

First off, I have been eating here since 1996. It is a East Coast style deli, bakery and cafe. They have one of the largest menus with no disappointments in site, except if they are out of what you wanted. They have traditional Jewish dishes and definitely the best bagel in Las Vegas.
Great portions, great food, great staff - Karie is an awesome server with good humor and very competent.

First, the ambience gets a big fat ZERO for noise, cramped and dirty.  To begin, it is a huge menu so we needed a bit of time to study it, so we ordered coffees.  I have no idea what the muddy water in the cup was and no amount of cream or sugar could help, YUK!  Oh well, I'm a coffee snob I guess.  My husband ordered a tuna melt on marble rye and he ate most of it.  That said, he didn't touch his fries....I thought maybe he was having a stroke!  Greasy!!  I had the tasteless shrimp salad and had them put it in a wrap.  Someone clearly doesn't realize it's the folding of the wrap that holds the contents in and cut the bottom off, so I removed the wrap to eat it after it fell out all over my plate.  No flavor, none.  I'm also a pickle lover and wouldn't call this a pickle.  I grew up on homemade pickles.  How can you ruin a pickle??  Hubby agreed.  The small side of cole slaw was edible.  That's $40 I'm not getting back, but lesson learned.  To be fair, I asked a few patrons who were leaving if this was a regular spot for them.  To my surprise, they all said they come for the soup only!  I think my last point of distaste was the servers wiping loads of crumbs onto the chairs from the previous patrons.  Yeah, no, I don't want to sit on or step on filth and napkins under my feet.

We go here regularly. My favorite is a plain bagel toasted with plain cream cheese but I've tried almost everything and have never been let down.
Friendly service, great food.

As with most 2-star restaurants, I don't have too much to say. 

The bagels were "good". The corned beef hash was "good". Service was "ok". Pancakes "did the job". There was nothing truly remarkable about this place. 

EXCEPT... the waitress was noteworthy. She was consistently dropping parts of meals! I watched 2 pieces of bacon slide off the plate when she rounded a corner... and proceed to put it on our table! I even had to call her attention to it, and she needed to be reminded that we needed replacements! Later on she dropped someone's bagel basket completely. Now I know everyone has their days, but this lady was not in good form. 

Needless to say, I don't plan on going back. I'd much rather go to the Cracked Egg instead (see my review for it).

I like Italian cookies so, when East Coast peeps such as Mario S and John F kept checking in and posting pictures of goodies from this place, I had to make it my mission to go here.  It must be legit.

You seat yourself and read the menu that looks like a newspaper then the server takes your order. For anything to-go, you have to go to the deli/bakery line.

I had such a sugar rush when I ate half a pound of the rainbow cookies. Those treats with the colors of the Italian flag that tastes like almond with apricot jam in each layer and chocolate on top. They're so good I couldn't stop myself from eating them.  I easily spent $56 on rainbow cookies, raspberry rugulach, apple rugulach, black and white cookies, Florentine cookies, linzers, etc.  

Their eggs benedict was also yummy.  Great Hollandaise sauce (consistency and flavor).  It comes with potatoes.  I also tried their cheese blintzes with strawberries.  Each blintz was fully stuffed with sweet cream cheese filling.  I could only eat 1.

They also have sandwiches, matzoh ball soup, salmon, white fish, etc. on their menu. Bagels and schmear, meats, monster-sized cupcakes, 7-layer cake, carrot cake, etc in the bakery/deli. 

I wish I would have known about this place a long time ago so I could have fed the doctors at work more variety of Kosher treats.  But at the same time, I'm glad I didn't know about this place a long time ago, otherwise, I would be 200lbs heavier by now!

I have such mixed feelings about the Bagel Cafe. I love-like-hate it, all at the same time. So, I will break it down as to why I feel the way I do.

LOVE:
Homemade food.
Fresh baked breads.
House-made Pickles (seriously, they're perfect)
Friendly service

Like:
Their soups are off the chain (I know it's 100 degrees in Vegas, but soup me!)
Corny newspaper menus
Selection of fresh baked pastries and cakes
Over-stuffed sandwiches.

Hate:
WARNING: Don't share your sandwiches (what, the what?! I do what I want with my sammie).
Pricing - $7.50 for a cup of soup.
Chaotic when entering. There's no "seat yourself" sign or anyone really greeting you.
How basic and homey the place feels.
Bland, uninspired food.

Bagel Cafe is hidden in a Business Park and they're always busy (especially on the weekends - up to an hour wait). IT's got a huge area in the front where you can get deli meats, cheese, chips, sammies, soups, cookies, bagels, and every other sweet confection known to man to-go. There are about 30 tables/booths. There's not a lot of ambiance and all employees where Bagel Cafe polo shirts so they're easy to spot. Bagel Cafe is very hit-or-miss in regards to what you order. My Matzo Ball soup was excellent and full of chicken chunks (and a few small bones), carrots, celery, and noodles. It's tasty, but nothing that makes it memorable. The tuna salad was bland. I hardly ever reach for salt and pepper and I had to! The Nova Platter small was a small amount of lox, olives, sliced tomato, sliced cucumber, and a pickle that was halved, it was $11.95, way too much for mainly salad bar options. I also can't get over the fact that they sell 1/4 & 1/2 lb sandwich options and state DO NOT SHARE. I get that if you are at an AYCE sushi place or dining at a 5 star restaurant, but at a Breakfast/Brunch spot? I do what I want with my sandwich and sharing is caring!

At the end of the day, the BAD outweights the good here. Overpriced, restrictions, dull food, and lack of organization makes this place a "meh" in my book.

Best bagels in town. Their lox is amazing. Cream cheese is great. Regular or strawberry. I usually go with super-egg bagel. So good. They also have great corned beef and pastrami. And their desserts. I can't even go over there because everything is too good. I'd gain like 5 pounds a day if I ate every dessert that looked good there.

Went there this morning for breakfast. Both the Lox and bagel were delicious but they were very chinsey on lox. Had to order a side of lox where we were given a slice and a quarter for $7. Silly no point!  Should give enough to cover two pieces of a bagel no one makes a sammy. 
Thanks

This is an update to  a previous review I did in 2014.  I wanted to give Bagel Cafe one more try, and probably this will be my last try.  I ordered a corned beef sandwich - no sides, no other items.  Total bill:  $14.00 (the sandwich was $12.95 plus tax).  Yes, the sandwich is large and can  be split between two people, but really?   $14.00 for a sandwich? (and a pickle that comes with it).  I will say, this time the pickle was better than last time, it tasted like a real kosher pickle instead of a raw cucumber.  However, the corned beef had tough, chewy portions that were difficult to swallow, and as last time, it was on the dry side, so I'm still very unimpressed with the quality of their corned beef and won't be doing that again. Also, I didn't see  prices posted anywhere. If there's a price list, I couldn't find it.  So, I suffered from "sticker shock" when I paid the bill.  

They must have raised their prices because last time my total was around $16.00 for a sandwich, cole slaw and a bear claw.  I thought this time it would be  less by at least several dollars, since I was only getting a sandwich and nothing else, but obviously not.    I'm reaching the point of simply giving up on 90% of the places in town except fast food because everything is so outrageously expensive in ways that really can't be justified.  If you're okay with paying $14.00 for a corned beef sandwich which  isn't that great, go ahead.  I'm not. .

A very affordable and delicious option for any meal! Every time I have eaten at Begel Cafe has been a wonderful dining experience. My friends and I make trips here pretty regularly and although we usually have a party of 4 or more, they always seat us quickly. 

I have only eaten here for breakfast and lunch but I have never been disappointed. The food is very good and I always go home feeling satisfied. I have had many things on the menu and I have yet to have something I didn't like. I never seem to have room for dessert, however they have a large selection. Just perusing the pasties on the shelves up front is enough to make your mouth water.

The food is great. The service is horrible and poorly managed. 
I'll pass on going back

For a NY'er like myself, this place is right on the money!  Terrific deli/bagel place/bakery that has all the NY favorites I've been missing (bagels, black and white cookies, rainbow cookies, rugulah, homemade blintzes and potato pancakes, etc.).  I'd give this place 5 stars but the line to pay was a TOTAL cluster and some regulars told me that it's always that way.  Still, I'd go out of my way from Henderson to Summerlin for breakfast or lunch here!

Worst food ever. After taste remains of vomit. Waitress was nice but manager was rude. Hair in my food and all we got were excuses. The desserts look pretty but taste old and nasty. $4.50 for a glass of oj expensive vomit all around.

AMAZING!!! this place is awesome. Food taste great, servers, bussers and host are fast. You can tell they are doing the best they can to accommodate such a large crowd. this place is busy so if you do not like waiting, I suggest come early or order to-go.
Compliments to the cooks in the back too!!! Cooks at hotels outta' learn from you guys. Lol.
Great job everyone!
I love the menu and the bakery is mouth watering. Everything is fair priced and large portions. My server Karla J is friendly and prompt. Good job girl!
It's a little loud and crowded so I think they should expand. 
I wish there are more businesses like this in vegas.

Love love love this place! Food is spot on every time. It is always busy for a reason. It is a Jewish paradise! I have eaten here numerous times and have also done takeout for passover. The takeout is just as good as dining in. They also do special catering for the Jewish holidays. YUM!

When ever I am in Vegas I always try to make it to The Bagel Cafe with my dad.  Their matzo ball soup is on point as are their bagels.  I recently placed an order of a dozen large black & white cookies which they packed nice for me and are always delicious!
Tried the Biscuits and gravy. Sorry I left my vonfort zone of Eggs Benedict. Very plain, very little sausage. Live and learn.

The service was very good. But for $40 I felt the amount of food served was pretty skimpy. I mean, really? I should have taken a picture of the fish.The bagels and cream cheese were great but the smoked salmon was not only skimpy but very disappointing flavor wise. Maybe east coast lox is different than I am used to. Not my Grandma's lox for sure. My friend loved her corned beef, though. The potato salad that came with it was good too. There is a full Jewish deli here. Looks delish! Very expensive but lots of choices.

The Bagel Cafe is the best breakfast-lunch place in all of Southern Nevada!

They have outstanding breakfast special, amazing sandwiches and every kind of Bagel under the sun!  When you visit Las Vegas make sure you visit the Bagel Cafe in summerlin!

First time for breakfast and I have to say it's refreshing to go to a local bagel café. They have half sour pickles that were so good, surprised because pickles are not one of my favorite foods but have to admit that tasted yummy. Breakfast was delicious and they serve before your food comes some delicious crunchy bagels and homemade style cream cheese.denitely delicious.

This breakfast spot rocks my morning, well weekend morning that is.  Them bagels be seriously bangin and the cream cheese flavors are hand crafted.  Cream cheese flavors include nova lox, garlic cheddar, olive pimento, veggie, scallion, plus many more that I look forward to trying now that I've locked in on this gem. Every single bagel they offer is super D-lish.  If I had to recommend my favorite bagel/cream cheese combo it would have to be the one and only (that makes me a little weak in the knees to think of it) garlic bagel piled high with some of their nova lox cream cheese.

Most of their breakfast dishes come with potatoes and choice of toast or one those yummilicious bagels.  Self seating.  The service is great; our drinks never reach half full.  Everyone including the table bussers keep a close watch on your drink and make sure to keep it frequently replenished.  We've yet to try any of the lunch dishes here, but today the table beside us ordered some of their overstuffed sandwiches, and they are ridiculously overstuffed.

Weekend word to the wise - wake up early or wait a little bit.  Last weekend we attempted to venture in around 10:30 on a Sunday and there were people lined out the door waiting for a table.

Best bagels in Vegas! Jalepeno or asiago bagel with jalepeno cheese cream cheese & cinnamon raisin or blueberry bagel with strawberry cream cheese. Mmmm! The first time I came here, I was confused with how ordering worked. The employees behind the counter are sometimes pushy/rude, & food is 'okay'...but regardless, still the best bagels!

Whether you choose breakfast or lunch, you cannot go wrong with this place. The food that I had here is outstanding. Breakfast is absolutely delicious. Your coffee is fantastic and they have many options and varieties depending on what you want. For lunch, despite many awesome options, their matzoh ball soup is amazing. Being someone who lived in New York City for many years, my favorite place from matzoh ball soup is second Avenue deli. It was the best that I ever had at a restaurant. This does not stray far from that soup and that's a huge compliment.
The location is in a very nice area. The prices are more than reasonable. The service is very friendly.
In writing this review, I feel very confident because I have many friends and acquaintances who recommended this restaurant to me and I cannot agree more with them. Outstanding!

I absolutely love this restaurant. It is always packed and people speak out loud how they like the food and how  sweets here are to die for.  I enjoy hot matzo ball soup, to corn beef or chopped liver sandwich. Priced fairly, food is excellent, service is prompt with servers with big smile. Brings back memory of New York in Las Vegas. I highly recommend this restaurant.

What I liked: I like this place very much. The bagels were good and fresh. New York bagels? No. But good! The black and white cookies are pretty amazing! Everyone's food that was coming out looked so good. I want to return for breakfast. 

What I didn't like: When we walked in we waited for a long time to be seated, not because there weren't any seats, but because no one was standing there to seat us. We didn't get a hello or anything from any employee. A few walked by and saw us standing there. Nothing. A guy eventually walks up and seats us. The second time I was there I took my order to go. They were SO BEYOND rude to this little old man standing at the bakery. They asked if I needed help I explained that he was before me and had been standing there a while. They told him he was standing at the wrong place, they mentioned this to him over 5 times as he was putting in his order. He kept apologizing saying normally his wife goes in and he didn't know. OKAY! We get it! Leave the poor man alone and take his order. This place is extremely unorganized as other yelpers have mentioned. I hope they get it together because they could possibly have one of the best places in town! 

I hope my third time is a charm! Will update.

This place is always good. Love the food. If breakfast is your thing, you'll find your favorites, plus you get a bagel as well. 

If you prefer lunch, they have great sandwiches, hot or cold. Beware, they are rather large! But no worries you can get half of one or the full thing, but no sharing aloud!

The sides are choice of coleslaw, macaroni salad, or fries, along with a pickle. The soups are chicken noodle, cabbage or soup of the day. And for the traditional kids menu, Hebrew National hot dogs! 

They have egg creme but to be honest, I haven't tried them. I hear they are good. 

If you want baked goods, they have a great selection. Large assortment of bagels and cream cheese, pastries, baklava, cannoli, and rugula. They even have a no sugar added cheese cake for when I'm watching my carbs but still want something sweet. 

Service is good, great attention to customer service. Only thing that is not so hot, parking, it's a busy place!
Its your typical NY Deli. Just as i remember when I was a kid. Its good and authentic if you like that kind of food.

Let me preface by stating the food was VERY good. The people that work there on the other hand, not so much. First off, our waitress talked so fast, we couldn't even answer before she was already making up our mind for us. We were supposed to have an option as our side (potatoes, fruit, or bread) and she never asked us what we wanted so I assumed that we didn't get a side with our meal. We did, she just assumed we wanted potatoes. Which I did not. We were served our meal without silverware. And after our meal, we went to the bakery and stood at the counter for minutes with staff walking past before anyone asked us if we had been helped. We noticed we were charged $3.25 for a potato pancake at our table, but they were at the bakery for $2.25. When I asked the cashier why we were charged more she gave me a snotty attitude and said it's cause they "warm it up." Seriously?! Starbucks warms your baked goods for free! When I told her it was silly she rolled her eyes and said "it's the labor charge." I'm thinking "OMG your ridiculous" but these words stayed in my head. I wanted to slap her. Then another staff member who overheard said "it's because it comes with bread." To which I replied "well, we didn't get bread."  The service was just downright ridiculous. I was so annoyed walking out of there. Seriously though, the food was great.

Food is always excellent here. Bagels taste just like you would get in New York maybe the buy water from there! .

Walking in you see the deli side of things which you can view the bagel and dessert case along with cold cuts and everything else to make pastrami or corned beef sammies!! 
These guys are great for catering too as they can produce a lot of product your up and coming Super Bowl party!

Ordered the Following:

lox and bagel (everything)
3 egg (sunny) with ham and a jalapeño bagel 

Everything came out piping hot and quick. This place never disappoints.
Make sure you call ahead to see if they're busy because this place tends to be because parking here is a nightmare.

The staff is very warm and friendly and take your order rather quickly. Check them out it's worth the drive if you live in Henderson or if you're visiting.. take the trip!!
A regular stop for breakfast. The place is clean, bright. Service is excellent and friendly staff. The food is excellent and huge portions. A great value
Great stuff! just like NYC since they get all the good stuff from there. Only complaint is that the coffee is lousy.
This place is soooo consistently good.  The chopped liver is the best.  Like to make my own combo sandwich.  Corned beef and Chopped liver.  Sounds different, but boy is it good.

If you live in Vegas and haven't eaten here, there's something wrong with you. Or maybe you've been living under a rock. Their challah french toast and everything bagels with nova lox will have you craving more. Don't forget to grab some sweets on the way out...their assorted rugelach and classic black & whites are my go-to's.

OMG every time I go in there and look at their desert case I gain 10 lbs just looking at it :) deserts are huge and priced right for what you get, fresh bagels.  Their Reuben sandwiches are so good best I've had since moving to Las Vegas

If you're going here I would suggest going for the bagels or takeout items only. We were seated for 4, it was very busy but our waitress was not as attentive as she should've been. 

One person ordered a Reuben and it was super lopsided, one half had all the fixings and the other had none making it difficult to eat. 

The salmon Benedict came with poached eggs which were over done and the middle underneath was torn open with salmon which was super salty and the English muffin was barely toasted and overall the dish was lukewarm. 

Another person in our party asked the waitress if there was an option to get just a plain bagel with cream cheese and lox (sliced salmon) no capers or tomatoes or anything else needed. She gave a complicated answer and ended up charging him for a platter (includes cucumber, après, tomato, onion, olives, salmon, bagel and cream cheese) $12 and brought it with only salmon bagel and cream cheese. You can't tell me there wasn't a cheaper and simpler option? 

The bagel, cream cheese and lox were great. The service was rushed, in attentive and not personable. So I would only go back for take out bagels or bakery items and wouldn't sit down to eat.

Wonderful happy place filled with smiling customers and cheerful staff. Cozy environment serving delicious bagel, excellent breakfast and lunch items. There is a very large menu with a full bakery onsite. Everything looks, tastes and smells great in this place. Very attentive pleasant service with perfectly cooked food. It never disappoints.  :)

DON'T GO HERE! CROSS CONTAMINATION! (they'll be shut down soon no doubt)
I blame yelp for leading me here. "Potato pancakes" (shoulda known) were delivered with NO APPLE SAUCE and NO SOUR CREAM and covered in the side of bacon someone else ordered! Ruined for a vegetarian (or anyone who gives a dang about food safety). The bacon was somehow burnt to a crisp (we specifically ordered it lightly cooked/ softly cooked) 
WHAT! 0 Stars avoid an all cost extremely fake inauthentic jewish food, (the latkes were massive and soggy)

Three dollars for 1/2 an old avocado. 

This trash place should be called The Burnt Bagel or The Bagel Ripoff.

I just found a piece of lox in my refrigerator. I bought here about six weeks ago right before getting ridiculously sick. Instead of grossing me out, the ancient piece of fish just made me want to go back to the Bagel Cafe to restock on fresh stuff.

It's about 35 minutes each way for me to get to Bagel Cafe, which seems like a long way to travel for bagels, but they are without question the best bagels I've had outside of NJ/NY. Having grown up there, I am very particular about bagels. You won't catch me dead in an Einstein. But these bagels are, in a word, fantastic.

They're oversized, big like real New York bagels should be. The crust of the bagel is browned just enough in the baking process, the crumb of the bagels remain chewy and moist.

Another feather in their cap: Bagel Cafe puts a TON of stuff on their bagels. Getting a dozen garlic always results in a massive pile of loose garlic in the bottom of the bag.

As much as I swoon over their bagels (I also really like the onion, asiago and jalapeno cheddar), there's much more here than that. I also like getting a little hand-sliced lox here - while I haven't had anything else from the deli, it all smells OH so good.

As for the dessert case ... I have to plead guilty here. The massive slabs of tiramisu, Napoleons, moist and fragrant macaroons, and ridiculously good (and ridiculously big) muffins, and best of all, rugelach - chocolate, raspberry, apple cinnamon and almond. Score.

A dozen bagels (which is actually 14) is just $10 here, which is sort of insanely cheap. Unfortunately, all the other non-bagel stuff here is so tempting that I wind up easily dropping $30 or more whenever I walk in the door.

But man, is it worth it.

This was my third visit to the Bagel Cafe. I am a New Yorker so my standards for a deli are pretty high. We arrived at 1 pm on a Friday and luckily only had a five minute wait to be seated. However we were not waited on for quite a while. The menu is extensive, so it is difficult to decide what to order. I settled on the corned beef hash and eggs special with an everything bagel. I am gluten sensitive so I mainly ordered the bagel for my husband to take home. He ordered a burger made with grass fed 
beef. 

We waited what seemed to be forever for our food. This surprised me because on other occasions we were served faster.  I forgot to take photos of the food because we were so hungry by the time they arrived. My order was well presented with a generous three eggs (I ordered over easy and they were cooked perfectly). The corned beef was cut up with onions and potatoes plus there was a small side of hash browns. They even added a skewer of fruit kabob. The bagel was toasted but not buttered and came with cream cheese with no butter on the side. If I was planning to eat it there I would have complained but it was fine for us. Bottom line, the food was good and the price was right ($10 special). 

My husband's burger came with fries and one side and he had coleslaw. He complained to me that the bun was falling apart but the burger was tasty. The fries stood out as some of the best here in Vegas. 

We were asked once if we needed anything but once we were done eating we were ignored and had to eventually request our check and take home box. The portions were so large we took home half the burger and my dish (and the bagel). 

Food wise, we will come back. Service wise, we will not go there if we have limited time. Bagel wise, certainly not the best but standards are lowered here in the desert.

Came for a breakfast business meeting today.   Everything was fresh.  Love that you get free bagel chips with the flavored cream cheese of the day.  Today was pecan sweet potato.     Service a bit slow.  Had to ask for coffee 3 times and cream twice.   Bathrooms not clean.  Floor in stall so wet with ?? that I had to roll up my pants to ensure that my cuffs didn't get dirty.

I wish Bagel Cafe was closer to where I live. It would be my go to spot for any of my meals for the day.

We walk in after an early morning in the snow.  What a perfect place to get warm and have a good meal.  The place was packed and we had to search for a table.  Which we found way in the back.  We were lucky as it seemed there were more people looking for tables as well.  Anyhow, we sit and looked at the menu.  She always knows what she wants so it was really just me looking at the menu.  She got the Matzaball soup and some sort of spinach pastry, the little one a halla bagel with cream cheese, and I got eggs and potatoes.  I'm a sucker for breakfast.  

The waitress was nice and took care of our needs.  Afterwards we looked at the bakery.  So much to choose from.  We brought home bagels, cookies, some sort of fruit filled pastry that was sweet and delicious, and an eclair.  So good... 

I have also had their chocolate cupcake in a different experience.  The eclair trumps it.

I don't have a whole lot to say about my recent trip this time... my dad decided to stop and get lunch to go and I ordered a Turkey on rye with mayo. I got a literal fist sized portion of Turkey in between 2 slices of rye with no mayo. The Turkey that bulky was super dry and I had to use a lot of mustard to help eat it. I honestly ended up removing half of the meat because no one can eat what they gave me practically... the slaw was average. I assume it's out of a bag. Aside from that this place still doesnt impress me. I'd never give my money to people who insult anyone with special needs but that's just me and I'm still pissed about hearing that conversation from last visit.

Didn't care for this place to much, do not order the pastrami sandwich it was pretty bad ..the cream cheese taste super weird and the pickles hade a weird taste to them also.. I rather eat Weiss deli in Henderson

The food is typically good, exactly what I would expect from a New York style deli, service on the hand; that's a whole other story and that's the basis for this review.  Over the years I've lived in town, which has been since 1995, I've eaten at this place numerous times. Occasionally service is pretty good but most of the time the service is way off.  Slow and poor. Today was no exception, the restaurant was fairly busy so we didn't mind waiting for a table, however it took an exorbitant long time to get our order taken once we were seated. The food came at a reasonable time but the order wasn't accurate. When we were ready to leave it took forever to finally get the check, we asked three people and sat for over 20 minutes trying to get somebody to get us a check; they wouldn't. We finally got up and waited in line to pay at the counter.  Once we got up to the counter to pay, which is something our waitress should have taken care of, the guy ringing just walked away!!  That leaves one person at the register and a whole extra line of people.   

I'm never going back regardless of whether I like the food or not.  The service is so poor for  what you pay there's just no reason to go there anymore. 

Plus: I find them to have a horrible attitude towards consumers. Notations on the menu like "one check per table, no splitting checks", "$2 charge for plate splitting"... Little rules and irritants. On the surface these dont sound like  big deals but when you couple it all with their poor service and their generally snotty attitude...well, screw 'em; I don't need 'em.
We have been coming here for years and years. It is without a doubt the best corned beef sandwich place in Vegas. Actually the BEST deli here. Matzo ball soup a must!!!!

This is heaven. on. Earth. (...and I'm NOT making a pun about the older clientèle.)

There's the deli, fresh baked goods, and obviously the restaurant itself (which is rather large).  I looked at the menu, and almost had a heart attack. The selection was so good that I was almost afraid to order anything. Everything looked DELICIOUS!  I was on a diet, so I grabbed some things from the deli (they were very, very good), and ran away.  I'm still waiting to grow the balls to go back.

The only downside is that the cashier(s?) are pretty worthless.  I watched 3-4 girls standing around behind the counter about 5 feet away from me, talking for a good 5 minutes without so much as a sideways glance.  I don't think I've ever had so much trouble getting an ice cube in my life.

OMG I would eat here everyday if I could.

I've been a few times now when visiting my parents, and everything on the menu has been outstanding.  The bagels are delicious and fresh.  I'd highly recommend the jalapeno cheddar bagel or everything bagel - yum.  I'm returning next week and am already thinking about what I want to get...

This place is awesome. Food, service, layout. Menu is running over. I mean from at least 30 different types of bagels to smoked fish. Omelets, pancakes, waffles and Benedicts. This is just the breakfast portion of the menu. My beautiful one had the veggie omelet with wheat toast also came with fresh fruit. Omelet came out packed with mushrooms, tomatoes, bell peppers onions.  I had a corned beef omelet with plenty of cheddar garlic bagel with garlic cream cheese. Look food is awesome one of the top 5 places to eat breakfast in Vegas.

Love this place. Reminds me of home and how good bagels are. Everything comes in  a huge portion and its always delicious. They have a great selection of break fast and lunch items to choose from so no issues here with variety. 

My favorite things here are the huge sandwiches and the home made desserts. Their fries are good too and I'm not even a fry person.  They have home made should everyday as well as gravy which I get sometimes.  Also the Challah French toast is thick and awesome if that's your thing. Make sure you get fruit on it because it doesn't cone with it. 

For their desserts you cannot miss the home made cheese cake our tiramisu. Seriously too die for. I come here maybe once a month but I'd come  more often if it was closer to where I am all the time. This place is a must try.
This place is reliably great! The servers are always friendly. The food is on the mark. Authentic and delicious.

Second time for breakfast and the food is still
Great.
The prices are good too because you get a bagel with every dish. Plus bagel chips as you wait for your food. Sooooo much food.
Service is very friendly.
Food comes out hot but coffee is not good. 
Lots of cream! Lol 
Don't be in a rush when you come because they are always busy. Enjoy the company and good food. 
Thank you

This restaurant is awesome especially to me because I am an ethnic Jew and grew up in delis like this one.  The bagels are to die for, the entrees are traditional, very well-done and very filling, and the matzo ball soup is amazing.  I also found out that the owners of this restaurant are involved in (probably own but I am not sure) the deli at South Point and Red Rock, both of which have ridiculously good bagels, soup, desserts, and everything in between.

If you are a fan of real boiled bagels with fresh cream cheese, big sandwiches with fresh pastrami and corned beef, and a huge selection of delicious desserts, you should absolutely check the Bagel Cafe out.  You will not be disappointed.

Omg, go here immediately and order the brisket.  Just get the whole order because it's the best thing you will ever eat.  Not kidding.  And there is something about the water because it's the best water in LV!  And the cheesecake?!?  Life changing!  After you eat head to the deli and get some bagels and cream cheese to go!

Or get their omelet (any and all of them!) and ask for a side of hollandaise sauce!  It's, oddly, one of my favorite keto friendly restaurants!

Yum. I don't know what a authentic NY bagel is..but this place does a fantastic breakfast with over a dozen different types of fresh bagels. All sorts of NY deli type dishes and a wall of bakery desserts.

It's was really good food. Slow service, huge portions 

Got to see the mayor's, so it must be good. This place is pricey

My husband and I discovered this place a few years back, and I have yet to review! Long overdue.

This is the BEST place in Las Vegas to get bagels.  (We are originally from New York, so we know good bagels.)  The bagels here are huge, and so soft on the inside.  The dough is delicious.  They also have a large variety of flavored cream cheeses. 

Their selection of bakery cookies and pastries is large, and they're delicious too! 

We have come here for breakfast and lunch, and every time it's delicious.  Here's what you should try:
Bagels
Matzohball soup
Chocolate ruggalah
Pickles
Any sandwich!

I wasn't a big fan of the egg slad, but it's because I like really wet egg salad and theirs is more traditionally dry. 

Service is always great.  It's a bit more pricey, but you're getting quality food that you can't find anywhere else.

If you want a nice breakfast out in Vegas, go here. Their bakery and deli counter is the best feature of this place; they have a huge selection of decadent desserts, meatz, cheezez, and of course, bagelz. It's easy and quick to get your order and get out when ordering at the counter. The last time we went there my gal and I got a raspberry (strawberry? can't remember exactly) danish and it was pretty damn good. I'm sure there are some desserts in there that are a bit dry but overall it's a win-win. I'd prefer to get a bag o' bagels over dining in and getting a bagel entrée.

Sunday morning breakfast is a nice atmosphere because it's quite bustling--however, it might be a while before you are seated and the service may seem a bit moony and often cold. I suggest getting an omelette when dining in with a side bagel if you're dying for a nice big breakfast because the other big breakfasts aren't really that appetizing. Not that the omelettes are supermodels, but they're pretty great.

Overall, it's a pretty good place. If you're visiting LV, it's far enough away from the strip that it makes it nice to get away from that snake-pit but close enough that you don't have to drive hours for a simple meal. Good luck finding a place to park as their lot sux and is surrounded by dentists.

One of the best places to go for breakfast. Food is yummy yummy.  It is a like a real New York diner.  My husband and I love it.  We always get the spinach feta omelet. Mmmmmmmm. I also love the honey wheat bagel with strawberry cream cheese. The staff is great and they get to know the regular customers, which is really nice.

I've visited 3 times now and not extremely happy with the level of customer service. My servers always seemed as though they are in a hurry to go some where. Usually behind the partition so they can chit chat with fellow workers. They do not try to up sell or explain the menu. Just uncanny that they are always in a hurry to get to the other side of the room. I haven't be able to figure that out yet. The condiments could be wiped free of finger prints and old dried ingredients. They do however stop by occasionally to make sure you're doing ok. My meal took exceptionally long this time and the restaurant was busy at all. All of about 10-12 customers. I ordered a patty melt, which was tasteless and had enough cheese to kill a senior citizen. Cole slaw, also no flavor, however my fries we good, not hot, but good. My server stopped by to check on things and left my bill. I immediately put my cc in the holder and waited for my server to come back. Finally she returned, took the bill and cc and dropped it off to the cashier. I watched the cashier complete the transaction and place my cc and receipts directly behind her on a ledge. There it sat, and I waited for my server...and waited...and waited...never to return, honestly. I went up to the cashier and told her that was my cc and receipts behind her, and thankfully she asked me for ID to make sure. I signed and left 20% gratuity for the "ghost server" anyway. So I think I will do take out next time. Maybe corned beef, or roasted turkey sandwich.

As I am from NYC area, finding a good deli/bagel is a hard thing to come by.
Bagel Cafe comes very close. The bagels are very good, they have the cookie bar that compares favorably to deli's back east, their Challa is excellent and makes fantastic french toast, and they have a vast variety of cream cheeses.

The dining area is a great place to enjoy some good Matzoh Ball soup, however, it is a very busy soup with noodles and carrots drowning out the small matzoh ball. (A good Matzoh Ball soup should have the Matzoh Ball on display in the middle of the soup.)

I was not impressed with the Corned Beef sandwich, nor did I think I would be having yet to find quality corned beef outside of NY or to a lesser extent, LA.
What was disappointing is the photo on the menu appeared to be piled high but the sandwich I received had a much more pedestrian helping of Corned Beef, most likely due to the rising cost of meat.   The rye bread was cut too thick and overpowered the sandwich but was a tasty bread in and of itself.

I do enjoy that they sell Dr. Brown's black cherry soda, Wise potato chips, and day old bagel chips and breads.  The deli meat counter however is often overpriced for the same boar's head meat you can get at the supermarket and the Lox prices are extremely high.  But go with a lox cream cheese which has large chunks of lox but is reasonably priced.

I figured since I learned I need to get my wisdom teeth pulled late this afternoon, I may as well get my grub on considering I will be food deprived for some time.  Best believe this afternoon I will be back for round two somewhere.  Although, known for their kosher offerings, I figured I could get some lox on one of the final weeks of lent Fridays.

So I opted for none other than...the waitresses recommendation on the best breakfast.  I believe the waitresses name is Nancy and was very sweet and sociable.  However, she did remind me of the sister of a co worker who is also very sweet, yet, a little broke down, not body odor conscious and has had a streak of bad luck.  Luckily, I try not to make a correlation with negativity, but it was hard not to notice the resemblance.  

Needless to say, Nancy recommended the crab cake benedict, and if y'all have read my previous reviews in the past, I have been known to have a soft place in my heart for benedict style breakfasts.  

The dish came out in a timely manner and commenced the destruction of the meal.  The dish came with two crab cake benedicts that were good portions, not too small, not gigantoid.  The dish was accompanied with a side of country style potatoes that were yummy as well.  This is the Friday before Good Friday and my no meat lent restrictions are nearly complete.  

The benedicts were filled with an above average crab cake, composed of real crab meat, how do I know you ask?  Well if you hit an occasional bit of shell, chances are the mofo is authentic.  The chunks were a generous size as well.  Holandaise sauce was good to go, not overwhelming or invisible, just right.  The price is the other indicator that the crab meat was real and not faux.  Priced at $14ish, the dish better have included real crab meat, right?!  Not quite as good as Maryland Crab Shack, which I still have a discount coupon for, but a close runner up.

Following the meal, my patnah and I notice that one of our "indirect" bosses showed up and my homie began to slide under the table.  I see nothing wrong with staying nutritionally adequate to perform our work duties and was tryna holla at him, yet with his stunnas on, it appeared that he was tryna keep it on the low pro.  

Anyhow, I later learned that you are not supposed to eat six hours prior to getting oral surgery, so if I choke on the crab cakes coming back out, nancy is my coworker reincarnated to punish me for my comments about her in this review.

What a welcome retreat just a quick drive from the craziness of the strip.  Desperate for anything not in a casino, I went twice this past week for breakfast and both times it was excellent.  Very busy spot with an excellent waitstaff that greets you warmly and gets the coffee flowing while you consider breakfast options.

The menu is pretty extensive with many great sounding options.  On my first visit I went with a corned beef hash omelette (which is not on the menu but they were able to whip it up for me) and even though I am always hesitant to order a bagel anywhere that is not Long Island, this place had me feeling good so I went for it - everything toasted with scallion cream cheese.  Excellent all around - everything fresh and prepared to order. 

Came back later in the week needing another escape from the glitter and noise.  This time I was heading to the Red Rock Conservation area for a hike and needed some fuel.  This is on the way if you are coming from the Vegas strip area, but I would have come even if it weren't.  This time I went veggie omelette and a salt bagel with cream cheese and bacon.  Once again, excellent all around - great food, great service and just an excellent overall experience. 

While Vegas is not on my favorites list, so glad I found a spot to get away when business calls me there.  

As someone who never thought you could get a great bagel off Long Island, Vegas is probably the last place on earth I would have expected to prove me wrong!

The Bagel Cafe is a dependable spot to eat great food in my neck of the woods, but I don't come here that often because, let's face it, I have no self control.  If they didn't  have a bakery, I'd probably be safe, but I just cannot resist!
So, a friend and I had breakfast this morning.  I thought I'd be healthy and ordered a veggie omelet with a whole wheat bagel.  Oh, it came with home fries, but I think potatoes are also a vegetable.  Anyway, that was delicious and very filling.  After paying our bill at the counter, my gal pal had to scoot, so she left me to "browse" the bakery area.  Well, browsing turned to buying, which turned into another instance of me facing my weakness for sugar. At least I had vegetables before the carbs were ingested.  See my pics for a couple of the pastries the cafe has to offer.  There's more to choose from, but you'll just have to go and see for yourself; I had to get out of there before I turned into a diabetic.

Sat down on a Saturday afternoon and the place was packed! 
Surprisingly we got seated very quick, had our drinks brought and also a delicious cream cheese with bagel chips to enjoy.
Waitress was very nice and polite, and my Reuben was superb! Half of it went to go since it was fairly big.

Big shoutout to the manager PABLO! Very polite and attentive, making sure we are enjoying our lunch, and brought my daughter crayola and drawing paper to keep her entertained .
Thank you very much Pablo for your attention, we had a great lunch! 

Overall great spot with great customer service ( no wonder why they're always busy) will be back again.

I have a newly restored opinion of the Bagel Cafe now. This is the BEST Jewish deli in Vegas so far. I have tried a few and this has the BEST food a d bakery items by far. All the breakfast and lunch options are great. Meats are of very good quality now.Weiss deli has better rye bread. I think when Canters opens up down the street in Tivoli Village , they will have some serious competition though. Canters is a legendary great place for food. Bagel Cafe is also awesome !!

I am from NYC, very nice decor in the inside reminds me of home with the deli and dessert counter . Everything bagel is missing the salt that's the only critique. Otherwise their bagels is the closest you can get for a chewy NYC bagel anywhere else in Vegas.

Never a huge fan of Bagel Cafe, but it has been the only traditional Jewish Style deli in the Summerlin area. They must know that formidable competition is opening soon and yet, when my  corned beef sandwich came with a twist tie in the coleslaw, their reaction was..."Oh, sorry, the bread is stored above the prep area so it can happen."
We didn't make a fuss with staff at the time, except to say they probably shouldn't have changed extra for the coleslaw, but I wrote to owners and have received no response. Apparently, they do not care about making a customer comfortable that the situation was taken seriously and remediated or extending any compensation at all for the unpleasant experience of chewing down on a twist tie in your sandwich!

Nothing special about this place.  Bagelmania is much better.  Had the 1/4lb corned beef.  Beef was not well spiced,  bread was soggy.  Cole slaw was boring,  needed some seasoning. . Pickle was Decent. . Guys had bagels and cream cheese. . Nothing really great. . Won't be back

Went there this morning...hadn't been in a while and ordered lox and bagel platter on whole wheat.  When I got to work nd opened sandwich..this is what I had for 12.95 ( + 1.00 for nova cream cheese which I requested).  For $14.01 I was thoroughly disappointed.  I called back and asked what the small fish platter consisted of..
Lettuce, onions, tomatoes pickles and capers which I did not receive.
Thoroughly disappointed with my $14 breakfast.  
P.S. cashiers did not look or greet me when giving order

The Bagel Cafe is a fantastic place for breakfast and lunch. The food is always fresh and delicious. The servers are attentive and friendly as they make their way around the huge dining room. Be careful though when you go to the front to pay, if you wander over to the Deli, you're liable to double or triple your bill :)

We had heard amazing things about The Bagel Cafe, and a couple weeks ago when we were looking for a taste of home we decided to give it a try.  Over all it was a positive experience, but there were some things that caused me to shake my head a bit.
The positives:
- The bagels were delicious and just like back east! 
- Our server was very friendly and attentive
- Their deli counter was very impressive, and provided a lot of to-go options
- Their portion size was very generous and we ended up taking a good bit of our fish platter home
- They started us off with some bagel chips and pineapple/coconut cream cheese which was excellent

The Negatives:
- They were very rigid as far as the menu went.  The waiter had to check and make sure they could do certain things.  This sometimes is a red flag.  I am the customer, charge me more if you have to, but give me what I want!
- We got a slice of banana cream cake and a frosted cookie (free with a yelp check-in).  The cake was just ok, and the cookie was almost tasteless 

Overall, I would definitely return to Bagel Cafe (especially to pick up a dozen), but I there are other places in town to to better get that taste of home!

We have frequented the Bagel Cafe for years. We lived down the street for 10 years and ate here almost every sunday. When we bought our home 20 min away....the fact that we weren't going to be near the cafe was part of the discussion about if we would move or not. We've never had dinner, but breakfast and lunch are a staple. Amazing bagels, and the biggest French toast in town. We love it and you will too.

Glad to have this wonderful deli in my neighborhood.  Not only great bagels but delicious pastries and meats.  The menu specials are always super and the early bird specials are one of the best bargains in town.  Can get noisy when crowded so I often opt of odd hours when the place is much quieter.  The soup and salad special, smoked fish, matza ball soup, breakfast egg dishes and various cream cheese and bagel options keep me coming back for more.  Don't confuse The Bagel Cafe at the Suncoast with the quality of food and service at the one on Buffalo.

Seriously I can't even explain how great everything was. The bagels to no surprise are incredible. I went went Sunday afternoon after the rush had died down with a friend. I had the Greek salad with chicken it was huge! With a sun dried tomato and cream cheese. She had a soup. Didn't try it but it looked Yums. Got a Rueben with turkey. Everyone was really friendly and helpful. I am super excited to go back!!!

This place is really excellent for breakfast.  The menu is cute and creative and they have many options to chose from.  They provide a variety of bagels alwith all types of schmears to choose from.  Their meals portions are huge and one omelet can easily feed two people.  This is just down the road from me and I will definitely be back.

The bagel cafe was an amazing find! Recently relocated to Vegas from NJ and these are really just as awesome as a New York Bagel! They are definitely a little pricey, but if you want an authentic taste of NYC this is it! High quality, fresh delicious bagels! In addition to great bagels, this place also sells 'wise' potato chips.. Love having a taste of home!! Highly recommend!

The food was mediocre, however the manager and counterman were extremely rude. We ate dinner and wanted to buy a chicken soup to go. We ordered it from the counterman and as I don't like vegetables I asked him if he could do his best to not get too many in my order. He rudely told me he could not do that. We said that our waitress had done a great job of that. The manager than rudely ran over yelling that the waitress could be fired for that and we should never ask again. I did not realize what a crime it was to ask them to go light on the veggies. Then when we were paying the bill (the manager is also the cashier) he told me that this was the owners wishes. I said the owner was an idiot for not trying to please his customers and the battle escalated from that. There are many restaurants competing for my $ in vegas, there is no need to go where you are treated rudely.

LOVE IT HERE!!! awesome service!! Pastrami sandwich is so good!!  Better than Katz in New York!! Bagels are amazing!! And the scallion cream cheese is so good!! Also the baked goods are to die for!! Love the rainbow cookies!! Also the pecan tools are so good and the palmier.. I could go on and on!! Amazing!!!

This is a go to restaurant for every New Yorker that wants to feel like they're in a New York Deli. The New York knishes, deep-fried, are really good. The kishka with brown gravy is delicious as well. The quality of the pastrami is no better than a packaged pastrami. They give you plenty of it though. When I ordered the pastrami on rye, I need to have it shaved super thin to not be tough. The chicken soup is too greasy for my taste. Coffee's good and they have Dr browns.
Best bagels and home made corned beef hash! Great BIG salads, yummy treats, all in one place!

Easily the best bagels in Las Vegas. They aren't NY bagels, but nothing is. The counter (to-go) staff is quick and efficient. There's never much of a wait. 

The sit down area is hit and miss from what I can tell. The waitresses are all nice, but not ways fast. 

Lastly, if you're ever feeling old go here on a Sunday before 9am and you'll feel young again. It seems as if the minimum age is 80.

Me and my son went there because i have been hearing so many good things about it, well we both ordered country fried steak, neither one of us liked it, tasted horrible so we left 2 full plates of food, waiter didnt even ask if there was a problem, any other business would have, so we just wont go back If he would have haf any concern i might, just might give it another try but no thanks


SAVAAS, i am trying to repond to you but i dont see anywhere after your comment so hope u see this, it was 05/042018 my son closed on his first home so we went there right after, i wanna say around 1230 -100pm and i dont remember the guys name who served us but i do remember what he looks lime if i saw him, anyways we like to try new things out but was just disappointed all the way around with no concern, thats what bothered me!
One of the best places to eat in vegas! Food is amazing and the portions are very generous.

I love this place. Nothing is more effective than the lox and bagels here for making me nostalgic about my childhood. The food, the service, the unlimited coffee refills, the 14 bagel baker's dozen...I could go on...basically, this place is popular and that popularity stems from being great at everything they do!

Hey Bagel lovers!!!

I've been missing New York bagels and been on a quest to find my go to bagel shop! After a quick search on yelp and all the awesome reviews... I found BC.

Came here for breakfast recently with a gf of mines. We dined in and ordered the chocolate chip with strawberry cream cheese and egg bagel with strawberry cream cheese. We also decided to try out the potato pancake since it was a popular menu item on yelp reviews.

Food was ok. Service could have been way better. Our waitress forgot about us throughout our meal. lame! On the positive side, there was no wait to be seated! and the guy behind the counter gave me his honest option and told me the blueberry bagel batch wasn't looking good that morning. 

Would I come back? Probably not. Unless I'm driving by and craving a bagel, BC wouldn't be my ideal spot for breakfast.

Love the cool newspaper menu and all of the yummy carby treats in the glass window.

If you love big bagels and live in the area, stop by BC.

- Miss Yelp 2011

Recently moved to this area, so I finally decided to try this place. I just needed some breakfast so I ordered eggs, bacon, fruit cup, and a bagel. Add cup of coffee, $13.25. Bacon was small, only 2 strips, eggs were small. Fruit cup was tiny...maybe 6 pieces. The bagel was ok. Not worth the $$ and probably won't return since there are so many other better choices.

The best deli sandwiches and desserts in this side of town!!!  Love their matzah ball soup too!!! The Roast beef and raw onions on a pumpernickel bread with deli mustard is my favorite!  My Dads is the pastrami on rye with deli mustard! Great desserts, fav' chocolate croissant and yin yang cookie! Definitely go when friends or Family are in town!  Wish they were open later and Sundays.

Let me start by saying I love this place! Why 2 stars? Because the people who answer the phone are as dumb as dumb and rude as rude can be! It cost you you a catering order today! Wasn't just one it was 2 different people 2 separate calls!

I had heard of the bagel cafe from my wife's sister when she came and helped us move. She had said she definitely recommended it. So since it was my mother's birthday and my wife and I wanted to take her out for a morning breakfast we decided to try the bagel cafe.

When we arrived we definitely noticed that the parking spots were for compact vehicles, since there was someone who didn't get that message and had their 1 ton truck taking up 2 parking spots. After finding a parking spot we walked in and were quickly greeted and found a spot to sit. It was my first time to this location so I was not sure if this was like a sandwich shop a pastry shop or a restaurant, well apparently it's all in ONE which is quite awesome I love one stop shops. 

After being seated we sat and waited at the table for menus. The bus boy came and asked if we wanted drinks. We ordered 1 coffee and 2 waters and again we waited. The waitress came with a pen and pad and asked us if we were ready to order. We all said we were waiting for the menus. She quickly apologized and informed us that the menus were located at the end of the table and was newspaper like menus. 

We looked through the menu which seemed a bit long for a breakfast/lunch establishment I believe that even in the last pages there were dinner plates which confused me a bit as there not open past 5. 

We ordered a cup of Matzo Ball soup, a biscuits and gravy plate, a corn beef hash and egg plate and one fresh veggie omelet. The matzo ball soup came with one ignoramus matzo ball and it was piled high with vegetables and chicken. My mom being the very whitey person that she is quickly reminded me how she had made me a similar soup when I was a kid and how I complained to her that what she served me was clearly not matzo ball soup and it was chicken noodle soup with a matzo ball in it LOL! Well that's exactly what I got here. My mom is a sous-chef at petrossian bar at the Bellagio and she drilled me at how matzo ball soup can be made in many different ways. Well I don't prefer this kind all though it was hearty and the matzo ball was delightful. I still prefer a matzo ball soup with just matzo ball not with chicken and vegetables. The portions reminded me allot of hash house a go go. The portions were rather big and hearty. The biscuits were soft and the gravy was very exquisite a change from hash house because there biscuits seemed to be a bit hard and these were really soft and awesome when paired with the gravy. The veggie omelet was a veggie omelet nothing spectacular. The corn beef hash was tasty especially coming from me because I'm not a corn beef fan and this one was defiantly cooked correctly and seasoned just right.

I think the customer service was sub-par. I could tell that the waitress was definitely trying to be nice and helpful however I felt at times I was forgotten we only had 1 water refilled and my mother's coffee was never refilled or even offered to be refilled. We might possibly try them again.

My wife who has been here several times for breakfast wanted to take me here for lunch because she noticed the tongue sandwich on the menu a real favorite of mine. We showed up around noon time on a Friday afternoon and the place was packed but were seated within ten minutes. My wife ordered a Reuben and I ordered the tongue tip. Our waitress returned a bit later to tell me they were out of tongue tip and regular tongue. I asked if this was normal and she couldn't really say. I settled on a philly cheese steak. All I can say is both sandwiches were a disappointment. Small servings and the philly might have just been two pieces of bread and a sprinkling of meat. Onions, peppers, cheese?  To beat it all on our way out we saw a sign on the door that said this is a place of peace no firearms. When will people learn that criminals don't read or care about signs. My wife and I were both armed and managed to get through our sub par meal without disturbing anyone. Armed citizens are a deterrent to crime and not a danger. If you want to prevent lawful CCW post your sign better. As per the law. I guess I'll never get to find out about that tongue sandwich now. Bummer!

You will not find a better bagel shop outside of New York than this one. And if you're a fan of sweets, get ready for a ride. They do nothing in moderation. You'll get a half pound of creme cheese on your bagel, and if you dare to order from the bakery you better have a friend to help you eat whatever you order. The apple turnovers are bigger than an iPad. This place is a legit jewish deli and they take it seriously. 

The only other thing to note is that this place is so good its also very very busy. I hardly ever try to eat in the restaurant unless I can get there at the crack of dawn. Better to grab a bagel from the deli and go sit in the park. Parking is tight so avoid coming in a giant vehicle.
What's not to like about matzoh ball soup or chicken soup? Both are recommended for the soul and for cool afternoons. Always a stomach warming experience.

A long long time ago. In a city far away, I moved to Vegas and ate a bagel. 

It was a 5 year experience that I'm glad that I had. Among many of the places I patronized while I lived there was the Bagel Cafe. 
I stumbled across it with the help of a friend. Okay, we were driving by and saw it. The rest is history. 
Fast forward 256 years into the future (sometimes it feels like that) and my wife and I are in Vegas for a whirlwind conference. Unfortunately, like most times, we didn't have time to do much. But, we were leaving sin city on a Friday morning and my wife wanted to stop one of the places I used to haunt. 
I forgot the name! :(  Quickly, I grabbed my phone and Googled Bagel Summerlin. The name and address came up and voila, it was JUST as I remembered. Deli in the front and seating in the back.

The first thing you notice is the place is clean. 
The second thing you notice is the staff is friendly. 
My wife ordered a full pastrami sandwich on marble rye.
I ordered a tongue sandwich on traditional rye. 
I asked the waiter if the tongue was fresh and he said yes. 
In about 10 minutes, the sandwiches were delivered.
My mouth is watering thinking about it now, several days later!
The pastrami was very good. Almost as good as a place I know in the Valley. The tongue was exceptional. Good taste, tender, and soft. 
The sandwich was almost too big for my mouth. It was delicious!
The only thing I didn't care for was the rye. Yes, they make their own rye, but it was too soft and squishy. I like a rye with a descent crust and a heavier rye flavor. But, that's me. The rye, as a bread goes, still was very fresh.
My sandwich was GONE is short order. My wife took 1/2 her sandwich to eat 7 hours later on the drive home.

----------------
Bottom Line

The Bagel Cafe is good. I take that back, it's GREAT!
The best time to go is during the week. Weekends were way TOO busy from my recollection, but should that stop you? No! Go anyway. A crowded deli is part of the New York experience!

Yes, I will go back when I'm in Vegas again!!!
When are you guys opening one in Reno??

Didn't eat in the café, but got some baked goods to go.   Growing up on the East Coast, I really miss the good bakeries.  We stumbled upon this place after a search for black and white cookies.   After looking at the photos, we had to stop by and get some.    On the first trip there, I got a black and white cookie and a few macaroons.   The macaroons were awesome.   The black and white cookies were pretty good.   It was definitely enough to warrant another trip.  
The second trip, we got some more black and white cookies to take home along with some raspberry linzer tarts and a raspberry rugalah.   Yummy!   They were all really good.   
If you are from the East Coast, or just like good baked goods,  give this place a try.  
Will I be back?  Sure, I have to try some of the other items they have there!

Awesome!  For a cafe, the quality and portion size is great.  There were 3 of us that came to eat for the first time and we all agreed to come back again, soon!

They use fresh deli meat for their sandwiches.  I had the Roast beef, my fiancée had the pastrami, and my friend ordered the corn beef.  All was delicious.  

The service was decent, pretty much what you would expect from a cafe.   

Their bakery is also pretty great.  It's only our first time, so we didn't buy a lot from the bakery.  But we did buy a few desserts (tiramisu, carrot cake, cheesecake cupcake & cannoli).  We will be back for more!
Yup yup! Awesome place. Hot Tongue on rye and a side of chopped chkn liver is my fav!  I love this place!

I just had my introduction here for lunch today, and came away satiated and very impressed.   The list of available food choices in the newspaper menu is ginormous, and includes everything from breakfast omelets to a myriad of combinations of meat sandwiches , and even three types of pickles: a sliced whole Kosher Dill, bright green New Pickle spears, and pickle chips.  Step over from the dining room to the glass display cases near the entrance, and, in addition to several varieties of cream cheeses, a large array of pastry delicacies beckon, ranging from Seven-Layer Chocolate Cake to the largest Black and White Cookies I have to date seen.

Although I enjoy eating Nova Lox on a cream-cheesed bagel about once a week, when I go to a deli I am generally looking for a heaping meat-filled deli sandwich on rye.  So, foolishly I suppose, for years I was put off by the "Bagel" in the restaurant's title.  Now that I know better, I expect to get my deli fix here on about a bimonthly basis.  Although I found the Matzoh Ball Soup and corned beef to be on the same par as found at Carnegie Deli at The Mirage, here I will not have to pay an exorbitant valet parking fee for the pleasure of dining on the Strip, and I can get my mouth around the 1/4 pound sandwich halves--albeit barely so.  

My cup of Matzoh Ball Soup was excellent, except it could have used a bit more salt.  The Kosher Dill spears were right on, and the New Pickle spears barely ripe, as is normally the case.  The corned beef in my Corned Beef on Seeded Rye was moist and lean, just as I hoped, and the bread was also first rate.  Potato Salad and Cole Slaw were both creamy and delicious, and the French Fries of a superior grade.  Accompanying bagels were oversize and  noticeably fresh, and although my party of four hardly needed them, an assortment of bagel chips served with a pile of gray cream cheese were tasty as well.  I dressed up my sandwich with mild yellow mustard--although spicy mustard is also available--and luscious chopped liver.  By ordering an appetizer plate of Chopped Liver I could mete out what I wanted to smear on the rye with a table knife, and thus avoid a 1/2 & 1/2 deli sandwich combo, in which case I would be downing a quarter-pound of the artery-clogging organ meat.

It was a great tummy-filling lunch!  And my seat mates were equally pleased with their selections: a Tuna Salad Melt on Marble Rye, a Combo Corned Beef And Pastrami on Rye, and a Roast Beef French Dip with hot au jus and French Fries.
I have been going to the bagel cafe for years. I love the shrimp salad sandwich. They have this display of desserts. Cookies, cake, amazing pasties. They give you large portions.

The prices seem high at first and then you get your plate. HOLY MOLY the portions are huge! I got the fruit parfait and thought "$10 is a lot for a parfait." It was the biggest parfait I have ever seen in my life. I could t finish it! My in laws loved their food and can't wait to go back. I guess there is a reason why this place is a Las Vegas staple.  I'm looking forward to trying more on the menu. Downsides are that the parking lot isn't very big and that it can be a little noisy inside the restaurant. But we will definitely be going back.

Came in and got some bagels, which are actually not good the second day, unless you freeze them. So, if you want more than a few, you need a big freezer, but they will get freezer burn after a few days anyway.So, it is not worth my time. If you don't eat  it right there and then, it is a rock. The owner's attitude is tangible and avoid it at all costs, if you want to be able to eat. I have been a restaurant manager for well over 20 years, and I know when something is wrong. This place gives me the creeps, now.

The bagels and cinnamon rolls here deserve five stars.

After a morning hike some friends and I arrived at The Bagel Cafe for breakfast. It wasn't super busy yet and we were able to get a table right away. Noted! By the time we left, the place was packed and there was a wait.

I do want to start by saying that all the issues that came up were remedied best they could be, but I still left slightly disappointed. I ordered the egg white omelet and my plate had a hair in the food. This seems to be a trend for me lately when I dine with this group of friends. Also noted! The server took my plate away, was very apologetic, and brought me a new dish as fast as the kitchen could push it out. My replacement omelet was overdone and my bagel was burnt.

Thankfully the cinnamon rolls there saved the day and I will gladly pop in to order all the pastries and bagels to go.

Such a cool place. It's super easy to just order take out! Staff is friendly and the take out orders are always quick! I am extremely simple and I love the blueberry bagels with strawberry cream cheese. And it's delicious! They never disappoint whenever I stop in!

Moving to Las Vegas from NY, I have been in search of a "good" bagel and The Bagel Cafe makes a GREAT bagel! 

It has been everything I was missing in the way of a bagel shop but more with the sit down restaurant and pastries. I would recommend an everything bagel with cream cheese or pick up a variety to take home. 

I can't say much more besides go try it!  I've ran into some celebrities while I have been there and I've loved standing next to them when ordering my bagels because they are just normal people enjoying the same thing.

Ordered a corned beef and pastrami sandwich and fries which tasted just ok. Got home and later that night started feeling nauseous. Ended up having to throw up several times. I had food poisoning from my meal. Brought it to the attention of the manager and owner and he couldn't care less.  Poo-pooed the whole thing (no pun intended). Will never eat here again.

I love the bakery here, although service can be bad, only because they don't really have a good system to order. If you stand in line, and someone else happens to catch the attention of the worker, they'll cut you off and next thing you know, you're the sucker standing in line for 10 min without anyone helping you. Prices are expensive, but whatevs. Not like I come here often enough.

So I've come here quite a few times since my discovery. That says a lot considering I live in the SW so making this drive is a huge effort on my end. From what I understand is this place has been around for quite awhile. 
I've been searching for a good bagel place since I got here and I'm so glad I can finally abandon that mission. This place gets packed on the weekends but for good reason. Expect at least a 20 min wait after 10am. 
They have at least a dozen style bagels fresh and ready at any given time with a healthy selection of shmears. On top of that, lox, cod and more. And on top of THAT(yes, there's more), is a sweets display. Chinese almond cookies, tiramisu, cinnamon rolls, cakes, so on and so forth. This doesn't include the restaurant which has excellent fresh squeezed oj, pancakes, sandwiches, chicken fried steak, omelettes and a plethora of other dishes. Do I really need to say more? Prices are great. Breakfast never exceeds $40 for two with plenty to take home. Service is fast and friendly. Only thing that sucks is parking is cramped. Literally, every spot is compact car size parking so if you have an SUV, prepare for a tight squeeze.

The Bagel Cafe has to be one of the best breakfast (and lunch) spots in Vegas. It has character, they make their customers feel like family and the food is amazing. One of the things I feel like many Las Vegans complain about is the lack of these types of family owned restaurants. Since this is right by my house, I eat there almost 2-3 times per month.

It is perfect for takeout or sit-in, they also have a huge selections of desserts, which are perfect if you just want a little something to crave your sweet tooth or you are looking for a full on cake to bring to a party.

For breakfast I am hooked on the veggie omelet, with sliced tomatoes and an everything bagel. (The lite scallion cream cheese is my weakness!) 

They actually have good strong house coffee too!

For lunch their fresh tuna and egg salad sandwiches are so good and HUGE!

One of things that continues to draw me into this place is that unlike most breakfast places you don't feel like you are consuming a thousand calories! Their food tastes fresh and healthy! Of course if you get Biscuits and Gravy or something like that you are probably looking at a boat load of calories/fat, but overall I don't feel like they cover their food in butter or grease.
The bagels and food are fantastic but the service was pretty rude. The girl at the checkout register clearly did not want to be there today
The bagel cafe is one of our favorites!  Everyone is friendly, the food is fantastic, and the service is great. We especially love Anna, as she is attentive and incredibly sweet.

I really, really enjoy this place. I can't honestly say that I'm the biggest deli person, but I do love their food. I'm not a big fan of cured meats, so I tend to shy away from the sandwiches. I usually order the french toast or matzo ball soup (minus the noodles). 

Everything here is pretty good. I love me some bagels and this place has a plethora to choose from. Every flavor you can imagine.

The desserts look really good, and if the meal portions weren't so plentiful I'd actually be able to consume one after my meal... lol.

Definitely a safe "go to" restaurant.

Best bagels ever.  I ordered the lox and requested that they toast my bagel really well. I got exactly what I asked for. They had fresh coffee, and the ambiance was great.  Loved the photos they had on their overhead TV. Showed lots of platters, and so many different pastries. 

The service was also great. When I visit Vegas again, I will definitely make an attempt to visit them again!

Crab eggs benedict? 
Yes, please!

I came here for bagels on a Saturday morning and after further studying the menu, I knew I had to return.  And I did. Less than 24 hours later.  We dined in both times. I shared the fish platter (belly lox) with my mom and it was fantastic. The bagels were delicious and the serving of cream cheese is enough to serve 3.  The following day, I returned with the whole family in tow, and tried the Crab eggs benedict.  It was delicious, but the ONLY downfall was that the poached egg was overcooked.  I asked the waitress about it, and she said that is how they normally do it, and next time to specify that I want the runny egg-yolk goodness instead.  The crab cakes were crabulicious and I can just imagine how much more amazing they will be with my yolk of choice.  

My husband and mom both ordered "Overstuffed Meat Sandwiches" (pastrami and brisket) and our mouths watered as the tower of meat was served.  They both ordered whole sandwiches and had enough to take home for an afternoon snack.  

The service was quick and very friendly. It is quite the happenin' place (especially around brunch time on the weekends) so I recommend calling in advance to put your name on the list if their is a long wait.  Although if there is a wait, there is a take-out area with displays of bagels and cream cheese, meats, smoked fish, and pastries galore to wet your appetite.
New to the area & this is close. The food selections were plenty & the potato pancakes were excellent. Good service even though they were busy things were great. I will be back.

It good. Good quality. Tasty. They try hard, but it's still not real NY DELI, but it's the best I can find in Vegas

Pastry's are wonderful,  holiday meals are helpful, typical NY attitude from the help...
